verses.latin: Adam, Seth, Enos,
verses.english: Adam, Seth, Enos,

verses.latin: Cainan, Malaleel, Jared,
verses.english: Cainan, Mahalalel, Jared,

verses.latin: Henoch, Mathusala, Lamech,
verses.english: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

verses.latin: Noe, Sem, Cham, et Japheth.
verses.english: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

verses.latin: Filii Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Thubal, Mosoch, Thiras.
verses.english: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

verses.latin: Filii autem Gomer: Ascanaz, et Riphath, et Thogorma.
verses.english: And the sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

verses.latin: Filii vero Javan: Elisa, et Tharsis, Cetthim, et Dodanim.
verses.english: And the sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

verses.latin: Filii Cham: Chus, et Mesraim, et Phuth, et Chanaan.
verses.english: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

verses.latin: Filii autem Chus: Saba, et Hevila, Sabatha, et Regma, et Sabatacha. Filii Regma: Saba, et Dadan.
verses.english: And the sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

verses.latin: Porro Chus genuit Nemrod: hic cœpit esse potens in terra.
verses.english: Furthermore, Cush was the father of Nimrod; he was the first to become a mighty one on earth.

verses.latin: Mesraim vero genuit Ludim, et Anamim, et Laabim, et Nephthuim,
verses.english: Mizraim was the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

verses.latin: Phthrusim quoque, et Casluhim, de quibus egressi sunt Philisthiim, et Caphthorim.
verses.english: and Pathrusim, and Casluhim—from whom the Philistines came—and Caphtorim.

verses.latin: Chanaan vero genuit Sidonem primogenitum suum, et Heth,
verses.english: And Canaan was the father of Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth,

verses.latin: et Jebusæum, et Amorrhæum, et Gergesæum,
verses.english: and the Jebusites, and the Amorites, and the Girgashites,

verses.latin: et Hevæum, et Aracæum, et Sinæum,
verses.english: and the Hivites, and the Arkites, and the Sinites,

verses.latin: et Aradium, et Samaræum, et Hamathæum.
verses.english: and the Arvadites, and the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.

verses.latin: Filii Sem: Ælam, et Assur, et Arphaxad, et Lud, et Aram, et Hus, et Hul, et Gether, et Mosoch.
verses.english: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

verses.latin: Arphaxad autem genuit Sale, et Sale genuit Heber.
verses.english: And Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.

verses.latin: Porro Heber nati sunt duo filii: nomen uni Phaleg, quia in diebus ejus divisa est terra; et nomen fratris ejus Jectan.
verses.english: Furthermore, two sons were born to Eber: one was named Peleg—because in his days the earth was divided—and his brother's name was Joktan.

verses.latin: Jectan vero genuit Elmodad, et Saleph, et Asarmoth, et Jare,
verses.english: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

verses.latin: et Adoram, et Uzal, et Decla,
verses.english: and Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,

verses.latin: Ebal quoque, et Abimaël, et Saba,
verses.english: and Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

verses.latin: necnon et Ophir, et Hevila, et Jobab. Omnes isti, filii Jectan.
verses.english: as well as Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

verses.latin: Sem, Arphaxad, Sale,
verses.english: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

verses.latin: Heber, Phaleg, Ragau,
verses.english: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

verses.latin: Sarug, Nahor, Thare,
verses.english: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

verses.latin: Abram, iste est Abraham.
verses.english: Abram, who is Abraham.

verses.latin: Filii autem Abraham: Isaac et Ismaël.
verses.english: And the sons of Abraham were Isaac and Ishmael.

verses.latin: Et hæ generationes eorum. Primogenitus Ismaël, Nabaioth, et Cedar, et Adbeel, et Mabsam,
verses.english: And these were their generations: Ishmael's firstborn was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, and Mibsam,

verses.latin: et Masma, et Duma, Massa, Hadad, et Thema,
verses.english: and Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

verses.latin: Jetur, Naphis, Cehma. Hi sunt filii Ismaël.
verses.english: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.

verses.latin: Filii autem Ceturae concubinæ Abraham, quos genuit: Zamran, et Jecsan, et Madan, et Madian, et Isbac, et Sue. Filii quoque Jecsan: Saba, et Dadan.
verses.english: And the sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine, whom she bore to him, were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan were Sheba and Dedan.

verses.latin: Filii autem Madian: Epha, et Epher, et Henoch, et Abida, et Eldaa. Omnes hi, filii Ceturae.
verses.english: And the sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abidah, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.

verses.latin: Genuit autem Abraham Isaac: cujus fuerunt filii, Esau et Israël.
verses.english: Abraham was the father of Isaac. And Isaac's sons were Esau and Israel.

verses.latin: Filii Esau: Eliphaz, Rahuel, Jehus, Ihelom, Core.
verses.english: The sons of Esau were Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.

verses.latin: Filii Eliphaz: Theman, Omar, Cephi, Gathan, Cenez, Thamna, Amalec.
verses.english: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.

verses.latin: Filii Rahuel: Nahath, Zara, Samma, Meza.
verses.english: The sons of Reuel were Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

verses.latin: Filii Seir: Lotan, Sobal, Sebeon, Ana, Dison, Eser, Disan.
verses.english: The sons of Seir were Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.

verses.latin: Filii Lotan: Hori, Homam. Soror Lotan, Thamna.
verses.english: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Homam. Lotan's sister was Timna.

verses.latin: Filii Sobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Sephi, Onam. Filii Sebeon: Aia, Ana.
verses.english: The sons of Shobal were Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon were Aiah and Anah.

verses.latin: ISTI sunt filii Israel: Ruben, Simeon, Levi, Juda, Issachar, Zabulon,
verses.english: These are the sons of Israel—who was also known as Jacob: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

verses.latin: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Nephthali, Gad, Aser.
verses.english: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

verses.latin: Filii Juda: Her, et Onan, et Sela: tres nati sunt ei de filia Sue Chananitidis. Fuit autem Her, primogenitus Juda, nequam coram Domino, et occidit eum.
verses.english: The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him from the daughter of Shua, a Canaanite woman. Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the Lord, and the Lord brought about his death.

verses.latin: Thamar autem nurus ejus peperit ei Phares et Zara. Omnes ergo filii Juda, quinque.
verses.english: Moreover, his daughter-in-law Tamar bore him Perez and Zerah. Thus, Judah had a total of five sons.

verses.latin: Filii Phares: Hesron et Hamul.
verses.english: The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

verses.latin: Filii vero Zara: Zamri, et Ethan, et Eman, Chalchol quoque, et Dara: simul quinque.
verses.english: The sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—a total of five sons.

verses.latin: Filii Charmi: Achar, qui turbavit Israel, et peccavit in anathemate.
verses.english: The son of Carmi was Achar, who brought trouble upon Israel by sinning against the things devoted to destruction by God's ban.

verses.latin: Filii Ethan: Azarias.
verses.english: The son of Ethan was Azariah.

verses.latin: Filii Hesron, qui nati sunt ei: Jerameel, et Ram, et Calubi.
verses.english: The sons of Hezron who were born to him were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb.

verses.latin: Porro Ram genuit Aminadab. Aminadab autem genuit Naasson, principem filiorum Juda.
verses.english: Furthermore, Ram fathered Amminadab. Amminadab in turn fathered Nahshon, who was a prince among the sons of Judah.

verses.latin: Naasson vero genuit Salma. Salma genuit Booz.
verses.english: Nahshon fathered Salma, and Salma fathered Boaz.

verses.latin: Booz quoque genuit Obed. Obed genuit Isai.
verses.english: Boaz also fathered Obed, and Obed fathered Jesse.

verses.latin: Isai autem genuit primogenitum Eliab, secundum Abinadab, tertium Simmaa,
verses.english: Jesse fathered his firstborn, Eliab; his second son, Abinadab; and his third son, Shimea.

verses.latin: quartum Nathanael, quintum Raddai,
verses.english: His fourth son was Nethanel, and his fifth was Raddai.

verses.latin: sextum Asom, septimum David.
verses.english: His sixth son was Ozem, and his seventh was David.

verses.latin: Quorum sorores fuerunt Sarvia et Abigail. Filii Sarvia: Abisai, Joab, et Asael, tres.
verses.english: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel—three men.

verses.latin: Abigail vero peperit Amasa: cujus pater Jether Ismahelites.
verses.english: Abigail bore Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.

verses.latin: Caleb vero filius Hesron accepit uxorem Azubah, quæ peperit ei Jerioth: fueruntque filii ejus, Jaser, et Sobab, et Ardon.
verses.english: Caleb, the son of Hezron, took a wife named Azubah, who bore him Jerioth. Azubah's sons by Caleb were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

verses.latin: Cumque mortua esset Azubah, accepit uxorem Caleb Ephrath: quæ peperit ei Hur.
verses.english: After Azubah died, Caleb took another wife named Ephrath, who bore him Hur.

verses.latin: Porro Hur genuit Uri: et Uri genuit Beseleel.
verses.english: Furthermore, Hur fathered Uri, and Uri fathered Bezalel.

verses.latin: Post hæc ingressus est Hesron ad filiam Machir patris Galaad, et accepit eam cum esset annorum sexaginta: quæ peperit ei Segub.
verses.english: After these events, Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead, and took her as his wife when he was sixty years old. She bore him Segub.

verses.latin: Sed et Segub genuit Jair, qui habuit viginti tres civitates in terra Galaad.
verses.english: Segub also fathered Jair, who possessed twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

verses.latin: Et cepit Gessur, et Aram oppida Jair, et Canath, et viculos ejus sexaginta civitates: omnes isti filii Machir patris Galaad.
verses.english: Jair captured Geshur and Aram, as well as the towns bearing Jair's name, and Kenath with its sixty villages. All these men were descendants of Machir, the father of Gilead.

verses.latin: Post mortem vero Hesron in Caleb Ephratha, peperit ei Abia uxor ejus Ashur patrem Thecue.
verses.english: After Hezron died in Caleb-Ephrathah, his wife Abiah bore him Ashur, the father of Tekoa.

verses.latin: Nati sunt autem filii Jerameel primogeniti Hesron: Ram primogenitus, et Buna, et Aran, et Asom, et Ahia.
verses.english: The sons born to Jerahmeel, Hezron's firstborn son, were Ram—who was Jerahmeel's firstborn—then Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.

verses.latin: Duxit quoque Jerameel uxorem alteram, nomine Atara, quæ fuit mater Onam.
verses.english: Jerahmeel also took another wife, named Atarah, who was the mother of Onam.

verses.latin: Porro filii Ram primogeniti Jerameel: Moos, Jamin, et Achar.
verses.english: Furthermore, the sons of Ram, Jerahmeel's firstborn, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

verses.latin: Filii autem Onam erant Sammai, et Jada. Filii Sammai: Nadab et Abisur.
verses.english: The sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.

verses.latin: Nomen vero uxoris Abisur, Abihail, quæ peperit ei Ahobban, et Molid.
verses.english: The name of Abishur's wife was Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.

verses.latin: Filii autem Nadab: Saled et Appaim. Et mortuus est Saled absque liberis.
verses.english: The sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim. Seled died without having any children.

verses.latin: Filii vero Appaim: Isei. Filii autem Isei: Sesan. Filii Sesan: Oholai.
verses.english: The son of Appaim was Ishi. The son of Ishi was Sheshan. The son of Sheshan was Ahlai.

verses.latin: Filii autem Jada fratris Sammai: Jether et Jonathan. Et mortuus est Jether absque liberis.
verses.english: The sons of Jada, Shammai's brother, were Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without having any children.

verses.latin: Porro filii Jonathan: Phaleth et Ziza. Isti sunt filii Jerameel.
verses.english: Furthermore, the sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Ziza. These are the sons of Jerahmeel.

verses.latin: Sesan vero non habuit filios, sed filias: et servum ægyptium habebat nomine Jeraa.
verses.english: Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. He also had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.

verses.latin: Deditque ei filiam suam uxorem: quæ peperit ei Ethei.
verses.english: So Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha as his wife, and she bore him Attai.

verses.latin: Porro Ethei genuit Nathan: et Nathan genuit Zabad.
verses.english: Furthermore, Attai fathered Nathan, and Nathan fathered Zabad.

verses.latin: Zabad quoque genuit Ophlal: et Ophlal genuit Obed.
verses.english: Zabad also fathered Ephlal, and Ephlal fathered Obed.

verses.latin: Obed genuit Jehu: Jehu genuit Azariam.
verses.english: Obed fathered Jehu, and Jehu fathered Azariah.

verses.latin: Azarias genuit Helles: et Helles genuit Elasam.
verses.english: Azariah fathered Helez, and Helez fathered Eleasa.

verses.latin: Elasa genuit Sisamoi: Sisamoi genuit Sellum.
verses.english: Eleasa fathered Sismai, and Sismai fathered Shallum.

verses.latin: Filii autem David qui nati sunt ei in Hebron, fuerunt: primogenitus Amnon ex Achinoam Jezrahelitide: secundus Daniel de Abigail Carmeli:
verses.english: The sons of David who were born to him in Hebron were: The firstborn was Amnon, whose mother was Ahinoam from Jezreel; the second son was Daniel, whose mother was Abigail from Carmel.

verses.latin: tertius Absalom filius Maacha filiae Tolmai regis Gessur: quartus Adonias filius Aggith:
verses.english: The third son was Absalom, whose mother was Maachah, daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth son was Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith.

verses.latin: quintus Saphathias de Abital: sextus Jethraam de Egla uxore sua.
verses.english: The fifth son was Shephatiah, whose mother was Abital; the sixth son was Ithream, whose mother was Eglah, David’s wife.

verses.latin: Sex itaque nati sunt ei in Hebron, ubi regnavit septem annis et sex mensibus: triginta vero et tribus annis regnavit in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Therefore, these six sons were born to David in Hebron, where he reigned for seven years and six months. He then reigned in Jerusalem for thirty-three years.

verses.latin: Hi sunt autem qui nati sunt ei in Jerusalem: Sammua, et Sobab, et Nathan, et Salomon, quatuor de Bathsua filia Ammiel:
verses.english: These are the sons who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon. These four sons were born from Bath-shua, daughter of Ammiel.

verses.latin: Jebahar quoque, et Elisama, et Eliphalet,
verses.english: Also, Ibhar, Elishama, and Eliphelet.

verses.latin: et Noga, et Napheg, et Japhia,
verses.english: And Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia.

verses.latin: necnon Elisama, et Eliada, et Eliphalet, novem.
verses.english: In addition, Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet. These were nine sons in total.

verses.latin: Omnes hi, filii David, absque filiis concubinarum: habueruntque sororem Thamar.
verses.english: All these were the sons of David, not including the sons he had with his concubines. They also had a sister named Tamar.

verses.latin: Filius autem Salomonis, Roboam: cujus Abia filius, Osa filius, Joram filius,
verses.english: The son of Solomon was Rehoboam. Rehoboam’s son was Abijah. Abijah’s son was Asa. Asa’s son was Jehoshaphat.

verses.latin: Ochozias filius, Joas filius, Amasias filius, Azarias filius, Joathan filius,
verses.english: Jehoshaphat’s son was Ahaziah. Ahaziah’s son was Joash. Joash’s son was Amaziah. Amaziah’s son was Azariah. Azariah’s son was Jotham.

verses.latin: Achaz filius, Ezechias filius, Manasses filius,
verses.english: Jotham’s son was Ahaz. Ahaz’s son was Hezekiah. Hezekiah’s son was Manasseh.

verses.latin: Amon filius, Josias filius.
verses.english: Manasseh’s son was Amon. Amon’s son was Josiah.

verses.latin: Filii Josiae, primogenitus Johanan, secundus Joakim, tertius Sedecias, quartus Sellum.
verses.english: The sons of Josiah were: The firstborn was Johanan; the second son was Jehoiakim; the third son was Zedekiah; the fourth son was Shallum.

verses.latin: Filii autem Joakim: Jechonias filius, Sedecias filius.
verses.english: The sons of Jehoiakim were: His son was Jeconiah, and his son was Zedekiah.

verses.latin: De Jechonia autem nati sunt Salathiel filius ejus,
verses.english: From Jeconiah, his son Salathiel was born.

verses.latin: Melchiram, Phadaia, Seneser, et Jecemia, Sama, et Nadabia.
verses.english: Also from Jeconiah, his other sons were Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Phadaia, Zorobabel, et Semei. Filii Zorobabel, Mosollam, Hananias, et Salamith soror eorum:
verses.english: The sons of Pedaiah were Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel were Meshullam, Hananiah, and their sister Shelomith.

verses.latin: Hasaba quoque, et Ohol, et Barachias, et Hasadias, Josabhesed, quinque.
verses.english: Also, the other sons of Zerubbabel were Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed. These were five additional sons.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Hananiae, Pheltias, et Isaia, filii Raphaia, filii Arnan, filii Obdia, filii Sechenia.
verses.english: The sons of Hananiah were Pelatiah and Jeshaiah. Jeshaiah was the father of Rephaiah, who was the father of Arnan, who was the father of Obadiah, who was the father of Shecaniah.

verses.latin: Filius Sechenia, Semeia: et filii Semeia, Hattus, et Jegal, et Bariu, et Naaria, et Saphat, sex.
verses.english: The son of Shecaniah was Shemaiah. And the sons of Shemaiah were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat. These were six sons.

verses.latin: Filii autem Naariae, Elionai, et Ezechias, et Azricam, tres.
verses.english: The sons of Neariah were Elioenai, Hezekiah, and Azrikam. These were three sons.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Elionai, Odovia, et Eliasib, et Phalaia, et Accub, et Johanan, et Dalaia, et Anani, septem.
verses.english: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani. These were seven sons.

verses.latin: Filii Elionai: Odovia, et Eliasib, et Phalaia, et Accub, et Johanan, et Dalaia, et Anani, septem.
verses.english: The sons of Elioenai were Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani. These were seven sons.

verses.latin: Filii Juda: Phares, Hesron, et Charmi, et Hur, et Sobal.
verses.english: The sons of Judah were Phares, Hesron, Charmi, Hur, and Sobal.

verses.latin: Filius Raia, genuit Jaath, de quo ortus est Ahiud, et Laad. Hae sunt cognationes Sarai.
verses.english: Raia's son was Jaath, from whom Ahiud and Laad were born. These are the families of Sarai.

verses.latin: Et ista stirps Etam: Jezrahel, et Jesema, et Jedebos, cognominis suae Pater fratris, et Nomina, et Sarrhae.
verses.english: And these are the descendants of Etam: Jezrahel, Jesema, and Jedebos, whose family name was 'Father of his brother'. Also listed are Nomina and Sarrhae.

verses.latin: Et Phanuel pater Gedor, et Ezer pater Hosa: isti sunt filii Hur primogeniti Ephratha patris Bethlehem.
verses.english: Phanuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hosa. These men were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratha, who was the father of Bethlehem.

verses.latin: Et Assur pater Thecue habuit duas uxores, Heleam et Naaram.
verses.english: Assur, the father of Thecue, had two wives, Helea and Naara.

verses.latin: Et peperit ei Naara Ozam, et Hepher, et Themani, et Ahastari: hi sunt filii Naara.
verses.english: Naara bore him Oza, Hepher, Themani, and Ahastari. These are the sons of Naara.

verses.latin: Filii vero Helea: Zereth, et Sohar, et Ethnan.
verses.english: The sons of Helea were Zereth, Sohar, and Ethnan.

verses.latin: Porro Cos genuit Anob et Sobeba, et stirpes Aharhel filii Harum.
verses.english: Furthermore, Cos fathered Anob and Sobeba, and the families of Aharhel, the son of Harum.

verses.latin: Fuit autem vir nobilis vocabulo Jabes, plusquam ceteri fratres sui, et mater ejus vocavit nomen ejus Jabes, dicens: Quia peperi eum in doloribus.
verses.english: Now there was a man of noble birth whose name was Jabes, more honorable than all his brothers. His mother called his name Jabes, saying, 'Because I bore him in sorrows.'

verses.latin: Invocavit ergo Jabes Deum Israel, dicens: Si benedicens benedixeris mihi, et dilataveris terminos meos, et fuerit manus tua mecum, et feceris me cavere a malo, ne tristor. Et praestitit Deus quae precatus est.
verses.english: Therefore, Jabes called upon the God of Israel, saying, 'If You truly bless me, and expand my territories, and if Your hand is with me, and You keep me from evil so that I do not suffer.' And God granted what he prayed for.

verses.latin: Porro Caleb frater Sua genuit Mehir, qui fuit pater Esthon.
verses.english: Furthermore, Caleb, the brother of Sua, fathered Mehir, who was the father of Esthon.

verses.latin: Esthon autem genuit Bethrapha, et Phasea, et Tehinna patrem urbis Naas: hi sunt viri Recab.
verses.english: Esthon fathered Bethrapha, Phasea, and Tehinna, who was the father of the city of Naas. These are the men of Recab.

verses.latin: Filii Cenez: Othoniel et Saraia. Filii Othoniel: Hathath et Maonathi.
verses.english: The sons of Cenez were Othoniel and Saraia. The sons of Othoniel were Hathath and Maonathi.

verses.latin: Maonathi genuit Ophra, et Saraia genuit Joab patrem vallis artificum: hi enim artifices erant.
verses.english: Maonathi fathered Ophra, and Saraia fathered Joab, the father of the Valley of Craftsmen, for they were indeed craftsmen.

verses.latin: Filii Caleb filii Jephone: Hir, et Ela, et Naham. Filii Ela: Cenez.
verses.english: The sons of Caleb, the son of Jephone, were Hir, Ela, and Naham. The sons of Ela were Cenez.

verses.latin: Filii Jahaleleel: Ziph, et Zipha, Thiria, et Asareel.
verses.english: The sons of Jahaleleel were Ziph, Zipha, Thiria, and Asareel.

verses.latin: Filii Esra: Jether, et Mered, et Epher, et Jalon, et genuit Mariam, et Sammai, et Jesba patrem Esthamo.
verses.english: The sons of Esra were Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. He fathered Miriam, Sammai, and Jesba, the father of Esthamo.

verses.latin: Et uxor ejus Judaia peperit Jared patrem Gedor, et Heber patrem Socho, et Jecuthiel patrem Zanoe. Hi sunt filii Bechia filiae Pharaonis, quam accepit Mered.
verses.english: His Jewish wife bore Jared, the father of Gedor, and Heber, the father of Socho, and Jecuthiel, the father of Zanoe. These are the sons of Bechia, the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took as his wife.

verses.latin: Filii uxoris ejus Odaiae sororis Naham patris Ceila: Garmita, et Esthamo, qui fuit Machathi.
verses.english: The sons of his wife Odaia, the sister of Naham, the father of Ceila, were Garmita and Esthamo, who was a Machathite.

verses.latin: Filii Simon: Amnon, et Rina, filius Hanan, et Thilon. Et filii Jesi: Zoheth, et Benzoheth.
verses.english: The sons of Simon were Amnon and Rina, and Hanan's son, and Thilon. And the sons of Jesi were Zoheth and Benzoheth.

verses.latin: Filii Sela filii Juda: Her pater Lecha, et Laada pater Maresa, et cognationes domus operantium byssum in Bethsan.
verses.english: The sons of Sela, the son of Judah, were Her, the father of Lecha, and Laada, the father of Maresa. Also, the families of the house of those who worked fine linen in Bethsan.

verses.latin: Et Qui sunt viri mendacii, et viri Soham, et viri Chozeba, et qui de principibus fuerunt, et qui reverterunt in Bethlem. Hae sunt antiquae res.
verses.english: And these are the men of Lying, and the men of Soham, and the men of Chozeba, and those who were among the leaders, and those who returned to Bethlehem. These are the ancient records.

verses.latin: Isti sunt figuli habitantes in plantationibus, et in sepibus: apud regem in operibus ejus commorati sunt.
verses.english: These were potters who lived in plantations and among hedges. They remained with the king for his works.

verses.latin: Filii Simeon: Namuel, et Jamin, Jarib, Zara, Saul:
verses.english: The sons of Simeon were Namuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zara, and Saul.

verses.latin: Sallum filius ejus, Mabsam filius ejus, Masma filius ejus.
verses.english: Sallum was his son, Mabsam was his son, Masma was his son.

verses.latin: Filii Masma: Amus filius ejus, Misma filius ejus, Misma filius ejus.
verses.english: The sons of Masma: Amus was his son, Misma was his son. The repetition of 'Misma filius ejus' in the Latin may indicate a distinct, repeated name, or it could be a scribal duplication in the original text.

verses.latin: Filii Amus: Zechur filius ejus, Semei filius ejus. Filii Semei sedecim, et filiae sex. Fratres ejus non habuerunt filios multos: et universa cognatio eorum non potuit æquare numerum filiorum Juda.
verses.english: The sons of Amus: Zechur was his son, Semei was his son. Semei had sixteen sons and six daughters. His brothers did not have many children, and their entire family could not equal the number of the sons of Judah.

verses.latin: Habitaverunt autem in Bersabee, et Molada, et Hasarsual,
verses.english: They lived in Bersabee, Molada, and Hasarsual,

verses.latin: Et Bala, et Asom, et Tholad,
verses.english: And Bala, Asom, and Tholad,

verses.latin: Et Bathuel, et Horma, et Siceleg,
verses.english: And Bathuel, Horma, and Siceleg,

verses.latin: Et Bethmarchaboth, et Hasarsusim, et Bethberai, et Saarim: hae civitates eorum usque ad regem David.
verses.english: And Bethmarchaboth, Hasarsusim, Bethberai, and Saarim. These were their cities until the reign of King David.

verses.latin: Villae quoque eorum: Etam, et Ain, Remmon, et Thochen, et Asan: civitates quinque.
verses.english: Their villages also included Etam, Ain, Remmon, Thochen, and Asan: five cities.

verses.latin: Et omnes viculi eorum per circuitum civitatum harum usque ad Baal. Haec est habitatio eorum, et divisio.
verses.english: And all their surrounding hamlets of these cities up to Baal. This was their dwelling place, and their tribal division.

verses.latin: Masobab, et Jemlech, et Josa filius Amasias,
verses.english: Masobab, Jemlech, and Josa, the son of Amasias,

verses.latin: Et Johel, et Jehu filius Josabia filii Saraia filii Asiel,
verses.english: And Johel, and Jehu, the son of Josabia, the son of Saraia, the son of Asiel,

verses.latin: Et Elioenai, et Jacoba, et Isuhaia, et Asaia, et Adiel, et Ismiel, et Banaia,
verses.english: And Elioenai, Jacoba, Isuhaia, Asaia, Adiel, Ismiel, and Banaia,

verses.latin: Ziza quoque filius Sephei filii Allon filii Idaia filii Semri filii Samaia.
verses.english: And Ziza, the son of Sephei, the son of Allon, the son of Idaia, the son of Semri, the son of Samaia.

verses.latin: Isti, qui descripti sunt nominatim, principes erant in cognationibus suis, et domus patrum suorum multorum.
verses.english: These men, who were listed by name, were leaders in their families, and their ancestral houses were numerous.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt ut jussum est in Gad, usque ad Gador et usque ad fines orientis campestrium regionum, ut quaererent pascua gregibus suis.
verses.english: They went out, as commanded, to Gad, as far as Gador and to the eastern limits of the open country, to seek pasture for their flocks.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt pascua uberrima, et optima, et terram latissimam, et quietam, et uberem, in qua ante eos habitaverant de stirpe Cham.
verses.english: And they found very rich and excellent pastures, and a very wide, peaceful, and fertile land, where people of the lineage of Cham had lived before them.

verses.latin: Filii Ruben primogeniti Israel (ipse est primogenitus ejus: at quia violavit stratum patris sui, data est primogenita ejus filiis Joseph filii Israel, et non est reputatus primogenitus
verses.english: The sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn son. Even though Reuben himself was the firstborn of Jacob, because he defiled his father's marriage bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel. Therefore, Reuben was not reckoned as the firstborn in terms of the blessings of the birthright.

verses.latin: quoniam ex Juda fortissimi viri et de ipso princeps, id est, ducis familia ortus est, et non juxta generationem primogenitus reputatus est)
verses.english: The reason for this change in the birthright was that from Judah came mighty men, and from him arose the leader of the people—the royal family, that is—and he was not reckoned as the firstborn according to his genealogy, but according to God's choice for leadership.

verses.latin: Filii autem Ruben primogeniti Israel: Enoch et Phallu, Hesron et Charmi.
verses.english: Now, the actual sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, were Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

verses.latin: Filii Joel: Samaia filius ejus, Gog filius ejus, Semei filius ejus,
verses.english: The sons of Joel were Shemaiah, his son; Gog, his son; Shimei, his son;

verses.latin: Micha filius ejus, Reaia filius ejus, Baal filius ejus,
verses.english: Michah, his son; Reaiah, his son; Baal, his son;

verses.latin: Beera filius ejus, quem in Babylonem transtulit Theglathphalnasar rex Assyriorum, et ipse fuit princeps in tribu Ruben.
verses.english: And Beerah, his son. Beerah was one of the leaders of the tribe of Reuben, whom Tiglath-Pileser, the king of Assyria, carried away captive to Babylon.

verses.latin: Fratres autem ejus et universa cognatio, cum enumerarentur per familias suas, princeps Jeiel, et Zacharias.
verses.english: His brothers, along with their entire clan, were counted according to their families. The chief men were Jeiel and Zechariah.

verses.latin: Porro Bala filius Azaz filii Samma filii Joel, ipse habitavit in Aroer usque ad Nebo et Beelmeon.
verses.english: Bela, the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, lived in Aroer, stretching as far as Nebo and Baal-Meon.

verses.latin: Ad orientem autem habitavit usque ad introitum deserti et fluvii Euphratis. Multa quippe possederant pecora in terra Galaad.
verses.english: Eastward, they extended their dwelling places all the way to the entrance of the desert, to the River Euphrates. This was because they owned a vast number of livestock in the land of Gilead.

verses.latin: In diebus autem Saul, pugnabant contra Agarenos, et vicerunt illos: et habitaverunt in tabernaculis eorum in omni regione quæ respicit ad orientem Galaad.
verses.english: During the days of King Saul, they waged war against the Hagrites and defeated them. Afterward, they lived in the Hagrites' tents throughout the entire region east of Gilead.

verses.latin: Filii vero Gad contra eos habitabant in terra Basan usque Salacha.
verses.english: The sons of Gad lived opposite them, in the land of Bashan, as far as Salecah.

verses.latin: Joel princeps, et Saphan secundus: et Janai et Saphat in Basan.
verses.english: Joel was the chief, and Shapham was second in command. Then Janai and Shaphat lived in Bashan.

verses.latin: Fratres autem eorum per familias suas: Michaël et Mosollam et Sebee et Jorai et Jacan et Zie et Heber, septem.
verses.english: Their brothers, according to their families, were seven: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Heber.

verses.latin: Hi filii Abihail filii Huri filii Jaroa filii Galaad filii Michaël filii Jesisi filii Jeddo filii Buz.
verses.english: These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz.

verses.latin: Fratres quoque filii Abihail, principes familiarum: Jahdo, et Buz.
verses.english: Also, their brothers, the sons of Abihail, were chiefs of their families: Jahdo and Buz.

verses.latin: Hi habitaverunt in Galaad et in Basan, et in viculis earum, et in universis suburbanis Saron, usque ad terminos.
verses.english: These men lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its surrounding villages, and in all the open pasturelands of Sharon, up to their borders.

verses.latin: Omnes hi numerati sunt in diebus Joathan regis Juda, et in diebus Jeroboam regis Israel.
verses.english: All these men were recorded in the genealogies during the reigns of Jotham, king of Judah, and Jeroboam, king of Israel.

verses.latin: Filii Ruben, et Gad, et dimidiæ tribus Manasse, viri bellicosi, portantes scutum et gladium, et dirigentes sagittam, et scientes certare prælio: sex et quadraginta millia septingenti triginta, qui procedebant ad pugnam.
verses.english: The sons of Reuben, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh were all valiant men, capable warriors. They carried shields and swords, were skilled archers, and knew how to fight in battle. Those who went out to war numbered forty-six thousand seven hundred and thirty.

verses.latin: Pugnabant autem contra Agarenos: Ituræos et Naphiseos et Nodabæos.
verses.english: They fought against the Hagrites, along with the Jeturites, Naphishites, and Nodabites.

verses.latin: Et adjuti sunt contra illos: traditique sunt in manibus eorum Agareni, et universi qui cum eis fuerunt: preces enim fuderunt ad Dominum dum præliarentur: et exaudivit eos, eo quod in eo confisi sunt.
verses.english: They received help against these enemies. The Hagrites and all who were with them were delivered into their hands. This victory occurred because the Israelite warriors cried out to the Lord during the battle, and He heard their prayers, for they trusted in Him.

verses.latin: Et captivum duxerunt gregem eorum, camelorum quinquaginta millia, et ovium ducenta quinquaginta millia, et asinos duo millia, et animarum hominum centum millia.
verses.english: They carried away as plunder their livestock: fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep, two thousand donkeys, and one hundred thousand people as captives.

verses.latin: Interfecti sunt autem multi: digno enim judicio pugnabant. Et habitaverunt pro eis usque ad transmigrationem.
verses.english: Many of their enemies were killed because the battle was fought under God's righteous judgment. And the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in their place until the time of the exile.

verses.latin: Filii quoque dimidiæ tribus Manasse possederunt terram a Basan usque ad Baal Hermon et Sanir et montem Hermon: ipsi enim plurimi erant.
verses.english: The sons of the half-tribe of Manasseh possessed the land from Bashan to Baal-Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon, for they had become very numerous.

verses.latin: Hi sunt ergo principes familiarum tribus Manasse: Epher et Isi et Eliel et Esriel et Jeremia et Odaia et Jediel, viri robustissimi et potentes, et viri nominati, principes familiarum suarum.
verses.english: These were the chiefs of their family divisions in the half-tribe of Manasseh: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were brave and powerful men, well-known leaders of their respective families.

verses.latin: Fornicati sunt autem contra Deum patrum suorum, et fornicati sunt post deos populorum terræ, quos abstulit Deus a facie eorum.
verses.english: However, these tribes committed spiritual adultery against the God of their fathers. They prostituted themselves by following the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had removed from before them.

verses.latin: Et suscitavit Deus Israel spiritum Phul regis Assyriorum, et spiritum Theglathphalnasar regis Assur: et transtulit Ruben et Gad et dimidiam tribum Manasse, et adduxit eos in Hala et in Habor et Ara et ad fluvium Gozan usque ad hunc diem.
verses.english: Therefore, the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul, king of Assyria, also known as Tiglath-Pileser, king of Assyria. He carried away the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, bringing them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river Gozan, where they remain to this very day.

verses.latin: Filii Levi: Gerson et Caath et Merari.
verses.english: The sons of Levi were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.latin: Filii Caath: Amram, Isaar, Hebron, et Oziel.
verses.english: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.

verses.latin: Filii Amram: Aaron, Moyses, et Maria. Filii Aaron: Nadab et Abiu, Eleazar et Ithamar.
verses.english: The sons of Amram were Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

verses.latin: Eleazar genuit Phinees, et Phinees genuit Abisue,
verses.english: Eleazar fathered Phinehas, and Phinehas fathered Abishua.

verses.latin: Abisue genuit Bocci, et Bocci genuit Ozi,
verses.english: Abishua fathered Bukki, and Bukki fathered Uzzi.

verses.latin: Ozi genuit Zarahia, et Zarahia genuit Meraioth,
verses.english: Uzzi fathered Zerahiah, and Zerahiah fathered Meraioth.

verses.latin: Meraioth genuit Amaria, et Amaria genuit Achitob,
verses.english: Meraioth fathered Amariah, and Amariah fathered Ahitub.

verses.latin: Achitob genuit Sadoc, et Sadoc genuit Achimaas,
verses.english: Ahitub fathered Zadok, and Zadok fathered Ahimaaz.

verses.latin: Achimaas genuit Azaria, et Azaria genuit Johanan,
verses.english: Ahimaaz fathered Azariah, and Azariah fathered Johanan.

verses.latin: Johanan genuit Azaria (ipse est qui sacerdotio functus est in domo quam ædificavit Salomon in Jerusalem),
verses.english: Johanan fathered Azariah. This Azariah was the one who served as priest in the Temple that King Solomon built in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Azaria genuit Amaria, et Amaria genuit Achitob,
verses.english: Azariah fathered Amariah, and Amariah fathered Ahitub.

verses.latin: Achitob genuit Sadoc, et Sadoc genuit Sellum,
verses.english: Ahitub fathered Zadok, and Zadok fathered Shallum.

verses.latin: Sellum genuit Helcia, et Helcia genuit Azaria,
verses.english: Shallum fathered Hilkiah, and Hilkiah fathered Azariah.

verses.latin: Azaria genuit Saraia, et Saraia genuit Josedec.
verses.english: Azariah fathered Seraiah, and Seraiah fathered Jehozadak.

verses.latin: Filii Levi: Gerson, Caath, et Merari.
verses.english: The children of Levi were Gerson, Caath, and Merari.

verses.latin: Filii Caath: Amram, Isahar, Hebron, et Oziel.
verses.english: The children of Caath were Amram, Isahar, Hebron, and Oziel.

verses.latin: Filii Amram: Aaron, Moyses, et Maria. Filii Aaron: Nadab, Abiu, Eleazar, et Ithamar.
verses.english: The children of Amram were Aaron, Moyses, and Maria. The children of Aaron were Nadab, Abiu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

verses.latin: Eleazar genuit Phinees, et Phinees genuit Abisue.
verses.english: Eleazar was the father of Phinees, and Phinees was the father of Abisue.

verses.latin: Abisue genuit Bocci, et Bocci genuit Ozi.
verses.english: Abisue was the father of Bocci, and Bocci was the father of Ozi.

verses.latin: Ozi genuit Zarahiæ, et Zarahiæ genuit Meraioth.
verses.english: Ozi was the father of Zarahiæ, and Zarahiæ was the father of Meraioth.

verses.latin: Meraioth genuit Amariam, et Amariam genuit Achitob.
verses.english: Meraioth was the father of Amariam, and Amariam was the father of Achitob.

verses.latin: Achitob genuit Sadoc, et Sadoc genuit Achimaas.
verses.english: Achitob was the father of Sadoc, and Sadoc was the father of Achimaas.

verses.latin: Achimaas genuit Azariam, et Azariam genuit Johanan.
verses.english: Achimaas was the father of Azariam, and Azariam was the father of Johanan.

verses.latin: Johanan genuit Azariam. Ipse est Azarias, qui sacerdotio functus est in domo quam ædificavit Salomon in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Johanan was the father of Azariam. This Azarias was the priest who ministered in the house which Solomon built in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Azarias genuit Amariam, et Amariam genuit Achitob.
verses.english: Azarias was the father of Amariam, and Amariam was the father of Achitob.

verses.latin: Achitob genuit Sadoc, et Sadoc genuit Sellum.
verses.english: Achitob was the father of Sadoc, and Sadoc was the father of Sellum.

verses.latin: Sellum genuit Helciam, et Helcias genuit Azariam.
verses.english: Sellum was the father of Helcias, and Helcias was the father of Azariam.

verses.latin: Azarias genuit Saraiam, et Saraiam genuit Josedec.
verses.english: Azarias was the father of Saraiam, and Saraiam was the father of Josedec.

verses.latin: Porro Josedec egressus est, quando transtulit Dominus Judam et Jerusalem per manus Nabuchodonosor.
verses.english: Moreover, Josedec went into exile when the Lord allowed Nabuchodonosor to carry away the people of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Filii Levi: Gerson, Caath, et Merari.
verses.english: The children of Levi were Gerson, Caath, and Merari.

verses.latin: Et hæc sunt nomina filiorum Gerson: Lobni et Semei.
verses.english: And these are the names of the children of Gerson: Lobni and Semei.

verses.latin: Filii Caath: Amram, Isahar, Hebron, et Oziel.
verses.english: The children of Caath were Amram, Isahar, Hebron, and Oziel.

verses.latin: Filii Merari: Moholi et Musi. Hæ autem cognationes Levi secundum familias eorum.
verses.english: The children of Merari were Moholi and Musi. Now these are the descendants of Levi according to their family groups.

verses.latin: De Gerson: Lobni filius ejus, Jahath filius ejus, Zamma filius ejus.
verses.english: From Gerson: his son Lobni, his son Jahath, his son Zamma.

verses.latin: Joah filius ejus, Addo filius ejus, Zara filius ejus, Jethrai filius ejus.
verses.english: His son Joah, his son Addo, his son Zara, his son Jethrai.

verses.latin: Filii Caath: Aminadab filius ejus, Core filius ejus, Asir filius ejus.
verses.english: The children of Caath were: his son Aminadab, his son Core, his son Asir.

verses.latin: Elcana filius ejus, Abiasaph filius ejus, Asir filius ejus.
verses.english: His son Elcana, his son Abiasaph, his son Asir.

verses.latin: Thahath filius ejus, Uriel filius ejus, Ozias filius ejus, Saul filius ejus.
verses.english: His son Thahath, his son Uriel, his son Ozias, his son Saul.

verses.latin: Filii Elcana: Amasai et Achimoth.
verses.english: The children of Elcana were Amasai and Achimoth.

verses.latin: Elcana filius ejus, Sophai filius ejus, Nahath filius ejus.
verses.english: His son Elcana, his son Sophai, his son Nahath.

verses.latin: Eliab filius ejus, Jeroham filius ejus, Elcana filius ejus.
verses.english: His son Eliab, his son Jeroham, his son Elcana.

verses.latin: Filii Samuel: primogenitus Vasseni et Abia.
verses.english: The children of Samuel were: his firstborn, Vasseni, and Abia.

verses.latin: Filii Merari: Moholi, Lobni filius ejus, Semei filius ejus, Oza filius ejus.
verses.english: The children of Merari were: Moholi, his son Lobni, his son Semei, his son Oza.

verses.latin: Samaa filius ejus, Haggia filius ejus, Asaia filius ejus.
verses.english: His son Samaa, his son Haggia, his son Asaia.

verses.latin: Isti sunt, quos constituit David super cantores domus Domini, ex quo locata est arca.
verses.english: These are the men whom David appointed to oversee the singers in the house of the Lord, from the time the ark was placed there.

verses.latin: Et ministrabant coram tabernaculo testimonii, concentu, donec ædificaret Salomon domum Domini in Jerusalem: stabant autem juxta ordinem suum in ministerio.
verses.english: And they ministered before the tabernacle of testimony with singing, until Solomon built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem; they stood in their service according to their appointed order.

verses.latin: Hi vero sunt qui assistebant cum filiis suis, de filiis Caath, Hemam cantor, filius Johel, filius Samuel.
verses.english: Now these are the men who assisted with their sons, from the children of Caath: Hemam, the singer, son of Johel, son of Samuel.

verses.latin: Filius Elcana, filius Jeroham, filius Eliel, filius Thoë.
verses.english: Son of Elcana, son of Jeroham, son of Eliel, son of Thoë.

verses.latin: Filius Suph, filius Elcana, filius Maath, filius Amasai.
verses.english: Son of Suph, son of Elcana, son of Maath, son of Amasai.

verses.latin: Filius Elcana, filius Johel, filius Azariæ, filius Sophoniæ.
verses.english: Son of Elcana, son of Johel, son of Azariæ, son of Sophoniæ.

verses.latin: Filius Thahath, filius Asir, filius Abiasaph, filius Core.
verses.english: Son of Thahath, son of Asir, son of Abiasaph, son of Core.

verses.latin: Filius Isaar, filius Caath, filius Levi, filius Israel.
verses.english: Son of Isaar, son of Caath, son of Levi, son of Israel.

verses.latin: Et frater ejus Asaph, qui stabat a dextris ejus, Asaph filius Barachiæ, filius Samaa.
verses.english: And his brother Asaph, who stood at his right hand, was Asaph, son of Barachiæ, son of Samaa.

verses.latin: Filius Michaël, filius Basaia, filius Melchiæ.
verses.english: Son of Michaël, son of Basaia, son of Melchiæ.

verses.latin: Filii autem Issachar: Tola, et Phua, Jasub, et Somer, quatuor.
verses.english: Now the sons of Issachar were Tola, Phua, Jasub, and Somer—a total of four sons.

verses.latin: Filii Tola: Uzzi, et Raphaia, et Jerihel, et Jemai, et Jebsem, et Samuel, principes familiarum suarum de Tola, viri fortissimi per cognationes suas; quorum numerus in diebus David, ducenta viginti millia sexcenti.
verses.english: The sons of Tola were Uzzi, Raphaia, Jerihel, Jemai, Jebsem, and Samuel. These men became the heads of their families, mighty warriors from their ancestral lines. Their total number, as recorded in the days of King David, was two hundred twenty thousand six hundred.

verses.latin: Filii autem Uzzi: Izrahia, de quo. Filii Izrahia: Michaël, et Abdia, et Joel, et Jesia, quinque; omnes principes.
verses.english: The son of Uzzi was Izrahia. And Izrahia's sons were Michaël, Abdia, Joel, and Jesia—a total of five, all of whom became family heads.

verses.latin: Cum his et cognationibus suis, secundum propinquitates et familias, virorum ad pugnandum promptissimi, triginta sex millia: multa enim conjuges et filii fuerant.
verses.english: With these men and their extended families, according to their relationships and households, there were thirty-six thousand mighty men ready for battle, because they had many wives and many sons.

verses.latin: Fratres quoque eorum per omnes cognationes Issachar, robustissimi ad praelia, nonaginta septem millia.
verses.english: Their brothers, from all the families of Issachar, were mighty men for battle, totaling ninety-seven thousand.

verses.latin: Filii Benjamin: Bela, et Becher, et Jadihel, tres.
verses.english: The sons of Benjamin were Bela, Becher, and Jadihel—a total of three.

verses.latin: Filii Bela: Esbon, et Uzzi, et Uziel, et Jerimoth, et Uri, quinque, principes familiarum, robustissimi pugnatores; et numerus eorum viginti duo millia triginta quatuor.
verses.english: The sons of Bela were Esbon, Uzzi, Uziel, Jerimoth, and Uri—five in total. These were the heads of families, mighty warriors. Their number was twenty-two thousand thirty-four.

verses.latin: Filii Becher: Zamira, et Joas, et Eliezer, et Elioenai, et Omri, et Jerimoth, et Abia, et Anathoth, et Almath: omnes hi, filii Becher.
verses.english: The sons of Becher were Zamira, Joas, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jerimoth, Abia, Anathoth, and Almath. All these were the sons of Becher.

verses.latin: Horum numerus per cognationes, principes familiarum, fortissimi ad proelia, viginti millia ducenti.
verses.english: The count of these men, by their families, who were heads of families and mighty in battle, was twenty thousand two hundred.

verses.latin: Filii autem Jadihel: Balan. Filii autem Balan: Jehus, et Benjamin, et Aod, et Chanana, et Zethan, et Tharsis, et Ahisahar.
verses.english: The son of Jadihel was Balan. And the sons of Balan were Jehus, Benjamin, Aod, Chanana, Zethan, Tharsis, and Ahisahar.

verses.latin: Omnes hi, filii Jadihel, principes familiarum, fortissimi viri, decem et septem millia ducenti ad pugnandum.
verses.english: All these, the sons of Jadihel, were heads of families and mighty men of war, numbering seventeen thousand two hundred who were ready for battle.

verses.latin: Sepham quoque et Huppham, filii Hir: et Husim, filii Aher.
verses.english: Also Sepham and Huppham were the sons of Hir. And Husim was a son of Aher.

verses.latin: Filii autem Nephthali: Jasiel, et Guni, et Jezer, et Sellum. Filii Bala.
verses.english: The sons of Nephthali were Jasiel, Guni, Jezer, and Sellum—these were the sons of Bala.

verses.latin: Filii autem Manasse: Asrihel: et de concubina ejus Syriaca, peperit Machir patrem Galaad.
verses.english: The sons of Manasseh: Asrihel. And his Syrian concubine bore Machir, who became the father of Galaad.

verses.latin: Machir autem accepit uxores filiis suis Hupphim et Supphim: et habuit sororem nomine Maacha: nomen secundi Salphaad, natusque est Salphaad filias.
verses.english: Machir took wives for his sons Hupphim and Supphim. He also had a sister named Maacha. The name of his second son was Salphaad, who had only daughters.

verses.latin: Peperitque Maacha uxor Machir, virum, et vocavit nomen ejus Phares: nomenque fratris ejus Sares: et filii ejus Ulam et Recem.
verses.english: Maacha, Machir's wife, bore a son and called his name Phares. His brother's name was Sares. His sons were Ulam and Recem.

verses.latin: Filii autem Ulam: Badan. Hi sunt filii Galaad filii Machir, filii Manasse.
verses.english: The son of Ulam was Badan. These were the sons of Galaad, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Soror autem ejus Regina peperit Isod, et Abihi, et Mahela.
verses.english: His sister, Regina, bore Isod, Abihi, and Mahela.

verses.latin: Fuerunt autem filii Semida, Ahian, et Sechem, et Leci, et Aniam.
verses.english: The sons of Semida were Ahian, Sechem, Leci, and Aniam.

verses.latin: Filii autem Ephraim: Suthela, cujus fuit Bared filius, cujus Ruhapha filius, cujus Reseph filius, cujus Thale filius, cujus Aran filius.
verses.english: The sons of Ephraim: Suthela, whose son was Bared; whose son was Ruhapha; whose son was Reseph; whose son was Thale; whose son was Aran.

verses.latin: Cujus filius Badam, cujus filius Zathan, cujus filius Eden, et frater ejus Berad, et Thaha, interfecitque illos viri Geth indigenae, eo quod descendissent ad diripienda pecora eorum.
verses.english: His son was Badam; whose son was Zathan; whose son was Eden. His brother was Berad, and Thaha. The men who were native to Geth killed them because they had gone down to plunder their livestock.

verses.latin: Luctuque percussus est Ephraim pater eorum multis diebus, et venerunt fratres ejus ut consolarentur eum.
verses.english: Ephraim, their father, was struck with grief for many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.

verses.latin: Ingressusque est ad uxorem suam, quae concepit et peperit filium, et vocavit nomen ejus Beria, eo quod in malis domus ejus natus esset.
verses.english: Then he went to his wife, who conceived and bore a son, and he called his name Beria because he was born during a time of evil in his household.

verses.latin: Filia quoque ejus fuit Sara, quae aedificavit Bethoron inferiorem et superiorem, et Uzzen Sara.
verses.english: His daughter was Sara, who built the lower and upper Bethoron, and Uzzen Sara.

verses.latin: Filius autem ejus Rapha, et Reseph, et Thale, de quo natus est Taan,
verses.english: His son was Rapha, and Reseph, and Thale, from whom Taan was born.

verses.latin: qui genuit Laadan: hujus filius Ammiud, hujus filius Elisama,
verses.english: Taan begot Laadan; Laadan's son was Ammiud; Ammiud's son was Elisama.

verses.latin: hujus filius Nun, hujus filius Josue.
verses.english: Elisama's son was Nun; Nun's son was Josue.

verses.latin: Possessio autem eorum et habitatio, Bethel cum filiabus suis, et contra orientem Noran, et ad occidentalem plagam Gazer et filiae ejus, Sichem quoque cum filiabus suis usque Azam et filias ejus.
verses.english: Their possessions and dwellings were Bethel with its villages, and to the east, Noran; to the west, Gazer with its villages; also Sichem with its villages, all the way to Azam and its villages.

verses.latin: Juxta filios quoque Manasse, Bethsan et filias ejus, Thanach et filias ejus, Mageddo et filias ejus, Gezer et filias ejus: in his habitaverunt filii Joseph filii Israel.
verses.english: Alongside the sons of Manasseh, their territory included Bethsan with its villages, Thanach with its villages, Mageddo with its villages, and Gezer with its villages. In these places the sons of Joseph, the sons of Israel, lived.

verses.latin: Filii autem Aser: Jemna, et Jesua, et Jessui, et Beria, et Sara soror eorum.
verses.english: The sons of Aser were Jemna, Jesua, Jessui, and Beria, with Sara as their sister.

verses.latin: Filii autem Beria: Heber, et Melchiel: ipse est pater Barsaith.
verses.english: The sons of Beria were Heber and Melchiel. Melchiel was the father of Barsaith.

verses.latin: Heber genuit Jephlat, et Somer, et Hotham, et Suaa sororem eorum.
verses.english: Heber begot Jephlat, Somer, Hotham, and Suaa, their sister.

verses.latin: Filii Jephlat: Phosech, et Bamaal, et Asoth: hi sunt filii Jephlat.
verses.english: The sons of Jephlat were Phosech, Bamaal, and Asoth. These were Jephlat's sons.

verses.latin: Filii autem Somer: Roaga, et Haba, et Aram.
verses.english: The sons of Somer were Roaga, Haba, and Aram.

verses.latin: Et filii Hotham: Supha, et Jemna, et Seles, et Amal.
verses.english: And the sons of Hotham were Supha, Jemna, Seles, and Amal.

verses.latin: Filii Aser: de Supha, Sue, et Harnapher, et Sual, et Beri, et Jamra,
verses.english: The sons of Aser: from Supha were Sue, Harnapher, Sual, Beri, and Jamra.

verses.latin: et Bosor, et Hod, et Sama, et Selesa, et Jethran, et Bera.
verses.english: And Bosor, and Hod, and Sama, and Selesa, and Jethran, and Bera.

verses.latin: Filii autem Jether: Jephone, et Phaspha, et Ara.
verses.english: The sons of Jether were Jephone, Phaspha, and Ara.

verses.latin: Filii autem Ulla: Arah, et Hanniel, et Resia.
verses.english: The sons of Ulla were Arah, Hanniel, and Resia.

verses.latin: Omnes hi filii Aser, principes familiarum, electi et fortissimi duces principum: et fuit numerus eorum qui ducerentur ad praelium, viginti sex millia virorum.
verses.english: All these were the sons of Aser, heads of families, chosen as mighty leaders among the chiefs. The number of men who were prepared to be led into battle was twenty-six thousand.

verses.latin: Benjamin autem genuit Bala primogenitum suum, Asbel secundum, Ahara tertium,
verses.english: Now Benjamin fathered his firstborn son, Bala. His second son was Asbel, and his third was Ahara.

verses.latin: Noha quartum, et Rapha quintum.
verses.english: His fourth son was Noha, and his fifth was Rapha.

verses.latin: Fueruntque filii Bala, Addar et Gera, et Abihud,
verses.english: The sons of Bala were Addar, Gera, and Abihud.

verses.latin: Abisue quoque et Naaman, Ahia etiam,
verses.english: Also, Abishua, Naaman, and Ahiah.

verses.latin: et Gera, et Sephuphan, et Huram.
verses.english: And Gera, Sephuphan, and Huram.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Aod, principes familiarum habitantium in Gabaa, qui translati sunt in Manahath.
verses.english: These were the sons of Ehud, who were the chiefs of the families living in Geba. They were moved and settled in Manahath.

verses.latin: Naaman quoque, et Ahia, et Gera: ipse et transtulit eos, et genuit Oza, et Ahiud.
verses.english: These were Naaman, Ahiah, and Gera. It was Gera himself who relocated them, and he fathered Uzza and Ahihud.

verses.latin: Porro Saaraim genuit in regione Moab, postquam dimisit Husim et Baara uxores suas.
verses.english: Furthermore, Shaharaim fathered children in the region of Moab after he had sent away his wives Hushim and Baara.

verses.latin: Genuit autem de Hodes uxore sua, Jobab, et Sebia, et Mosa, et Molchom,
verses.english: Now, by his wife Hodes, he fathered Jobab, Zebiah, Mesha, and Malcam.

verses.latin: et Jehus, et Sachia, et Marma. Hi sunt filii ejus principes familiarum.
verses.english: Also Jeus, Sachia, and Mirma. These are his sons, who were chiefs of families.

verses.latin: De Husim vero genuit Ahitob, et Elphaal.
verses.english: From Hushim, however, he fathered Ahitub and Elpaal.

verses.latin: Filii autem Elphaal, Heber, et Misaam, et Samad: hic ædificavit Onon, et Lod cum filiabus suis.
verses.english: Now the sons of Elpaal were Heber, Misham, and Shemed. It was Shemed who built Ono and Lod, along with their surrounding villages.

verses.latin: Beria quoque et Sama, principes familiarum habitantium in Ajalon: hi fugaverunt habitatores Geth.
verses.english: Also, Beriah and Shema were chiefs of families who lived in Aijalon. These were the ones who drove out the inhabitants of Gath.

verses.latin: Ahio, Sasac, et Jerimoth,
verses.english: Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth.

verses.latin: Zebadia, et Arad, et Eder,
verses.english: Zebadiah, Arad, and Eder.

verses.latin: Michael, et Jespha, et Joha filii Beria.
verses.english: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were the sons of Beriah.

verses.latin: Zebadia, et Mosollam, et Hezeci, et Heber,
verses.english: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, and Heber.

verses.latin: Jesamari quoque, et Jezlia, et Jobab, filii Elphaal.
verses.english: Also Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were sons of Elpaal.

verses.latin: Jacim, et Zechri, et Zabdi,
verses.english: Jakim, Zichri, and Zabdi.

verses.latin: Elienai, et Selethai, et Eliel,
verses.english: Elienai, Zilthai, and Eliel.

verses.latin: Adaia, et Baraia, et Samarat, filii Semei.
verses.english: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.

verses.latin: Jesphan, et Heber, et Eliel,
verses.english: Ishpan, Heber, and Eliel.

verses.latin: Abdon, et Zechri, et Anan,
verses.english: Abdon, Zichri, and Hanan.

verses.latin: Anania, et Elam, et Anthothia,
verses.english: Hananiah, Elam, and Antothiah.

verses.latin: Iephdaia, et Phanuel filii Sasac.
verses.english: Iphedeiah and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.

verses.latin: Samsarai, et Saarai, et Gotholia,
verses.english: Shamsherai, Shehariah, and Athaliah.

verses.latin: Zebedia, et Melluch, et Salmasi, filii Jeroham.
verses.english: Jereshiah, Eliah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.

verses.latin: Hi principes familiarum et stirpium suarum: hi habitaverunt in Jerusalem.
verses.english: These were the chiefs of the families and their lineages. These chiefs dwelt in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: In Gabaon autem habitaverunt pater Gabaon, et nomen uxoris ejus Maacha:
verses.english: Now, in Gibeon, the father, or founder, of Gibeon dwelt, and the name of his wife was Maachah.

verses.latin: et filius ejus primogenitus Abdon, et Sur, et Cis, et Baal, et Nadab,
verses.english: And his firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, and Nadab.

verses.latin: Gedor quoque, et Ahio, et Zacher.
verses.english: Also Gedor, Ahio, and Zecher.

verses.latin: Et Macelloth genuit Samaa: isti habitaverunt ex adverso fratres suos in Jerusalem, cum fratribus suis.
verses.english: And Mikloth fathered Shimeah. These lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem, within the community of their brothers.

verses.latin: Porro Ner genuit Cis, et Cis genuit Saul, et Saul genuit Jonathan, et Melchisua, et Abinadab, et Esbaal.
verses.english: Furthermore, Ner fathered Kish. Kish fathered Saul. And Saul fathered Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

verses.latin: Et filius Jonathan, Meribbaal: et Meribbaal genuit Micha.
verses.english: And Jonathan's son was Meribbaal. And Meribbaal fathered Micah.

verses.latin: Filii autem Micha, Phithon, et Melech, et Tharaa, et Ahaz.
verses.english: Now the sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

verses.latin: Et Ahaz genuit Joada, et Joada genuit Alemeth, et Azmoth, et Zamri: et Zamri genuit Mosa,
verses.english: And Ahaz fathered Jehoaddah. And Jehoaddah fathered Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. And Zimri fathered Moza.

verses.latin: et Mosa genuit Banaa, qui fuit pater Rapha: et Rapha genuit Elasa, et Elasa genuit Azel.
verses.english: And Moza fathered Binea, who was the father of Rapha. And Rapha fathered Eleasah. And Eleasah fathered Azel.

verses.latin: Huic autem Azel sex filii fuerunt, nomina eorum Azricam, Bocru, Ismael, Saraia, Abdia, Anan: omnes hi filii Azel.
verses.english: Now Azel had six sons. Their names were Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.

verses.latin: Filii autem Esec fratris ejus, Ulam primogenitus, Jehus secundus, Eliphalet tertius.
verses.english: Now the sons of Eshek, his brother, were Ulam his firstborn, Jeush his second, and Eliphelet his third.

verses.latin: Fuerunt autem filii Ulam viri robustissimi et ducentes sagittas: et habentes plurimos filios, et nepotes usque ad centum quinquaginta. Omnes hi de filiis Benjamin.
verses.english: Now the sons of Ulam were exceptionally strong men and skilled archers. They had many sons and descendants, up to one hundred and fifty in number. All these were from the sons of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et omnis Israel numeratus est, et continetur in sermonibus libri regum Judae et Israel: et translati sunt in Babylonem propter iniquitates suas.
verses.english: And all of Israel was counted and their records are found in the books of the kings of Judah and Israel; and they were taken away as exiles to Babylon because of their sins.

verses.latin: Et principes qui habitaverunt in civitatibus et in possessionibus suis, sunt isti: Israelitae, sacerdotes, Levitae, et Nathinaei.
verses.english: The first people to resettle in their cities and lands were these leaders: the Israelites, the priests, the Levites, and the Nethinim.

verses.latin: In Jerusalem autem habitaverunt de filiis Juda, et de filiis Benjamin, et de filiis Ephraim, et Manasse.
verses.english: In Jerusalem itself, the following groups lived: some from the children of Judah, and some from the children of Benjamin, and some from the children of Ephraim and Manasseh.

verses.latin: Uthai filius Ammiud, filii Amri, filii Omrai, filii Bana, de filiis Phares, filii Juda.
verses.english: Uthai, son of Ammiud, son of Omri, son of Bana, from the children of Perez, son of Judah.

verses.latin: Et de Siloni, Asaia primogenitus, et filii ejus.
verses.english: And from the line of Shelah, there was Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.

verses.latin: De filiis autem Zara, Jehuel, et fratres ejus, sexcenti nonaginta.
verses.english: From the children of Zerah, there was Jeuel, and his six hundred and ninety brothers.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Benjamin: Sallu filius Mosollam, filii Oduia, filii Asana.
verses.english: And from the children of Benjamin: Sallu, son of Meshullam, son of Hodaviah, son of Hassenuah.

verses.latin: Et Jebania filius Jeroham, et Ela filius Ozi, filii Mochori, et Mosollam filius Saphatiae, filii Rahuel, filii Jebaniae.
verses.english: And Ibneiah, son of Jeroham; and Elah, son of Uzzi, son of Michri; and Meshullam, son of Shephathiah, son of Reuel, son of Ibnijah.

verses.latin: Et fratres eorum per familias suas, nongenti quinquaginta sex: omnes isti principes familiarum secundum domos suas.
verses.english: And their brothers, according to their family lines, numbered nine hundred and fifty-six. All these were heads of households, according to their family units.

verses.latin: Et de sacerdotibus: Jedaia, Jojarib, Jachin.
verses.english: And among the priests were: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin.

verses.latin: Et Azarias filius Helciae, filii Mosollam, filii Sadoc, filii Meraioth, filii Achitob, princeps domus Dei.
verses.english: And Azariah, son of Hilkiah, son of Meshullam, son of Zadok, son of Meraioth, son of Ahitub, who was the ruler of the House of God.

verses.latin: Adaia quoque filius Jeroham, filii Phasor, filii Melchiae: et Maasai filius Adiel, filii Jezra, filii Mosollam, filii Mosollamith, filii Emmer.
verses.english: Also Adaiah, son of Jeroham, son of Pashhur, son of Malchijah; and Maasai, son of Adiel, son of Jahzerah, son of Meshullam, son of Meshillemith, son of Immer.

verses.latin: Et fratres eorum principes familiarum, mille septingenti sexaginta, fortissimi robore ad opus ministerii domus Dei.
verses.english: And their brothers, who were heads of households, numbered one thousand seven hundred and sixty. They were very mighty in strength for the work of the service of the House of God.

verses.latin: De Levitis vero: Semeia filius Hassub, filii Azaricam, filii Hasabiae de filiis Merari.
verses.english: Now from the Levites: Shemaiah, son of Hasshub, son of Azrikam, son of Hashabiah, from the children of Merari.

verses.latin: Bacbacar, Heres, Galal, Mathania filius Micha, filii Zechri, filii Asaph.
verses.english: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal; Mattaniah, son of Micah, son of Zichri, son of Asaph.

verses.latin: Et Obdia filius Semeia, filii Galal, filii Idithun: et Barachia filius Asa, filii Elcana, qui habitavit in atriis Nethuphati.
verses.english: And Obadiah, son of Shemaiah, son of Galal, son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah, son of Asa, son of Elkanah, who lived in the settlements of Netophah.

verses.latin: Janitores autem: Sellum, et Accub, et Telmon, et Ahiman: et fratres eorum: Sellum princeps.
verses.english: Now the gatekeepers were: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, and Ahiman. And their brothers; Shallum was their chief.

verses.latin: Usque nunc in porta regis ad orientem, ipsi fuerunt per vices suas janitores filiorum Levi.
verses.english: Until now, they were the gatekeepers at the King's Gate, which is to the east, serving in their assigned shifts, these sons of Levi.

verses.latin: Porro Sellum filius Core, filii Abiasaph, filii Core, cum fratribus suis et domo patris sui: Coreitae super opera ministerii, custodes liminum tabernaculi: et familiae eorum per vices suas erant ad custodias castrorum Domini.
verses.english: Furthermore, Shallum, son of Kore, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah—with his brothers and his father's household, the Korahites—they were in charge of the work of the ministry, as guardians of the thresholds of the tabernacle. And their family lines, in their assigned shifts, were responsible for guarding the Lord's encampment.

verses.latin: Phinees autem filius Eleazar erat dux super eos ante Dominum.
verses.english: Now Phinehas, son of Eleazar, was their leader before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et Zacharias filius Mosollamia janitor portae tabernaculi foederis.
verses.english: And Zechariah, son of Meshelemiah, was the gatekeeper of the entrance to the Tabernacle of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Omnes hi electi janitores per portas, ducenti duodecim: et divisi in villis suis, quos constituerunt David et Samuel propheta in fide sua.
verses.english: All these chosen gatekeepers for the entrances numbered two hundred and twelve. They were assigned to their own villages, whom David and Samuel the prophet had appointed in their faithfulness to God.

verses.latin: Tam ipsi, quam filii eorum per portas Domini, et tabernaculum custodiis agebant.
verses.english: Both they themselves and their sons were responsible for guarding the entrances to the Lord's tabernacle.

verses.latin: Per quatuor ventos erant janitores: ad orientem, et occidentem, et aquilonem, et meridiem.
verses.english: The gatekeepers were stationed at the four cardinal directions: to the east, west, north, and south.

verses.latin: Fratres autem eorum in viculis suis morabantur, ut venirent per dies septem, et vice sua cum illis.
verses.english: Their brothers lived in their own villages so that they could come every seven days and take their shift with them.

verses.latin: Ipsi enim erant per fiduciam principes janitorum Levitici generis, et erant super thesauros, et super thesauros sanctorum.
verses.english: For these were the chief gatekeepers from the Levitical lineage, holding their positions by trust. They were also in charge of the treasuries, and of the sacred treasures.

verses.latin: Manebat autem super eos, ut aperirent ostia mane per singulos dies.
verses.english: It was also their duty to open the doors every morning.

verses.latin: De his erant et qui curam habebant vasorum ministerii: et inferebantur et efferebantur ad numerum.
verses.english: Some of them were also responsible for the vessels of ministry, and these were brought in and taken out by count.

verses.latin: De ipsis erant, qui et vasa sanctuarii, et universa vasa caereremoniarum, et similaginem, et vinum, et oleum, et thus, et aromata, custodiebant.
verses.english: Others among them were entrusted with the sacred vessels, and all the vessels for the ceremonial rites, as well as the fine flour, wine, oil, incense, and spices.

verses.latin: Filii autem sacerdotum, pigmenta unguenti faciebant.
verses.english: But it was the sons of the priests who prepared the mixtures of ointments.

verses.latin: Et Matthathias Levites primogenitus Sellum Coreitae, praefectus erat eorum quae in sartagine frigebantur.
verses.english: And Mattithiah, a Levite, the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with the preparation of the offerings baked on griddles.

verses.latin: Et de fratribus eorum filiorum Caath, erant qui panibus propositionis praeessent, ut semper novos facerent per singula sabbata.
verses.english: And some of their brothers, from the children of Kohath, were responsible for the bread of the Presence, making sure new loaves were prepared every Sabbath.

verses.latin: Hi sunt cantores, principes familiarum Levitarum, qui morabantur in exedris, ita ut die ac nocte jugiter suo ministerio deservirent.
verses.english: These are the singers, who were heads of Levitical households, and they lived in special chambers. They were continually serving in their ministry both day and night.

verses.latin: Principes familiarum Levitarum, per generationes suas et mansiones suas. Hi erant principes.
verses.english: These were the heads of the Levitical households, according to their generations and dwelling places. These were the chief men.

verses.latin: In Gabaon autem habitaverunt pater Gabaon, Jehiel: et nomen uxoris ejus Maacha.
verses.english: Now in Gibeon, Jeiel, the father of Gibeon, lived there; and the name of his wife was Maacah.

verses.latin: Filius ejus primogenitus Abdon, et Sur, et Cis, et Baal, et Ner, et Nadab.
verses.english: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, and Nadab.

verses.latin: Gedor quoque, et Ahio, et Zacharias, et Macelloth.
verses.english: Also Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.

verses.latin: Porro Macelloth genuit Samaa: isti habitaverunt e regione fratrum suorum in Jerusalem, cum fratribus suis.
verses.english: Mikloth begot Shimeam. These also lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem, with their brothers.

verses.latin: Ner autem genuit Cis: et Cis genuit Saul: et Saul genuit Jonathan, et Melchisua, et Abinadab, et Esbaal.
verses.english: Ner begot Kish; Kish begot Saul; and Saul begot Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

verses.latin: Et filius Jonathan, Meribbaal: et Meribbaal genuit Micha. Filius autem Micha, Phithon, et Melech, et Tharaa, et Achaz.
verses.english: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal; and Meribbaal begot Micah. And the sons of Micah were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

verses.latin: Igitur Philisthiim pugnabant adversum Israel: et fugerunt viri Israel ante faciem Philisthinorum, et ceciderunt vulnerati in monte Gelboe.
verses.english: So then, the Philistines were fighting against Israel. The Israelite soldiers fled from the Philistines and fell, wounded, on Mount Gilboa.

verses.latin: Persequentesque Philisthiim Saul et filios ejus, percusserunt Jonathan, et Abinadab, et Malchisua filios Saul.
verses.english: The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons, and they struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchisua, who were Saul's sons.

verses.latin: Et aggravatum est proelium adversus Saul: inveneruntque eum sagittarii, et vulneraverunt jaculis.
verses.english: The battle intensified against Saul, and the archers found him and wounded him with their arrows.

verses.latin: Et dixit Saul armigero suo: Evagina gladium tuum, et percute me: ne forte veniant incircumcisi isti, et illudant mihi. Et noluit armiger ejus, timore perterritus.
verses.english: Saul then said to his armor-bearer: 'Draw your sword and run me through, so that these uncircumcised enemies (the Philistines, viewed with religious contempt by the Israelites) don't come and mock me.' But his armor-bearer refused, utterly terrified.

verses.latin: Arripuit itaque Saul gladium, et irruit super eum.
verses.english: So Saul took his own sword and fell upon it.

verses.latin: Quod cum vidisset armiger ejus, videlicet mortuum Saul, irruit et ipse super gladium suum, et mortuus est.
verses.english: When his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he also fell upon his own sword and died.

verses.latin: Interrogantes autem omnes Israelitae, qui habitabant in campestribus, videntes quod fugissent viri Israel, et mortuus esset Saul, et filii ejus: dereliquerunt civitates suas, et unumquemque locum, et fugerunt. Veneruntque Philisthiim, et habitaverunt ibi.
verses.english: Now all the Israelites who lived in the valleys, upon seeing that the Israelite soldiers had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, abandoned their cities and every location, and fled. Then the Philistines came and settled there.

verses.latin: Die igitur altero, venerunt Philisthiim ut spoliarent interfectos, et invenerunt Saul, et filios ejus jacentes in monte Gelboe.
verses.english: So on the next day, the Philistines came to strip the dead, and they found Saul and his sons lying on Mount Gilboa.

verses.latin: Truncaveruntque caput ejus, et spoliaverunt eum armis, et mittentes in terra Philisthinorum, per gyrum, ut annunciaretur in simulacris idolorum, et in populis suis.
verses.english: They cut off his head and stripped him of his armor, and sent them throughout the land of the Philistines (to publicly announce their victory), to be displayed among the temples of their idols and to be shown to their own people.

verses.latin: Arma autem illius posuerunt in templo Astaroth, et caput affixerunt in templo Dagon.
verses.english: They placed Saul's armor in the temple of Astaroth (a pagan goddess), and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon (a pagan god).

verses.latin: Hoc cum audissent universi Jabes Galaad, quaecumque fecerant Philisthiim Saul,
verses.english: When all the inhabitants of Jabesh-Gilead heard this about everything the Philistines had done to Saul (their former deliverer),

verses.latin: Surrexerunt omnes viri fortissimi, et tulerunt cadavera Saul, et filiorum ejus, et attulerunt in Jabes, et sepelierunt ossa eorum sub quercu, quae erat in Jabes: et jejunaverunt septem diebus.
verses.english: All the bravest men rose up and took the bodies of Saul and his sons. They brought them to Jabesh and buried their bones under the oak tree that was in Jabesh. And they fasted for seven days (in mourning).

verses.latin: Mortuus est ergo Saul propter iniquitates suas, eo quod praevaricatus sit mandatum Domini, quod non custodivit: sed insuper et pythonissam consuluerit,
verses.english: So Saul died because of his sins: because he had transgressed the command of the Lord, which he had not kept, and moreover, he had even consulted a witch (a diviner, a practice forbidden by God).

verses.latin: et non speraverit in Domino: propterea interfecit eum, et transtulit regnum ejus ad David filium Isai.
verses.english: and had not trusted in the Lord. Therefore, the Lord killed him and transferred his kingdom to David, the son of Jesse.

verses.latin: Igitur universus Israël congregatus est ad David in Hebron, dicens: Ecce nos sumus os tuum, et caro tua.
verses.english: So then, all of Israel gathered to David in Hebron, saying, "Behold, we are your bone and your flesh," meaning we are your family and kin.

verses.latin: Jampridem quoque cum adhuc Saul regnaret, tu eras qui educebas et introducebas Israël: et Dominus Deus tuus dixit tibi: Tu pasces populum meum Israël, et tu eris dux super eum.
verses.english: Even long ago, while Saul was still reigning, you were the one who led Israel out to battle and brought them back. And the Lord your God told you: "You shall shepherd My people Israel, and you shall be their chosen leader."

verses.latin: Venerunt ergo universi majores natu de Israël ad regem in Hebron, et iniit David foedus cum eis in Hebron coram Domino: unxeruntque eum regem super Israël, juxta sermonem Domini in manu Samuel.
verses.english: So then, all the elders of Israel came to the king in Hebron. And David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the Lord. And they anointed him king over Israel, just as the Lord had spoken through Samuel.

verses.latin: Abiit quoque David et universus Israël in Jerusalem, haec est Jebus, ubi erant Jebusaei habitatores terrae.
verses.english: Then David and all of Israel went to Jerusalem—which is also called Jebus, where the Jebusites were living in the land.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque habitatores Jebus ad David: Non ingredieris huc. Porro David cepit arcem Sion, haec est civitas David.
verses.english: But the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, "You shall not enter here!" Nevertheless, David captured the stronghold of Sion, which is now known as the City of David.

verses.latin: Dixerat autem David: Quicumque percusserit Jebusaeum in primis, erit princeps et dux. Ascendit ergo primus Joab filius Sarviae, et factus est princeps.
verses.english: David had said earlier, "Whoever strikes down a Jebusite first will be made chief and a commander." So Joab, the son of Sarvia, went up first, and he became the chief.

verses.latin: Et habitavit David in arce, ob quam causam vocata est civitas David.
verses.english: And David lived in that stronghold, which is why it was called the City of David.

verses.latin: Aedificavitque urbem in gyro a Mello, usque in circuitu: porro Joab reliqua urbis instauravit.
verses.english: And David built up the city all around, from Millo and extending in a circle. Meanwhile, Joab restored the rest of the city.

verses.latin: Et grandis effectus est David, crescens et magnificans, et Dominus exercituum erat cum eo.
verses.english: And David became very great, continually growing and becoming more prominent, for the Lord of hosts was with him.

verses.latin: Hi quoque sunt principes fortium David, qui adjuverunt eum ut rex fieret in omni Israël, juxta sermonem Domini.
verses.english: These also are the chiefs of David's mighty men, who helped him become king over all of Israel, in accordance with the word of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et hic est numerus fortium David: Jasobaam filius Hachamoni, princeps inter triginta: hic levavit hastam suam super trecentos vulneratos una vice.
verses.english: And this is the number of David's mighty men: Jasobaam, the son of Hachamoni, who was chief among the thirty. He lifted his spear against three hundred men and wounded them all at one time.

verses.latin: Post hunc Eleazar filius patrui ejus Achoites, qui erat inter tres potentes.
verses.english: After him was Eleazar, the son of his uncle Dodo the Ahohite, who was among the three most powerful.

verses.latin: Hic fuit cum David in Phesdom, quando Philisthaei congregati sunt ad pugnam: et irruit campus in Philisthaeos, et erat ibi ager agri hordeaceus.
verses.english: He was with David at Pas Dammim, when the Philistines gathered for battle. And the field was full of Philistines, and there was a field of barley there.

verses.latin: Cumque in fugam versi essent populus a facie Philisthinorum, stetit in medio agri, et eruit eum: percussitque Philisthaeos, et salvavit Dominus per manum suam salutem magnam.
