verses.english: When the people had fled from the Philistines, Eleazar stood in the middle of the field and delivered it from the enemy. He struck down the Philistines, and the Lord saved them with a great salvation through Eleazar's action.

verses.latin: Descenderunt quoque tres de triginta principibus ad petram, in qua erat David, in spelunca Odollam, cum Philisthaei castrametati essent in Valle Raphaim.
verses.english: Moreover, three of the thirty chiefs went down to the rock where David was, in the cave of Adullam, while the Philistines were camped in the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Porro David erat in praesidio, et statio Philisthinorum in Bethlehem.
verses.english: David was then in the stronghold, and a garrison of Philistines was in Bethlehem.

verses.latin: Desiderabat ergo David, et aiebat: O si quis mihi daret aquam de cisterna Bethlehem, quae est in porta!
verses.english: So David longed for something and said, "Oh, if only someone would give me water from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!"

verses.latin: Et irruerunt tres per media castra Philisthinorum, et hauserunt aquam de cisterna Bethlehem, quae erat in porta, et asportaverunt ad David: et noluit bibere, sed libavit illam Domino,
verses.english: And the three mighty men broke through the middle of the Philistine camp and drew water from the well of Bethlehem, which was by the gate, and brought it to David. But he refused to drink it. Instead, he poured it out as a libation to the Lord.

verses.latin: dicens: Absit ut hoc faciam in conspectu Dei mei, et sanguinem istorum hominum bibam? quia in periculo animarum suarum attulerunt mihi aquam. Et ob hanc causam noluit bibere. Haec fecerunt tres fortissimi.
verses.english: David said, "Far be it from me to do this in the sight of my God! Shall I drink the blood of these men? For at the risk of their very lives they brought this water to me." And for this reason, he refused to drink it. These were the acts of the three most mighty men.

verses.latin: Abisai quoque frater Joab, ipse erat princeps trium, et ipse levavit hastam suam super trecentos interfectos, tantumque nomen habuit inter tres.
verses.english: Abisai, Joab's brother, was also chief of the three. He himself lifted his spear against three hundred men and killed them, and he had as great a reputation among the three as the others.

verses.latin: Et inter tres, secundus et illustrior fuit, et erat illis quasi dux: verumtamen usque ad tres primos non pervenerat.
verses.english: Among the three, he was second and more renowned, and he was like a leader to them. Nevertheless, he did not attain to the fame of the first three.

verses.latin: Banaias filius Jojadae viri fortissimi, qui a Cabseel multa opera gessit: ipse percussit duos leones Moab, et ipse descendit, et interfecit leonem in media cisterna nivea.
verses.english: Banaias, the son of Jojada, a most courageous man from Cabseel, accomplished many great deeds. He struck down two lion-like men of Moab, and he himself went down into a pit and killed a lion on a snowy day.

verses.latin: Et ipse interfecit virum, AEgyptium staturae incredibilis, habentem in manu hastam quasi liciatorium texentium: qui et descendit ad eum cum virga, et extorsit hastam quam tenebat, et interfecit eum hasta sua.
verses.english: He also killed an Egyptian of incredible stature, who had a spear in his hand like a weaver's beam. Banaias went down to him with only a staff, took the spear from him, and killed him with his own spear.

verses.latin: Haec fecit Banaias filius Jojadae, et inter tres potentes ipse erat nominatus,
verses.english: These things Banaias, the son of Jojada, accomplished, and he was renowned among the three most powerful men.

verses.latin: et inter triginta primus, verumtamen usque ad tres non pervenerat: posuit autem eum David ad aures suas.
verses.english: He was chief among the thirty, yet he did not attain to the fame of the first three. But David appointed him to his inner circle, meaning he became a close and trusted advisor.

verses.latin: Porro fortissimi exercitus erant, Asahel frater Joab, et Elchanan filius patrui ejus de Bethlehem,
verses.english: Now the bravest men of the army were Asahel, Joab's brother, and Elchanan, the son of his uncle Dodo from Bethlehem,

verses.latin: Sammoth Aroërites, Helles Phelonites,
verses.english: Sammoth the Harorite, Helles the Pelonite,

verses.latin: Ira filius Acces Thecuites, Abiezer Anathothites,
verses.english: Ira, the son of Acces the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,

verses.latin: Sobochai Husathites, Ilai Achoites,
verses.english: Sobochai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

verses.latin: Maharai Netophathites, Heled filius Baana Netophathites,
verses.english: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled, the son of Baana the Netophathite,

verses.latin: Ittai filius Ribai de Gabaath filiorum Benjamin, Banaia Pharatonites,
verses.english: Ittai, the son of Ribai, from Gibeah of the sons of Benjamin, Banaia the Pirathonite,

verses.latin: Hurai de torrente Gaas, Abiel Arbathites,
verses.english: Hurai from the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

verses.latin: Azmoth Bauramites, Eliaba Salabonites,
verses.english: Azmoth the Baharumite, Eliaba the Shaalbonite,

verses.latin: filii Assan Gizonites, Jonathan filius Sage Ararites,
verses.english: The sons of Assan the Gizonite, Jonathan, the son of Sage the Hararite,

verses.latin: Ahiam filius Sachar Ararites, Eliphal filius Ur,
verses.english: Ahiam, the son of Sachar the Hararite, Eliphal, the son of Ur,

verses.latin: Hepher Mecherathites, Ahia Phelonites,
verses.english: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahia the Pelonite,

verses.latin: Hesro Carmelites, Naarai filius Azbai,
verses.english: Hesro the Carmelite, Naarai, the son of Azbai,

verses.latin: Joël frater Nathan, Mibahar filius Agaree,
verses.english: Joel, Nathan's brother, Mibahar, the son of Hagri,

verses.latin: Selec Ammonites, Naharai Berothites armiger Joab filii Sarviae,
verses.english: Selec the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, who was the armor-bearer for Joab, the son of Sarvia,

verses.latin: Ira Jethræus, Gareb Jethræus.
verses.english: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite.

verses.latin: Hi quoque venerunt ad David in Siceleg, cum adhuc fugeret Saul filium Cis, qui erant fortissimi et egregii pugnatores.
verses.english: These are the ones who came to David in Ziklag while he was still fleeing King Saul, the son of Kish. These men were very strong and excellent fighters.

verses.latin: Intenti in arcum, et utraque manu fundis lapides jactantes, et sagittas dirigentes: de fratribus Saul de Benjamin.
verses.english: They were skilled with the bow and could sling stones and shoot arrows with either hand. These men were even from Saul’s own kinsmen, from the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.latin: Princeps Achiezer, et Joas filii Samaa Gabaathites: et Jaziel, et Pheleth, filii Azmoth: et Baracha, et Jehu Anathothites.
verses.english: The chief Aheizer, and Joas, sons of Samaa, from Gibeah; also Jaziel and Pheleth, sons of Azmoth; and Baracha and Jehu from Anathoth.

verses.latin: Samaias quoque Gabaonites fortissimus inter triginta et super triginta. Jeremias, et Jeheziel, et Johanan, et Jozabad Gederathites.
verses.english: There was also Samaia from Gibeon, who was the strongest among the thirty, and even above them in command. From Gederah were Jeremias, Jeheziel, Johanan, and Jozabad.

verses.latin: Eluzai, et Jerimuth, et Baalia, et Samaria, et Sephatia Haruphites.
verses.english: Eluzai, Jerimuth, Baalia, Samaria, and Sephatia, all Haruphites.

verses.latin: Celcana, et Jesia, et Azareel, et Joezer, et Jasabaam Carithim.
verses.english: Celcana, Jesia, Azareel, Joezer, and Jasabaam, all Carithites.

verses.latin: Et Joela, et Zabadia filii Jeroham de Gedor.
verses.english: And Joela and Zabadia, the sons of Jeroham, from Gedor.

verses.latin: Sed et de Gad, transfugerunt ad David cum lateret in deserto, viri robustissimi, et pugnatores optimi, armenta portantes scuti et contis: facies eorum quasi facies leonis, et veluces quasi capreæ in montibus:
verses.english: And from the tribe of Gad, men also deserted to David when he was hiding out in the desert. They were very strong men and excellent warriors, bearing shields and spears. Their faces were as fierce as lions, and they were as swift as gazelles on the mountains.

verses.latin: Ezer princeps, Obadias secundus, Eliab tertius.
verses.english: Ezer was their chief, Obadias was second in command, and Eliab was third.

verses.latin: Masmana quartus, Jeremias quintus.
verses.english: Masmana was fourth, and Jeremias was fifth.

verses.latin: Ethi sextus, Eliel septimus.
verses.english: Ethi was sixth, and Eliel was seventh.

verses.latin: Johanan octavus, Elzebad nonus.
verses.english: Johanan was eighth, and Elzebad was ninth.

verses.latin: Jeremias decimus, Machbanai undecimus.
verses.english: Jeremias was tenth, and Machbanai was eleventh.

verses.latin: Hi de filiis Gad principes exercitus: novissimus centum militibus præerat, et maximus mille.
verses.english: These men from the sons of Gad were commanders in the army. The least capable among them commanded a hundred soldiers, and the greatest among them commanded a thousand.

verses.latin: Isti sunt qui transierunt Jordanem mense primo, quando redundabant aquæ super ripas: et omnes fugaverunt qui morabantur in vallibus ad orientalem plagam atque occidentalem.
verses.english: These were the men who crossed the Jordan River in the first month of the year, when the waters overflowed its banks due to the spring floods. They drove away everyone who was dwelling in the valleys, on both the eastern and western sides.

verses.latin: Venerunt autem et de Benjamin, et Juda ad præsidia in quibus morabatur David.
verses.english: Some men also came from Benjamin and Judah to the strongholds where David was staying.

verses.latin: Egressusque est David obviam eorum, et ait: Si pacifice venistis ad me ut auxiliemini mihi, cor meum jungatur vobis: si autem insidiantes mihi pro adversariis meis, cum ego iniquitatem in manibus non habeam, videat Deus patrum nostrorum, et judicet.
verses.english: David went out to meet them and said: "If you have come to me peacefully to help me, then my heart will be united with you. But if you are here to betray me to my adversaries—even though I have done no wrong—then may the God of our fathers see it and judge you."

verses.latin: Spiritus vero induit Amasai principem inter triginta, et ait: Tui sumus, o David, et tecum, fili Isai: pax, pax tibi, et pax adjutoribus tuis: te enim adjuvat Deus tuus. Suscepit ergo eos David, et constituit principes turmarum.
verses.english: Then the Spirit of God empowered Amasai, who was a chief among the thirty, and he said: "We are yours, O David, and we are with you, son of Jesse! Peace, peace to you, and peace to all who help you, for your God truly helps you." So David received them and made them commanders of his troops.

verses.latin: Porro de Manasse, transfugerunt ad David, quando veniebat cum Philisthiim adversus Saul ut pugnaret: et non dimicavit cum eis, quia inito consilio remiserunt eum principes Philisthinorum, dicentes: Periculo capitis nostri revertetur ad dominum suum Saul.
verses.english: Furthermore, some men from the tribe of Manasseh also deserted to David when he was coming with the Philistines to fight against Saul. But David did not actually fight with the Philistines, because the Philistine princes, after careful deliberation, sent him away, saying, "He will surely turn back to his master Saul at the cost of our lives, endangering us."

verses.latin: Quando igitur reversus est in Siceleg, transfugerunt ad eum de Manasse, Ednas, et Jozabad, et Jedihel, et Michael, et Jozabad, et Eliu, et Silthai, principes millium in Manasse.
verses.english: Therefore, when David returned to Ziklag, men from Manasseh deserted to him: Ednas, Jozabad, Jediel, Michael, Jozabad, Eliu, and Silthai. These were commanders of thousands within the tribe of Manasseh.

verses.latin: Et ipsi auxilium præbuerunt David adversus latrunculos: omnes enim erant viri fortissimi, et facti sunt principes in exercitu.
verses.english: These men helped David against the marauders, for they were all very strong men and became commanders in David's army.

verses.latin: Sed et per singulos dies veniebant ad David quasi ad auxilium, donec fieret exercitus magnus, sicut exercitus Dei.
verses.english: And indeed, day by day, more men came to David, as if to offer help, until his army became very great—as numerous and formidable as the army of God Himself.

verses.latin: Iste est numerus principum exercitus qui venerunt ad David in Hebron, ut transferrent regnum Saul ad eum, juxta verbum Domini.
verses.english: This is the number of the commanders of the army who came to David in Hebron to transfer the kingdom from Saul to him, just as the Lord had promised.

verses.latin: Filii Juda portantes scutum et lanceam, sex millia octingenti expediti ad pugnam.
verses.english: From the sons of Judah, bearing shield and spear, there were six thousand eight hundred men, ready for battle.

verses.latin: De filiis Simeon, fortissimi ad pugnandum, septem millia centum.
verses.english: From the sons of Simeon, seven thousand one hundred very strong men, ready for battle.

verses.latin: De filiis Levi, quatuor millia sexcenti.
verses.english: From the sons of Levi, four thousand six hundred.

verses.latin: Et Jojada princeps de genere Aaron, et cum eo tria millia septingenti.
verses.english: And Jojada, a chief from the family of Aaron, and with him three thousand seven hundred men.

verses.latin: Sadoc quoque puer egregius, et domus patris ejus, principes viginti duo.
verses.english: And also Zadok, an excellent young man, came from the household of his father, bringing with him twenty-two commanders.

verses.latin: Et de filiis Benjamin fratribus Saul, tria millia: nam ex his plures adhuc sequebantur domum Saul.
verses.english: And from the sons of Benjamin, who were Saul's kinsmen, three thousand men came. This was significant because many more of the Benjaminites were still loyal to Saul’s household.

verses.latin: Porro de filiis Ephraim, viginti millia octingenti, fortissimi viri, clari in cognominibus suis.
verses.english: Furthermore, from the sons of Ephraim, there were twenty thousand eight hundred very strong men, each one distinguished by his reputation.

verses.latin: Et ex dimidia tribu Manasse, decem et octo millia, singuli per nomina sua, ut venirent et constituerent regem David.
verses.english: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh, eighteen thousand men came, each one specifically named and recognized, to make David king.

verses.latin: De filiis quoque Issachar, viri intelligentes tempora, ut scirent quid facere deberet Israël: principes eorum ducenti, et omnis reliqua tribus eorum, horum sequebatur imperium.
verses.english: From the sons of Issachar, there were men who understood the times, so that they knew exactly what Israel ought to do. Their commanders were two hundred, and the rest of their tribe followed their command.

verses.latin: Porro de Zabulon, tales qui egrederentur ad prælium, et starent in acie instructi omnibus armis bellicis, quinquaginta millia, adjuvantes David non in duplici corde.
verses.english: Furthermore, from the tribe of Zebulun, there were fifty thousand men, ready to go out to battle and stand in formation, fully equipped with all military weapons. They helped David with sincere and undivided hearts.

verses.latin: Et de Nephthali, principes mille, et cum eis ad pugnandum armati, triginta septem millia.
verses.english: And from Naphtali, there were one thousand commanders, and with them thirty-seven thousand armed men ready for battle.

verses.latin: De Dan quoque, expediti ad pugnam, viginti octo millia sexcenti.
verses.english: And from Dan also, twenty-eight thousand six hundred men, ready for battle.

verses.latin: Et de Aser, egredientes ad pugnam, et parati ad prælium, quadraginta millia.
verses.english: And from Asher, forty thousand men who were going out to battle and prepared for war.

verses.latin: Trans Jordanem vero de Ruben, et Gad, et dimidia tribu Manasse, centum viginti millia, instructi omnibus armis prælii.
verses.english: From beyond the Jordan River, from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, there were one hundred twenty thousand men, fully equipped with all the weapons of war.

verses.latin: Omnes isti viri bellatores expediti ad pugnandum, et præliantes in acie, venerunt in Hebron, integro corde, ut facerent regem David super omnem Israël: sed et universi reliqui ex Israël, erant una mente ut constituerent regem David.
verses.english: All these warriors, ready for battle and fighting in formation, came to Hebron with complete devotion to make David king over all Israel. Indeed, all the rest of Israel were of one accord and unanimous in their decision to make David king.

verses.latin: Fueruntque ibi cum David tribus diebus comedentes et bibentes: præparaverant enim illis fratres sui.
verses.english: They were there with David for three days, eating and drinking, for their brethren in the region had prepared an abundant feast for them.

verses.latin: Sed et qui juxta eos erant, et usque ad Issachar, et Zabulon, et Nephthali, afferebant panes in asinis, et camelis, et mulis, et bobus, ad vescendum, farinam, ficus, uvam passam, vinum, oleum, et boves, et oves in abundantia: gaudium quippe erat in Israël.
verses.english: Moreover, even those who lived near them, reaching as far as the tribes of Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, were bringing provisions on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen for them to eat: an abundance of flour, figs, raisins, wine, oil, cattle, and sheep. For there was indeed great joy throughout Israel.

verses.latin: Consuluit autem David omnes principes Israel, tribunos, et centuriones:
verses.english: Then David consulted with all the leaders of Israel: the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds.

verses.latin: et locutus est ad omnem cœtum Israel, dicens: Si placet vobis, et si a Domino Deo nostro egreditur sermo, mittamus ad reliquos fratrum nostrorum in universas terras Israel, et cum eis sacerdotes et Levitæ, qui sunt in suburbanis urbium, ut congregentur ad nos:
verses.english: He spoke to the entire assembly of Israel, saying: "If it pleases you, and if this plan is truly from the Lord our God, let us send messengers to the rest of our brothers throughout all the lands of Israel. Let us also send for the priests and Levites who live in the outlying settlements of the cities, so they may gather to us."

verses.latin: et adducamus arcam Dei nostri ad nos: siquidem in diebus Saul non quæsivimus eam.
verses.english: "And let us bring the Ark of our God here to us, because during the days of Saul, we did not faithfully seek its presence."

verses.latin: Et respondit universa multitudo ut ita fieret: placuerat enim sermo omni populo.
verses.english: The entire multitude responded that this should be done, for the plan was pleasing to all the people.

verses.latin: Congregavit ergo David cunctum Israël, a Nilo Ægypti usque dum ingrediatur Emath, ut adduceret arcam Dei de Cariathiarim.
verses.english: So David gathered all of Israel, from the Nile River in Egypt all the way to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the Ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.

verses.latin: Et ascendit David et omnis Israël in civitatem Cariathiarim, quæ est in Juda, ut afferrent inde arcam Domini Dei sedentis super Cherubim, ubi invocatum est nomen ejus.
verses.english: David and all Israel then went up to the city of Kiriath-jearim, which is in Judah, to bring from there the Ark of the Lord God—the one enthroned above the Cherubim, where His sacred Name had been invoked.

verses.latin: Et imposuerunt arcam Dei super plaustrum novum de domo Abinadab. Oza autem et fratres ejus minabant plaustrum.
verses.english: They placed the Ark of God on a new cart, taken from Abinadab’s house. Uzzah and his brothers were driving this cart.

verses.latin: David autem et omnis Israël ludebant coram Deo omni virtute in canticis, et citharis, et psalteriis, et tympanis, et cymbalis, et tubis.
verses.english: David and all Israel were celebrating before God with all their might, with songs, lyres, harps, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.

verses.latin: Cumque pervenissent ad aream Chidon, extendit Oza manum suam ut sustentaret arcam, quoniam boves lascivientes effuderunt eam.
verses.english: When they reached the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzzah extended his hand to steady the Ark, because the oxen had stumbled and nearly overturned it.

verses.latin: Iratusque est Dominus contra Oza, et percussit eum, eo quod tetigisset arcam: et mortuus est ibi coram Domino.
verses.english: The Lord became angry with Uzzah and struck him down because he had touched the Ark, and Uzzah died there before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et contrastatus est David eo quod Dominus percullerit Ozam: et vocavit locum illum Percussio Ozæ, usque in præsentem diem.
verses.english: David was deeply distressed that the Lord had broken out against Uzzah. So he named that place "The Striking of Uzzah"—a name it bears to this very day.

verses.latin: Et timuit David Deum in die illa, dicens: Quomodo possum in domum meam inferre arcam Dei?
verses.english: David greatly feared God on that day, saying: "How can I possibly bring the Ark of God into my own dwelling?"

verses.latin: Et ob hanc causam non intulit ad se, hoc est, in civitatem suam, arcam Dei, sed divertit in domum Obededom Gethæi.
verses.english: For this reason, David did not bring the Ark of God into his own city. Instead, he diverted it to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.

verses.latin: Mansit ergo arca Dei in domo Obededom in domo sua tribus mensibus: et benedixit Dominus domum Obededom, et omnia quæ illius erant.
verses.english: So the Ark of God remained in Obed-Edom’s house for three months, and the Lord blessed Obed-Edom's household and everything he owned.

verses.latin: Et misit Hiram rex Tyri nuntios ad David, et ligna cedrina, et artifices parietum, et artifices lignorum, ut aedificarent ei domum.
verses.english: Hiram, the king of Tyre, sent messengers to David, along with cedar timber, and skilled masons for building walls, and skilled carpenters for working with wood, so they could build a palace for him.

verses.latin: Intellexitque David quod confirmasset eum Dominus in regem super Israël, et sublevasset regnum suum super populum suum Israël.
verses.english: David then understood that the Lord had established him as king over all of Israel, and had raised his kingdom for the good of his people, Israel.

verses.latin: Accepit quoque David alias uxores in Jerusalem: genuitque filios et filias.
verses.english: David also took more wives in Jerusalem and fathered more sons and daughters.

verses.latin: Et haec nomina eorum, qui nati sunt ei in Jerusalem: Sammua, et Sobab, Nathan, et Salomon,
verses.english: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,

verses.latin: Jebahar, et Elisua, et Elpalet,
verses.english: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

verses.latin: Nogah quoque, et Napheg, et Japhia,
verses.english: Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia,

verses.latin: Elisama quoque, et Beeliada, et Elpalet.
verses.english: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphalet.

verses.latin: Audientes autem Philisthim quod unctus esset David rex super universum Israël, ascenderunt omnes ut quaererent eum: quod cum audisset David, egressus est obviam eis.
verses.english: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all of Israel, they all marched up to find him. When David heard of this, he went out to meet them.

verses.latin: Philisthim autem venientes, diffusi sunt in Valle Raphaim.
verses.english: The Philistines came and spread out across the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Consuluitque David Dominum, dicens: Si ascendam ad Philisthim, et si dabis eos in manu mea? Et dixit Dominus ad eum: Ascende, et dabo eos in manu tua.
verses.english: David asked the Lord, saying, "Should I go up against the Philistines? Will you deliver them into my hand?" The Lord said to him, "Go up, and I will deliver them into your hand."

verses.latin: Cumque ascendisset David in Baalpharasim, percussit ibi David eos, et dixit: Divisit Deus aquas per manus meas, sicut dividuntur aquae. Idcirco vocatum est nomen loci illius Baalpharasim.
verses.english: So David went up to Baal-perazim and defeated them there. David said, "God has broken through my enemies by my hand, like a bursting flood of water." Therefore, that place was named Baal-perazim, meaning 'Lord of Breakthroughs'.

verses.latin: Et reliquerunt ibi deos suos, quos combussit David igni.
verses.english: The Philistines left their idols there, and David had them burned with fire.

verses.latin: Instaurantes autem Philisthim, diffusi sunt in Valle Raphaim.
verses.english: However, the Philistines regrouped and spread out once more in the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.latin: Consuluitque rursum David Dominum: et dixit ei Dominus: Non ascendas post eos, sed circui eos, et veni eis ex adverso pirorum.
verses.english: David again consulted the Lord. The Lord said to him, "Do not go up directly after them. Instead, circle around them and attack them from opposite the pear trees.

verses.latin: Cumque audieris sonitum gradientis in vertice pirorum, tunc egredieris ad praelium: magnus enim Deus ante te egreditur, ut percutiat exercitum Philisthinorum.
verses.english: When you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the pear trees, then go out to battle. For God will go out before you to strike down the army of the Philistines."

verses.latin: Fecit ergo David sicut praeceperat ei Deus: et percussit exercitum Philisthinorum a Gabaon usque Gazer.
verses.english: So David did as God had commanded him, and they struck down the Philistine army from Gibeon all the way to Gezer.

verses.latin: Igitur nomen David divulgatum est in universis regionibus: et Dominus dedit terrorem ejus super omnes gentes.
verses.english: Thus, David's fame spread throughout all the regions, and the Lord caused dread of him to fall upon all nations.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque sibi domos in civitate David: et præparavit locum arcae Dei, et tetendit ei tabernaculum.
verses.english: King David also built his royal residences in the city of David. He also prepared a specific place for the Ark of God, and set up a tent to house it there.

verses.latin: Tunc dixit David: Non debet arcam Dei portare nisi Levitarum genus, quos elegit Dominus ad portandum eam, et ad ministrandum sibi usque in æternum.
verses.english: Then David declared: 'Only the tribe of Levi is permitted to carry the Ark of God, for the Lord chose them specifically to carry it and to serve Him as priests for all time.'

verses.latin: Et congregavit universum Israël in Jerusalem, ut afferretur arca Dei in locum suum, quem paraverat ei.
verses.english: King David assembled all the people of Israel in Jerusalem so that the Ark of God could be brought to the dedicated place he had prepared for it.

verses.latin: Congregavit quoque David sacerdotes et Levitas.
verses.english: David also specifically gathered the priests and the Levites.

verses.latin: De filiis Caath, Uriel princeps, et fratres ejus centum viginti.
verses.english: From the descendants of Kohath, Uriel was the chief, along with 120 of his kinsmen.

verses.latin: De filiis Merari, Asaia princeps, et fratres ejus ducenti viginti.
verses.english: From the descendants of Merari, Asaiah was the chief, along with 220 of his kinsmen.

verses.latin: De filiis Gersom, Joël princeps, et fratres ejus centum triginta.
verses.english: From the descendants of Gershom, Joel was the chief, along with 130 of his kinsmen.

verses.latin: De filiis Elisaphan, Semeia princeps, et fratres ejus ducenti.
verses.english: From the descendants of Elizaphan, Shemaiah was the chief, along with 200 of his kinsmen.

verses.latin: De filiis Hebron, Eliel princeps, et fratres ejus octoginta.
verses.english: From the descendants of Hebron, Eliel was the chief, along with 80 of his kinsmen.

verses.latin: De filiis Oziel, Aminadab princeps, et fratres ejus centum duodecim.
verses.english: From the descendants of Uzziel, Amminadab was the chief, along with 112 of his kinsmen.

verses.latin: Et vocavit David Sadoc et Abiathar sacerdotes, et Levitas Uriel, Asaiam, Joël, Semeiam, Eliel, et Aminadab.
verses.english: David then summoned the priests Zadok and Abiathar, along with the Levite chiefs Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eos: Vos qui estis principes familiarum Leviticarum, sanctificate vos cum fratribus vestris, ut adferatis arcam Domini Dei Israël ad locum quem ei paravi.
verses.english: He said to them: 'As the chiefs of the Levitical families, you must consecrate yourselves, along with your kinsmen. Then you are to bring the Ark of the Lord God of Israel to the place I have prepared for it.'

verses.latin: Quia non eratis præsentes, a principio percussit nos Dominus Deus noster.
verses.english: 'Our Lord God struck us down the first time we attempted to move the Ark, because you, the Levites, were not there to carry it as commanded from the beginning. It was not done according to the law.'

verses.latin: Sanctificati sunt ergo sacerdotes et Levitæ, ut afferrent arcam Domini Dei Israël.
verses.english: So the priests and the Levites consecrated themselves, preparing to bring the Ark of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: Et tulerunt filii Levi arcam Dei, sicut præceperat Moyses, juxta verbum Domini, in humeris suis in vectibus.
verses.english: And the sons of Levi carried the Ark of God, as Moses had specifically commanded according to the Lord's word, on their shoulders, using the carrying poles.

verses.latin: Dixitque David principibus Levitarum, ut constituerent de fratribus suis cantores in organis musicorum, nablis videlicet, et lyris, et cymbalis, ut resonaret in excelsis sonitus lætitiæ.
verses.english: Then David instructed the chiefs of the Levites to appoint singers from among their kinsmen to play musical instruments, specifically harps, lyres, and cymbals. This was so that the sound of rejoicing might echo loudly during the procession.

verses.latin: Constitueruntque Levitas Heman filium Joël, et de fratribus ejus Asaph filium Barachiæ, de filiis vero Merari, Ethan filium Cusai.
verses.english: So they appointed the Levite Heman, son of Joel; and from among his kinsmen, Asaph, son of Berechiah; and from the descendants of Merari, Ethan, son of Kushaiah.

verses.latin: Et cum eis fratres suos secundæ ordinis, Zachariam, et Ben, et Jaziel, et Semiramoth, et Jahiel, et Ani, Eliab, et Banaiam, et Maasiam, et Mathathiam, et Eliphele, et Micneiam, et Obededom, et Jehiel, portarios.
verses.english: And with them were their kinsmen of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, who served as gatekeepers and aids in the procession.

verses.latin: Porro cantores Heman, Asaph, et Ethan in cymbalis æneis concrepantes.
verses.english: The main singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan played loudly, clashing bronze cymbals.

verses.latin: Zacharias autem, et Aziel, et Semiramoth, et Jehiel, et Ani, et Eliab, et Maasias, et Banaias in nablis arcanis.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Zechariah, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah played on harps, specifically those tuned to 'Alamoth' – a high-pitched setting.

verses.latin: Et Mathathias, et Eliphele, et Micneias, et Obededom, et Jehiel, et Ozaziu in citharis præsidentes pro octava.
verses.english: And Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah led on lyres, playing 'for the octave' – likely referring to a lower pitch or bass accompaniment.

verses.latin: Porro Chonenias princeps Levitarum, prophetiæ præerat, ad præviam vocem, quod erat peritissimus.
verses.english: Furthermore, Chenaniah, the chief of the Levites, was appointed to lead the chanting of the hymns, specifically the 'prophetic' or inspired songs, as he was highly skilled in this musical direction.

verses.latin: Et Barachias et Elcana erant janitores arcæ.
verses.english: Berechiah and Elkanah were appointed to serve as doorkeepers for the Ark's tent.

verses.latin: Porro Sebania, et Josaphat, et Nathanaël, et Amasai, et Zacharias, et Banaias, et Eliezer sacerdotes, clangebant tubis ante arcam Dei: et Obededom et Jehías erant janitores arcæ.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the priests Shebaniah, Jehoshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer blew trumpets loudly before the Ark of God. Additionally, Obed-Edom and Jehiah served as doorkeepers for the Ark's tent.

verses.latin: Igitur David, et universi majores natu Israël, et tribuni, abierunt ad deferendam arcam fœderis Domini de domo Obededom cum lætitia.
verses.english: So King David, all the elders of Israel, and the military commanders went together to bring up the Ark of the Lord's Covenant from Obed-Edom's house with great joy.

verses.latin: Cumque adjuvisset Deus Levitas, qui portabant arcam fœderis Domini, immolata sunt septem tauri et septem arietes.
verses.english: Because God had granted success to the Levites who carried the Ark of the Lord's Covenant, seven bulls and seven rams were sacrificed in thanksgiving and expiation.

verses.latin: Porro David erat indutus stola byssina, et universi Levitæ qui portabant arcam, et cantores, et Chonenias princeps prophetiæ inter cantores: nanque et David indutus erat ephod lineo.
verses.english: King David was clothed in a robe made of fine linen. All the Levites who carried the Ark, as well as the singers, and Chenaniah, the chief of the chanting, were similarly clothed. David himself also wore a special linen ephod, indicating his priestly role in this religious ceremony.

verses.latin: Omnisque Israël ducebat arcam fœderis Domini in jubilo, et in sono buccinae, et tubis, et cymbalis, et nablis, et citharis.
verses.english: And all of Israel brought up the Ark of the Lord's Covenant with shouts of joy, to the sound of horns, trumpets, cymbals, harps, and lyres.

verses.latin: Cumque pervenisset arca fœderis Domini usque ad civitatem David, Michol filia Saul prospiciens per fenestram, vidit regem David saltantem atque ludentem, et despexit eum in corde suo.
verses.english: As the Ark of the Lord's Covenant reached the city of David, Michal, the daughter of Saul, looked out through a window. She saw King David dancing and celebrating with intense devotion and joy, and in her heart, she deeply despised him for it, considering it undignified for a king.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt arcam Dei, et posuerunt eam in medio tabernaculi, quod tetenderat ei David: et obtulerunt holocaustum et pacifica coram Deo.
verses.english: Then they brought in the Ark of God and placed it in the center of the tent that David had pitched for it. In that place, they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings to God.

verses.latin: Cumque complesset David offerens holocausta et pacifica, benedixit populo in nomine Domini.
verses.english: When David finished offering the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people of Israel in the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et divisit universis per singulos, a viro usque ad mulierem, singulis tortam panis, et partem assæ carnis bubulæ, et frixi olei: et abiit universus populus unusquisque in domum suam.
verses.english: And David distributed food to everyone in the crowd, both men and women. Each person received a loaf of bread, a portion of roasted beef, and a rich, sweet cake made with oil. After this, all the people returned to their homes.

verses.latin: Constituitque coram arca Domini de Levitis qui ministrarent jugiter, et in die, et nocte:
verses.english: Then David appointed specific Levites to minister continually before the Ark of the Lord, serving both day and night.

verses.latin: Asaph princeps, et secundus ejus Zacharias: porro Jehiel, et Semiramoth, et Jehiel, et Mathathias, et Eliab, et Banaias, et Obededom: et Jehiel super organa psalterii et lyras:
verses.english: Asaph was appointed as the chief minister, and Zechariah as his second. Additionally, Jehiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom served, with Jeiel being specifically in charge of the musical instruments like the psalteries and lyres.

verses.latin: Asaph vero tubis, et cymbalis, concinentibus in virtute magna:
verses.english: However, Asaph himself led with trumpets and cymbals, creating a powerful and harmonious sound.

verses.latin: Et Obededom et fratres ejus sexaginta octo, et Obededom filium Idithun, et Hosa janitores.
verses.english: Obed-Edom and his sixty-eight kinsmen were assigned roles, including Obed-Edom, son of Jeduthun, and Hosah, who served as gatekeepers.

verses.latin: Sadoc autem sacerdos, et fratres ejus sacerdotes, contra tabernaculum Domini in excelso quod erat in Gabaon:
verses.english: Meanwhile, Zadok the priest, and his kinsmen the other priests, served before the Lord's tabernacle that remained on the high place at Gibeon.

verses.latin: Ut offerrent holocausta jugiter mane et vespere, juxta omnia quæ scripta sunt in lege Domini, quam præcepit Israël.
verses.english: Their duty was to continually offer burnt offerings both morning and evening, in accordance with everything written in the Law of the Lord, which He had commanded to Israel.

verses.latin: Et cum eis Heman et Idithun, et reliqui electi, qui nominatim expressi fuerant, ad confitendum Domino, quoniam in æternum misericordia ejus.
verses.english: And with these priests at Gibeon were Heman and Jeduthun, along with the other chosen Levites who had been specifically appointed. Their role was to give thanks to the Lord, especially for His enduring mercy, which is eternal.

verses.latin: Porro Heman et Idithun canebant tubis, et cymbalis, et omni genere organorum musicorum.
verses.english: In this service, Heman and Jeduthun played trumpets, cymbals, and all kinds of other musical instruments, glorifying God.

verses.latin: Et intulerunt arcam Dei, et posuerunt eam in medio tabernaculi, quod tetenderat ei David: obtuleruntque holocausta, et pacifica coram Deo.
verses.english:
Then they brought in the ark of God and placed it inside the tent that David had set up for it.
Then they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.

verses.latin: Cumque complesset David offerens holocausta, et pacifica, benedixit populo in nomine Domini.
verses.english:
After David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings,
he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et divisit universis per singulos a viro usque ad mulierem, turam panis, et partem assae carnis bubulae, et frixam oleo similam.
verses.english:
And he distributed to everyone, from man to woman,
a loaf of bread, a portion of roasted beef, and flour cakes fried with oil.

verses.latin: Et constituit coram conspectu arcae Domini Levitas, qui ministrarent, et recordarentur operum Domini, et confiterentur, ac laudarent Dominum Deum Israël.
verses.english:
Then David appointed Levites before the ark of the Lord to minister there,
to commemorate the works of the Lord, to give thanks, and to praise the Lord God of Israel.

verses.latin: Asaph principem, et secundum ejus Zachariam: Jeiel autem, et Semiramoth, et Jeiel, et Mathathiam, et Eliab, et Banaiam, et Obededom, et Jeiel super organa psalterii et lyras: Asaph vero ut cymbalis sonaret.
verses.english:
Asaph was appointed as the chief, with Zechariah as his second.
Jeiel, Semiramoth, Jeiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel were put in charge of the psalteries and lyres.
Asaph himself was to sound the cymbals.

verses.latin: Banaiam vero, et Jaaziel sacerdotes, clangere tubis jugiter coram arca foederis Domini.
verses.english:
And Benaiah and Jahaziel, the priests,
were to blow the trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of the Lord.

verses.latin: In illo die præcepit David, ut gratiæ agerentur Domino per manum Asaph, et fratrum ejus.
verses.english:
On that day, David commanded that thanks be given to the Lord
through Asaph and his brethren.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino, et invocate nomen ejus: notas facite in populis adinventiones ejus.
verses.english:
Give thanks to the Lord, and call upon His name.
Make His deeds known among the peoples.

verses.latin: Cantate ei, et psallite ei: et narrate omnia mirabilia ejus.
verses.english:
Sing to Him, and sing praises to Him.
Recount all His wondrous works.

verses.latin: Laudamini in nomine sancto ejus: lætetur cor quærentium Dominum.
verses.english:
Glory in His holy name.
Let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice.

verses.latin: Quærite Dominum, et virtutem ejus: quærite faciem ejus semper.
verses.english:
Seek the Lord and His strength.
Seek His presence continually.

verses.latin: Recordamini mirabilium ejus, quæ fecit: signorumque illius, et judiciorum oris ejus.
verses.english:
Remember His wondrous works that He has done,
remember His signs, and the judgments from His mouth.

verses.latin: Semen Israël servi ejus: filii Jacob electi ejus.
verses.english:
O seed of Israel, His servants;
you sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.

verses.latin: Ipse Dominus Deus noster: in universa terra judicia ejus.
verses.english:
He is the Lord our God.
His judgments are throughout the entire earth.

verses.latin: Memento in sempiternum testamenti ejus: sermonis, quem mandavit in mille generationes.
verses.english:
Remember His covenant forever,
the word He commanded for a thousand generations.

verses.latin: Quod celebravit ad Abraham, et juramenti ejus ad Isaac.
verses.english:
The covenant He established with Abraham,
and His oath to Isaac.

verses.latin: Et statuit illud Jacob in præceptum, et Israël in testamentum æternum.
verses.english:
And He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,
and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.

verses.latin: Dicens: Tibi dabo terram Chanaan, funiculum hæreditatis vestræ.
verses.english:
Saying: 'To you I will give the land of Canaan,
the measured portion of your inheritance.'

verses.latin: Cum essent illi pauci numero, parvi, et coloni ejus.
verses.english:
When they were few in number, a small company,
and only sojourners in that land.

verses.latin: Et transierunt de gente in gentem, et de regno ad populum alterum.
verses.english:
And they wandered from nation to nation,
and from one kingdom to another people.

verses.latin: Non reliquit hominem nocere eis: et corripuit pro eis reges.
verses.english:
He allowed no one to oppress them,
and for their sake, He rebuked kings.

verses.latin: Nolite tangere Christos meos, et in prophetis meis nolite malignari.
verses.english:
'Do not touch My anointed ones,
and do no harm to My prophets.'

verses.latin: Cantate Domino omnis terra: annuntiate ex die in diem salutare ejus.
verses.english:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
Proclaim His salvation day after day.

verses.latin: Narrate in gentibus gloriam ejus: in cunctis populis mirabilia ejus.
verses.english:
Declare His glory among the nations.
Recount His wondrous works among all peoples.

verses.latin: Quoniam magnus Dominus, et laudabilis nimis: et horribilis super omnes deos.
verses.english:
For the Lord is great and greatly to be praised.
He is to be feared above all false gods.

verses.latin: Omnes enim dii gentium idola: Dominus autem cælos fecit.
verses.english:
For all the gods of the nations are idols;
but the Lord Himself made the universe.

verses.latin: Confessio, et magnificentia in conspectu ejus: fortitudo et jucunditas in loco ejus.
verses.english:
Confession and majesty are before Him.
Strength and joy are in His dwelling place.

verses.latin: Afferte Domino, familiæ gentium, afferte Domino gloriam et imperium.
verses.english:
Ascribe to the Lord, O families of the nations,
ascribe to the Lord glory and power.

verses.latin: Afferte Domino gloriam nomini ejus: tollite hostias, et venite in conspectu ejus: et adorate Dominum in decore sancto ejus.
verses.english:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due His name.
Bring offerings and come before Him.
Worship the Lord in His holy splendor.

verses.latin: Commoveatur a facie ejus omnis terra: ipse enim fundavit orbem terræ immobilem.
verses.english:
Let all the earth tremble before Him.
For He has established the world, so it cannot be moved from its purpose.

verses.latin: Lætentur cæli, et exultet terra: et dicant in nationibus: Dominus regnavit.
verses.english:
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth exult.
And let it be said among the nations: 'The Lord reigns!'

verses.latin: Fremant maria, et plenitudo eorum: gaudebunt campi, et omnia quæ in eis sunt.
verses.english:
Let the sea roar, and all that fills it.
Let the fields be joyful, and all things that are in them.

verses.latin: Tunc exsultabunt ligna silvarum a facie Domini: quia venit judicare terram.
verses.english:
Then all the trees of the forest will rejoice before the Lord.
For He comes to judge the earth.

verses.latin: Confitemini Domino, quoniam bonus: quoniam in sæculum misericordia ejus.
verses.english:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good.
For His mercy endures forever.

verses.latin: Et dicite: Salva nos Deus salutaris noster: congrega nos, et erue de gentibus: ut confiteamur nomini sancto tuo, et exultemus in laudibus tuis.
verses.english:
And say: 'Save us, O God, our Savior!
Gather us and deliver us from the nations.
So that we may give thanks to Your holy name and exult in Your praise.'

verses.latin: Benedictus Dominus Deus Israël ab æterno in æternum: et dicet omnis populus, Amen, et laudem Domino.
verses.english:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.
And let all the people say, 'Amen,' and 'Praise the Lord!'

verses.latin: Reliquit ergo ibi coram arca fœderis Domini Asaph, et fratres ejus, ut ministrarent in conspectu ejus jugiter per singulos dies.
verses.english:
So David left Asaph and his brethren there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord,
to minister continually before it, day by day.

verses.latin: Et Obededom, et fratres ejus sexaginta octo: et Obededom filium Idithun, et Hosa janitores.
verses.english:
And Obed-Edom with his sixty-eight brethren,
and Obed-Edom the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah, were appointed as gatekeepers.

verses.latin: Sadoc vero sacerdotem, et fratres ejus sacerdotes, coram tabernaculo Domini in excelso, quod erat in Gabaon.
verses.english:
But Zadok the priest, and his brethren, the priests,
were before the tabernacle of the Lord on the high place that was in Gibeon.

verses.latin: Ut offerrent holocausta Domino super altare holocausti jugiter mane et vespere, juxta omnia quæ scripta sunt in lege Domini, quam præcepit Israël.
verses.english:
So that they might offer burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering continually, morning and evening,
according to all that is written in the law of the Lord, which He commanded Israel.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum sedisset David in domo sua, dixit ad Nathan prophetam: Ecce ego habito in domo cedrina, et arca foederis Domini sub pellibus est.
verses.english: It came to pass that when David had settled into his own palace, he spoke to Nathan the prophet: 'Look, I am living in a house built with cedar wood, but the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord is still housed in tents.'

verses.latin: Et dixit Nathan ad David: Omnia quae sunt in corde tuo fac: quia Dominus tecum est.
verses.english: And Nathan said to David: 'Do everything that is in your heart, for the Lord God is with you in this.'

verses.latin: Factum est ergo in nocte illa, verbum Domini ad Nathan, dicens:
verses.english: Then, in that very night, a word from the Lord God came to Nathan, saying:

verses.latin: Vade, et loquere David servo meo: Haec dicit Dominus: Non aedificabis tu mihi domum ad inhabitandum:
verses.english: 'Go and speak to David, my servant, and tell him: 'This is what the Lord God says: You are not the one who will build a house for me to dwell in.'

verses.latin: Neque enim mansi in domo ex quo eduxi Israel usque in hanc diem: sed fui semper circumferens in tabernaculo, et in alio tentorio.
verses.english: For I have not lived in a house from the day I led Israel out of Egypt until this very day. Instead, I have always been moving around in a tent, even in another temporary dwelling.

verses.latin: Ubicumque transivi cum universo Israel, numquid locutus sum uni judicum Israel, quibus praeceperam ut pascerent populum meum, dicens: Quare non aedificastis mihi domum cedrinam?
verses.english: Wherever I traveled with all of Israel, did I ever speak a word to any of the judges of Israel—those I commanded to shepherd My people—and say, 'Why have you not built me a house of cedar?'

verses.latin: Nunc ergo sic dices servo meo David: Haec dicit Dominus exercituum: Ego tuli te de pascuis, de gregibus, ut esses dux super populum meum Israel:
verses.english: Now therefore, you shall say this to my servant David: 'This is what the Lord of hosts says: I took you from the pastures, from following the flocks, to be ruler over my people Israel.

verses.latin: Et fui tecum in omnibus, quocumque perrexisti: et interfeci omnes inimicos tuos a facie tua: et feci tibi nomen grande, juxta nomen magnorum qui sunt in terra.
verses.english: I have been with you wherever you went, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. I have made for you a great name, like the names of the most powerful people on the earth.

verses.latin: Et posui locum populo meo Israel: et plantavi eum, et habitabit ibi, et non turbabitur amplius: nec filii iniquitatis atterent eum, sicut a principio,
verses.english: Moreover, I have appointed a place for My people Israel, and I have planted them there. They will dwell in their own place and no longer be disturbed. Nor shall wicked people oppress them as they did at the beginning,

verses.latin: et ex diebus quibus judices praecepi tempori meo super populum meum Israel, et humiliabo omnes inimicos tuos: addebatisque quod Dominus aedificaturus esset tibi domum.
verses.english: ...and as they did from the days when I appointed judges over My people Israel. I will humble all your enemies. Furthermore, I declare to you that the Lord God Himself will build you a house —a lasting dynasty.

verses.latin: Cumque impleti fuerint dies tui, ut vadas ad patres tuos, suscitabo semen tuum post te, qui erit de filiis tuis, et stabiliam regnum ejus.
verses.english: And when your days are fulfilled, and you go to be with your fathers in death, I will raise up your offspring after you, who will be one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom firmly.

verses.latin: Ipse aedificabit mihi domum: et statuam thronum ejus usque in sempiternum.
verses.english: He it is who will build a house for My name—My Temple—and I will establish his throne forever.

verses.latin: Ego ero illi in patrem, et ipse erit mihi in filium: et misericordiam meam non auferam ab eo, sicut abstuli ab eo qui ante te fuit:
verses.english: I will be a father to him, and he will be a son to Me. I will not take away My mercy from him, as I took it away from the one who was before you.

verses.latin: sed statuam eum in domo mea, et in regno meo usque in sempiternum: et thronus ejus erit firmissimus in perpetuum.
verses.english: But I will establish him in My house—My dynasty and My Temple—and in My kingdom forever, and his throne will be most firm and enduring perpetually.

verses.latin: Juxta omnia verba haec, et juxta omnem visionem istam, sic locutus est Nathan ad David.
verses.english: According to all these words and according to this entire vision, so Nathan spoke to David.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est rex David, et sedit coram Domino: et dixit: Quis ego sum Domine Deus, et quae domus mea, ut ad tantum veneris me?
verses.english: Then King David went in and sat before the Lord God, and he said: 'Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my house—my family and dynasty—that you have brought me to such great honor?

verses.latin: Sed et hoc parvum visum est in oculis tuis Deus, et locutus es super domum servi tui in longinquum: et fecisti me quasi virum desuper, et elevasti me.
verses.english: Yet even this seemed a small thing in Your eyes, O God, for You have spoken concerning the house of Your servant far into the future. You have looked upon me as a man of high standing and have exalted me greatly.

verses.latin: Quid ultra potest ultra addere David, cum honoraveris servum tuum, et cognoveris eum?
verses.english: What more can David say to You, after You have so honored Your servant, and after You have intimately known him and his heart?

verses.latin: Domine propter servum tuum, et juxta cor tuum fecisti omnia haec magnalia, et ostendisti universa.
verses.english: O Lord, for Your servant's sake, and according to Your own heart's purpose, You have done all these great deeds and have revealed all these things.

verses.latin: Domine non est similis tui, et non est Deus absque te, ex omnibus quae audivimus auribus nostris.
verses.english: O Lord, there is no one like You, and there is no God besides You, according to all that we have heard with our own ears.

verses.latin: Et quae est alia gens in terra, sicut populus tuus Israel, quem abiisti ut redimeres, et faceres tibi nomen grande, et tremendum: ejiceres gentes a facie ejus?
verses.english: And what other nation on earth is like Your people Israel, whom You went forth to redeem for Yourself, to make for Yourself a great and awe-inspiring name, and to cast out nations from before them?

verses.latin: Et posuisti populum tuum Israel tibi in populum usque in aeternum: et tu Domine factus es eis in Deum.
verses.english: And You have established Your people Israel as Your own people forever, and You, O Lord God, have become their God.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo Domine sermo quem locutus es super servum tuum, et super domum ejus, firmetur in perpetuum: et fac sicut locutus es.
verses.english: Now therefore, O Lord, let the word that You have spoken concerning Your servant and concerning his house be established forever, and do as You have promised.

verses.latin: Et permaneat, et magnificetur nomen tuum usque in sempiternum, et dicatur: Dominus exercituum Deus Israel, Israel: et domus David servi tui permaneat coram te.
verses.english: Let it also remain, and let Your name be magnified forever, so that people will say, 'The Lord of hosts is truly the God of Israel!' And let the house of David Your servant remain established before You.

verses.latin: Tu enim Domine Deus meus, revelasti aurem servi tui, ut aedificares ei domum: et idcirco invenit servus tuus fiduciam, ut oret coram te.
verses.english: For You, O Lord my God, have revealed to Your servant's hearing that You intend to build him a lasting dynasty. Therefore, Your servant has found the confidence to pray before You.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo Domine, tu es Deus, et locutus es ad servum tuum tanta beneficia.
verses.english: Now, O Lord, You are God, and You have spoken such great and gracious promises to Your servant.

verses.latin: Et incipe benedicere domui servi tui in sempiternum: quia tu Domine benedixisti, et benedicta erit in perpetuum.
verses.english: And now, please begin to confirm Your blessing upon the house of Your servant forever, for You, O Lord, have indeed blessed it, and therefore it shall be blessed perpetually.

verses.latin: Post haec percussit David Philisthaeos, et humiliavit eos, et tulit Geth, et filias ejus de manu Philisthinorum.
verses.english: After these events, David struck down the Philistines and subdued them. He took Gath, along with its dependent towns, from the Philistines.

verses.latin: Et percussit Moab, et facti sunt Moabitæ servi David, offerentes ei munera.
verses.english: And he struck down Moab, and the Moabites became David's servants, offering him tribute.

verses.latin: Hoc quoque tempore percussit David Adarezer regem Sobal de Hemath, quando profectus est ut dilataret imperium suum usque ad flumen Euphraten.
verses.english: Also at this time, David struck down Hadadezer, king of Zobah (a region near Hamath), when Hadadezer was marching to extend his dominion as far as the Euphrates River.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo David ab eo mille quadrigas, et septem millia equitum, ac viginti millia virorum peditum: subnervavitque omnes equos curruum, exceptis centum curribus, quos reservavit sibi.
verses.english: So David captured from Hadadezer one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He then disabled all the horses of the chariots by cutting their hamstrings, except for the horses of one hundred chariots, which he kept for himself.

verses.latin: Venit autem et Syrus de Damasco, ut auxilium præberet Adarezer regi Sobal: et percussit David de Syris viginti duo millia virorum.
verses.english: When the Syrians from Damascus came to assist Hadadezer, king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of these Syrian soldiers.

verses.latin: Et posuit custodes in Syria Damasci: factusque est Syrus serviens David, et offerens munera. Adjuvabatque Dominus David in cunctis quæ gerebat.
verses.english: David then stationed garrisons in Damascus in Syria, and the Syrians became David's servants and brought him tribute. And the Lord helped David in everything he did.

verses.latin: Tulit quoque David arma aurea, quæ habebant servi Adarezer, et attulit ea in Jerusalem.
verses.english: David also took the golden shields that Hadadezer's officers had carried and brought them to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Nec non de Thebath et Chun, urbibus Adarezer, tulit David æs plurimum, de quo fecit Salomon mare æneum, et columnas, et bases æneas.
verses.english: From Tibhath and Cun, cities belonging to Hadadezer, David took a large quantity of bronze, from which Solomon later made the bronze sea (a large basin for the Temple), pillars, and bronze bases.

verses.latin: Audiens autem Thohu rex Hemath, percussisse David omnem exercitum Adarezer regis Sobal,
verses.english: When Tou, king of Hamath, heard that David had struck down the entire army of Hadadezer, king of Zobah,

verses.latin: misit Adoram filium suum ad regem David, ut salutaret eum, et congratularetur: eo quod pugnasset cum Adarezer, et percussisset eum. Siquidem Adarezer bellator erat Thohu: et omnia vasa aurea, et argentea, et ænea
verses.english: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and congratulate him because David had fought Hadadezer and struck him down (for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou). Hadoram also brought all sorts of vessels made of gold, silver, and bronze.

verses.latin: attulit ei. Statimque consecravit ea rex David Domino, cum argento et auro, quod tulerat de cunctis gentibus, tam de Idumæa, et Moab, et filiis Ammon, quam de Philisthim et Amalec.
verses.english: King David immediately consecrated these to the Lord, along with the silver and gold he had taken from all the nations he had conquered: from Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek.

verses.latin: Abisai quoque filius Sarviæ percussit Idumæos in Valle Salinarum decem et octo millia:
verses.english: Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, also struck down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

verses.latin: et posuit in Idumæa præsidia, ut esset Idumæa serviens David: salvavitque Dominus David in cunctis, ad quæ perrexerat.
verses.english: He then placed garrisons in Edom, so that Edom would be subject to David. And the Lord brought victory to David in everything he undertook.

verses.latin: Regnavit ergo David super universum Israël, et faciebat judicium atque justitiam cuncto populo suo.
verses.english: So David reigned over all of Israel, administering justice and righteousness to all his people.

verses.latin: Porro Joab filius Sarviæ erat super exercitum, et Josaphat filius Ahilud, a commentariis.
verses.english: Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was commander of the army, and Jehoshaphat, the son of Ahilud, was the royal recorder (keeper of official records).

verses.latin: Sadoc autem filius Achitob, et Ahimelech filius Abiathar, sacerdotes: et Susa, scriba.
verses.english: Zadok, the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech, the son of Abiathar, were priests. Shavsha (also called Shisha or Seraiah) was the secretary.

verses.latin: Banaias quoque filius Jojadæ super legiones Cherethi et Phelethi: porro filii David primi ad manum regis.
verses.english: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites (David's elite guard). And David's sons were the king's chief officials.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post haec, ut mortuus esset Naas rex filiorum Ammon, et regnaret filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: Now, after these events, Nahash, who was the king of the Ammonites, died, and his son succeeded him as king.

verses.latin: Dixitque David: Faciam misericordiam cum Hanon filio Naas, quia pater ejus fecit mecum misericordiam. Misit ergo David nuntios, qui consolarentur eum super obitu patris sui. Qui cum pervenissent in terram filiorum Ammon, ut consolarentur Hanon,
verses.english: Then King David said: 'I will show kindness to Hanun, the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.' So David sent messengers to comfort Hanun over the death of his father. When these messengers arrived in the land of the Ammonites to comfort Hanun,

verses.latin: dixerunt principes filiorum Ammon ad Hanon: Tu putas quod David honoris causa in patris tui memoriam miserit, qui te consolentur, et non potius ut explorent et investigent universam terram tuam, et postea subvertant?
verses.english: the princes of the Ammonites said to Hanun: 'Do you truly believe that David has sent these men to comfort you out of respect for your father's memory? Is it not rather that he sent them to spy out your entire land, to explore it, and then to overthrow it?'

verses.latin: Igitur Hanon abstulit servos David, rasitque et tonso ad medium barba omnium, et vestes eorum scidit usque ad nates, et dimisit eos.
verses.english: So Hanun took David's servants, publicly humiliated them by shaving off half of each man’s beard, and cutting their garments in half up to their buttocks. Then he sent them away.

verses.latin: Qui cum reversi essent, nuntiaverunt David omnia quae acciderant. Misit autem obviam eis, (graves namque erant valde,) et præcepit ut manerent in Jericho, donec cresceret barba eorum, et tunc reverterentur.
verses.english: When these men returned and reported everything that had happened to David, he sent people to meet them—for they were deeply disgraced and ashamed. David commanded them: 'Remain in Jericho until your beards have grown back, and then you may return.'

verses.latin: Videntes autem filii Ammon quod in contumeliam sibi egissent David, miserunt Hanon et conductores sexaginta millia pondera argenti, ut conducere sibi possent de Mesopotamia, et de Syria Maacha, et de Sobal currus et equites.
verses.english: When the Ammonites saw that they had made themselves offensive to David, Hanun and his officials sent sixty thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, from Aram-Maacah, and from Zobah.

verses.latin: Conduxeruntque sibi triginta duo millia curruum, et regem Maacha cum populo suo. Qui cum venissent, castrametati sunt contra Medaba. Porro filii Ammon congregati de urbibus suis, venerunt ad bellum.
verses.english: So they hired thirty-two thousand chariots and their warriors, along with the king of Maacah and his people. When these allies arrived, they encamped facing Medeba. Meanwhile, the Ammonites gathered their own forces from their cities and came out to battle.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset David, misit Joab et omnem exercitum virorum fortium.
verses.english: When David heard about this, he immediately sent Joab and his entire army of mighty warriors.

verses.latin: Egressique filii Ammon, direxerunt aciem juxta portam civitatis: reges autem qui advenerant, seorsum in campo steterunt.
verses.english: The Ammonites marched out and drew up their battle line by the city gate. The allied kings who had come to assist them took a separate position in the open field.

verses.latin: Igitur Joab, cernens bellum ex adverso et post tergum contra se fieri, elegit viros fortissimos de universo Israël, et instruxit illos contra Syros.
verses.english: Joab, seeing that the battle was arrayed against him both in front and behind, selected the strongest men from all of Israel and positioned them against the Arameans, or Syrians, as they were also known.

verses.latin: Reliquam vero partem populi dedit sub manu Abisai fratris sui, qui instruxit illos contra filios Ammon.
verses.english: He placed the rest of the Israelite people under the command of his brother Abishai, who arrayed them against the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Si vicerint me Syri, auxilii eris mihi: si autem filii Ammon superaverint te, ego auxiliabor tibi.
verses.english: Joab said to Abishai: 'If the Arameans prove too strong for me, then you must come to my aid. But if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will come and help you.'

verses.latin: Confortare, et agamus viriliter pro populo nostro, et pro urbibus Dei nostri: Dominus autem faciet quod in conspectu suo bonum est.
verses.english: 'Be strong! Let us fight courageously for our people and for the cities of our God. May the Lord do what is good in His sight.'

verses.latin: Igitur irruit Joab, et populus qui erat cum eo, contra Syros: qui statim fugerunt.
verses.english: So Joab and the people who were with him advanced to fight against the Arameans, who immediately fled before them.

verses.latin: Porro filii Ammon, videntes quod fugissent Syri, ipsi quoque fugerunt a facie Abisai fratris ejus, et ingressi sunt civitatem. Reversusque Joab in Jerusalem.
verses.english: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they themselves also fled from Abishai, Joab's brother, and retreated into their city. Then Joab returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Videns autem Syrus quod cecidisset coram Israël, misit nuntios, et adduxit Syros qui erant trans flumen: Sobach quoque princeps militiæ Adarezer, erat dux eorum.
verses.english: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated before Israel, they sent messengers and brought out the Arameans who were beyond the Euphrates River. Shobach, the commander of Hadadezer’s army, was leading them.

verses.latin: Quod cum nuntiatum esset David, congregavit universum Israël, et transiit Jordanem, et irruit in eos, et instruxit aciem contra illos. Ingressoque David adversum Syros in prælium, pugnaverunt contra eum.
verses.english: When this was reported to David, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan River, and advanced against them. He drew up his battle line against them. When David entered the battle against the Arameans, they fought against him.

verses.latin: Fugeruntque Syri a facie Israël: et interfecit David de Syris septem millia curruum, et quadraginta millia peditum, et Sobach principem militiæ eorum interfecit.
verses.english: The Arameans fled before Israel. David killed seven thousand of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers, and he also killed Shobach, their army commander.

verses.latin: Videntes autem servi Adarezer se esse ab Israël superatos, spoponderunt ei foedus, et servierunt illi. Nolueruntque ultra Syri auxilium præbere filiis Ammon.
verses.english: When Hadadezer's servants saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made a treaty with David and submitted to him. After this, the Arameans were no longer willing to help the Ammonites.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post annum, eo tempore quo solent reges ad bella procedere, eduxit Joab exercitum et vastavit terram filiorum Ammon: et venit et obsedit Rabba: David autem manebat in Jerusalem, quando percussit Joab Rabba, et destruxit eam.
verses.english: Now, it happened after a year had passed, at the time when kings usually go out to wage war, Joab led out the army and devastated the land of the sons of Ammon. Then he came and besieged Rabbah. But David remained in Jerusalem, while Joab attacked Rabbah and utterly destroyed it.

verses.latin: Tulit ergo David coronam Melchom de capite ejus, et invenit in ea auri pondus talentorum singulorum, et lapides pretiosissimos: fecitque David sibi ex ea diadema, et spolia civitatis asportavit multa.
verses.english: So David took the crown of Milcom from the Ammonite king's head. He found in it a weight of a single talent of gold, along with very precious stones. David then made a diadem for himself from it, and he carried away much spoil from the city.

verses.latin: Populum quoque qui erat in ea, eduxit, et fecit super eos tribulas et trahas et serras ferreas, et minora ferramentorum genera, quibus succiduntur arbores: sic fecit David cunctis urbibus filiorum Ammon. Et reversus est David et omnis exercitus in Jerusalem.
verses.english: He also brought out the people who were in the city, and he put them to forced labor with threshing sledges, iron wagons, and iron saws, and with various smaller iron tools used for cutting down trees. Thus David did to all the cities of the sons of Ammon. And David returned with all the army to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Post haec contigit bellum in Gazer, adversum Philisthaeos: tunc percussit Sobochai Husathites Saphai de genere Raphaim, et humiliati sunt.
verses.english: After these things, a war happened in Gezer against the Philistines. Then Sibbechai the Hushathite struck down Sippai, who was one of the descendants of the Rephaim, and the Philistines were humbled in defeat.

verses.latin: Aliud quoque fuit bellum adversus Philisthaeos, in quo percussit Eldadan filius Saltus fratrem Goliath Gethaei, cujus hastae lignum erat quasi liciatorium texentium.
verses.english: There was also another war against the Philistines, in which Eldadan, the son of the Forest, struck down Goliath's brother, the Gittite. The shaft of Goliath's brother's spear was like a weaver's beam.

verses.latin: Fuit quoque et aliud bellum in Geth, in quo vir procerae staturae, qui habebat senos digitos, id est, viginti quatuor, et hic de genere Raphaim.
verses.english: There was also another war in Gath, in which there was a man of great stature. He had six fingers on each hand, making twenty-four fingers in total. And this man also was a descendant of the Rephaim.

verses.latin: Hic blasphemavit Israël: percussit autem eum Jonathas filius Samaa fratris David.
verses.english: This man blasphemed Israel. But Jonathan, the son of Shimei, David's brother, struck him down.

verses.latin: Hi sunt de genere Raphaim in Geth, qui ceciderunt in manu David et servorum ejus.
verses.english: These were among the descendants of the Rephaim in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and his servants.

verses.latin: Surrexit autem Satan contra Israël: et incitavit David ut numeraret Israël.
verses.english: But Satan, the spiritual enemy of God and His people, rose up against Israel, and he provoked King David to count the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Joab et principes populi: Ite, numerate Israël a Bersabee usque Dan, et adferte mihi numerum, ut sciam.
verses.english: And King David said to Joab, the commander of his army, and to the other leaders of the people: 'Go, count all the men of Israel, from Beer-sheba in the south to Dan in the north, and bring the count back to me, so that I may know the total number.'

verses.latin: Responditque Joab: Addat Dominus super populum suum, sicut nunc est, centuplum: nonne, domine mi rex, omnes servi tui sunt? Quare hoc quærit dominus meus, quod in peccatum reputetur Israël?
verses.english: But Joab answered: 'May the Lord increase His people a hundred times over what they are now! My lord the king, are they not all your servants? Why does my lord seek to do this, which will be counted as a sin against Israel?'

verses.latin: Sed sermo regis magis prævaluit: et egressus est Joab, lustravitque Israël, et reversus est in Jerusalem.
verses.english: However, the king's command prevailed and was more powerful than Joab's objection. So Joab went out and travelled throughout Israel, taking a census, and then returned to Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo Joab numerum ad David eorum, quos inlustraverat: et inventus est universi Israël numerus, mille millia et centum millia virorum educentium gladium: de Juda vero quadringenta septuaginta millia bellatorum.
verses.english: Therefore, Joab gave to David the total number of the men he had counted. The total number found in all of Israel was one million one hundred thousand men who could draw the sword; and in the tribe of Judah alone there were four hundred seventy thousand fighting men.

verses.latin: Levi autem et Benjamin non numeravit: quia execrabatur Joab imperium regis.
verses.english: But Joab did not count the tribes of Levi and Benjamin, because Joab considered the king's order to be an abomination and an error.

verses.latin: Et displicuit Deo sermo, et percussit Israël.
verses.english: And this matter, this counting of the people by David, was displeasing to God, and because of it, God struck down the people of Israel with a plague.

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad Deum: Peccavi nimis, quod hoc feci: obsecro, aufer iniquitatem servi tui, quia insipienter egi.
verses.english: And David said to God: 'I have sinned grievously by doing this. I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant, because I have acted very foolishly.'

verses.latin: Et locutus est Dominus ad Gad videntem David, dicens:
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Gad, who was David's prophet and seer, saying:

verses.latin: Vade, et loquere ad David, dicens: Hæc dicit Dominus: Trium tibi optionem do: elige unum quod volueris, et faciam tibi.
verses.english: 'Go and speak to David, saying: "Thus says the Lord: 'I offer you three choices. Choose one of them that you desire, and I will do it to you.'"'

verses.latin: Cumque venisset Gad ad David, dixit ei: Hæc dicit Dominus: Elige quod volueris:
verses.english: When Gad came to King David, he said to him: 'Thus says the Lord: "Choose what you desire from these options:"'

verses.latin: Aut tribus annis famem: aut tribus mensibus fugere te hostes tuos, et gladium adversariorum non posse evadere: aut tribus diebus gladium Domini, et pestilentiam versari in terra, et angelum Domini interficere in universis finibus Israël. Nunc igitur vide quid respondeas ei qui misit me.
verses.english: 'Either three years of famine; or for three months you flee from your enemies, and the sword of your adversaries cannot be escaped; or for three days, the sword of the Lord, and a plague to spread throughout the land, and the angel of the Lord to kill throughout all the borders of Israel. Therefore, now consider what answer you will give to Him who sent me.'

verses.latin: Et ait David ad Gad: Angustia coarctor nimis: sed melius est ut incidam in manus Domini, quia multæ sunt misericordiæ ejus, quam in manus hominum.
verses.english: And David said to Gad: 'I am in very great distress and confined by these choices. But it is better that I fall into the hands of the Lord, because His mercies are many, rather than fall into the hands of men.'

verses.latin: Igitur immisit Dominus pestilentiam in Israël: et ceciderunt de Israël septuaginta millia virorum.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord sent a plague upon Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel died.

verses.latin: Et misit angelum Deus in Jerusalem, ut percuteret eam: cumque percuteretur, vidit Dominus, et misertus est super multitudinem, et præcepit Angelo percutienti: Jam sufficit, cesset manus tua. Porro angelus Domini stabat juxta aream Ornan Jebusæi.
verses.english: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to strike it. And as it was being struck, the Lord saw, and He had compassion on the multitude of people, and He commanded the angel who was striking them: 'It is enough now; stop your hand.' Indeed, the angel of the Lord was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

verses.latin: Et levans David oculos suos, vidit angelum Domini stantem inter terram et cælum, et gladium evaginatum in manu ejus, et extensorum super Jerusalem: et ceciderunt tam ipse quam majores natu, vestiti ciliciis, proni in terram.
verses.english: And David, lifting his eyes, saw the angel of the Lord standing between the earth and the sky, with his drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. And both David himself and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces to the ground.

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Deum: Nonne ego sum qui jussi populum numerari? ego peccavi, ego malum feci: isti greges quid commiserunt? Domine Deus meus, vertatur, obsecro, manus tua in me, et in domum patris mei: et in populum tuum non sit plaga.
verses.english: And David said to God: 'Was it not I who commanded the people to be counted? I am the one who sinned; I am the one who did wrong! These flocks, what have they committed? O Lord, my God, I beg you, let your hand be turned against me and against the house of my father, but let there be no plague upon Your people.'

verses.latin: Angelus autem Domini præcepit Gad, ut diceret David, ut ascenderet David, et constitueret altare Domino in area Ornan Jebusæi.
verses.english: Then the angel of the Lord commanded Gad to tell King David that David should go up and build an altar to the Lord on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

verses.latin: Ascendit ergo David juxta sermonem Gad, quem locutus erat in nomine Domini.
verses.english: So King David went up according to the word of Gad, which he had spoken in the name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Porro Ornan cum a converso aspiceret, vidit angelum, et quatuor filii ejus cum eo absconsi sunt. Ornan autem terebat triticum.
verses.english: Now Ornan, when he turned and looked around, saw the angel; and his four sons who were with him hid themselves in fear. Ornan himself was threshing wheat at the time.

verses.latin: Cumque veniret David ad Ornan, aspexit Ornan, et prosiliens de area, adoravit David pronus in terram.
verses.english: And when King David came to Ornan, Ornan looked up and, leaping from the threshing floor, he bowed down to David, prostrate on the ground.

verses.latin: Et dixit David ad Ornan: Da mihi locum areæ tuæ, ut ædificem in ea altare Domino: ita ut in justo pretio vendes illud mihi, et cesset plaga a populo.
verses.english: And David said to Ornan: 'Give me the place of your threshing floor, so that I may build an altar to the Lord there. You must sell it to me at its just price, so that the plague may cease from the people.'

verses.latin: Dixitque Ornan ad David: Tolle, et faciat dominus meus rex quod ei placet: sed et boves do in holocaustum, et tribulas in ligna, et triticum in sacrificium: omnia libens præbeo.
verses.english: And Ornan said to David: 'Take it, and let my lord the king do what pleases him. See, I also give the oxen for a burnt offering, and the threshing sledges for wood, and the wheat for the grain offering. I offer everything willingly.'

verses.latin: Et dixit rex David ad Ornan: Nequaquam, sed pretio emam a te: neque enim offerre tibi debeo holocaustum gratis Domino Deo meo. Emam igitur abs te pretio, et perficiam.
verses.english: But King David said to Ornan: 'No, not at all; I will surely buy it from you for a price. For I ought not to offer a burnt offering to the Lord my God that costs me nothing. Therefore, I will buy it from you for a price, and I will complete the sacrifice.'

verses.latin: Dedit ergo David Ornan sexcentos siclos auri recti ponderis.
