verses.english: So David gave Ornan six hundred shekels of pure gold by weight.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit ibi David altare Domino, et obtulit holocausta, et pacifica: et invocavit Dominum, et exaudivit eum in igne de cælo super altare holocausti.
verses.english: And David built an altar to the Lord there and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. He called upon the Lord, and the Lord answered him by sending fire from the sky upon the altar of burnt offering.

verses.latin: Et præcepit Dominus Angelo: et convertit gladium suum in vaginam.
verses.english: Then the Lord commanded the angel, and the angel put his sword back into its sheath.

verses.latin: Igitur cum vidisset David quod exaudisset eum Dominus in area Ornan Jebusæi, immolavit ibi victimas.
verses.english: Therefore, when David saw that the Lord had answered him on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.

verses.latin: Tabernaculum autem Domini, quod fecerat Moyses in deserto, et altare holocausti, eo tempore erat in excelso Gabaon.
verses.english: Now the Tabernacle of the Lord, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering, were at that time on the high place at Gibeon.

verses.latin: Et non poterat David ire ad adorandum ibi Deum, eo quod nimio timore perterritus esset, perterritus facie gladii angeli Domini.
verses.english: But David was not able to go there to worship God, because he was terrified by extreme fear, terrified by the sight of the sword of the angel of the Lord.

verses.latin: Constituit autem David locum templi Domini, et altaris holocausti.
verses.english: Then David designated the location for the Temple of the Lord, and for the altar where burnt offerings would be made.

verses.latin: Et præcepit ut congregarentur ad se advenæ, qui erant in terra Israel, et constituit ex illis cæmentarios, ut scinderent lapides et quadrados facerent ad ædificandum templum Dei.
verses.english: He then ordered all the foreigners living in the land of Israel to be gathered together. From among them, he appointed stonecutters to cut and square stones for the building of God's Temple.

verses.latin: Ferro quoque plurimo ad clavorum conjunctionesque tignorum, et ad cuncta opera præparavit David: et æris pondus immensum, quod ponderari non poterat.
verses.english: David also prepared a great quantity of iron for the nails, for joining the timbers, and for all the construction work; and an immense amount of bronze, so much that it could not even be weighed.

verses.latin: Cedros quoque absque numero: quia Sidonii et Tyrii multa cedrorum ligna attulerant ad David.
verses.english: He also prepared a countless number of cedar logs, because the people of Sidon and Tyre had brought many cedar timbers to David.

verses.latin: Dixitque David: Salomon filius meus parvulus est et tenellus, et templum quod ædificandum est Domino, tale esse debet ut in cunctis regionibus nominetur excelsum. Idcirco præparabo illi necessaria. Et hac de causa ante mortem suam præparavit omnia.
verses.english: And David said: "My son Solomon is still young and inexperienced, and the Temple that is to be built for the Lord must be so magnificent that it will be famous throughout all the lands. Therefore, I will prepare everything he needs for it." So, for this reason, David prepared everything before his death.

verses.latin: Et vocavit Salomonem filium suum, præcepitque ei ut ædificaret domum Domino Deo Israel.
verses.english: Then he called his son Solomon and commanded him to build a house for the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Dixitque David ad Salomonem: Fili mi, voluntatis meæ fuit ut ædificarem domum nomini Domini Dei mei:
verses.english: And David said to Solomon: "My son, it was my heartfelt desire to build a house for the Name of the Lord, my God."

verses.latin: Sed sermo Domini factus est ad me, dicens: Multum sanguinem effudisti, et plurima bella fecisti: non poteris ædificare domum nomini meo, nimio sanguine quem effudisti in terram coram me:
verses.english: "But the word of the Lord came to me, saying: 'You have shed much blood and fought many wars; therefore, you cannot build a house for My Name, because of the great amount of blood you have shed on the earth before Me.'"

verses.latin: Filius quippe nascetur tibi, qui erit vir quietissimus, et requiem dabo ei ab omnibus inimicis suis per circuitum: et Salomon vocabitur: et pacem et otium dabo in Israel cunctis diebus ejus.
verses.english: "'For a son will indeed be born to you who will be a man of rest, and I will give him peace from all his enemies on every side. His name will be called Solomon, which means peace, and I will grant peace and tranquility to Israel all his days.'"

verses.latin: Ipse ædificabit domum nomini meo: et ipse erit mihi in filium, et ego illi in patrem: et firmabo solium ejus super Israel in æternum.
verses.english: "'He is the one who will build a house for My Name, and he will be My son, and I will be his Father. And I will establish his throne over Israel forever.'"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, fili mi, sit Dominus tecum, et prosperare, et ædifica domum Domino Deo tuo, sicut locutus est de te.
verses.english: "Now therefore, my son, may the Lord be with you, and may you prosper as you build the house for the Lord your God, just as He spoke concerning you."

verses.latin: Det quoque tibi Dominus sapientiam et prudentiam, et possit regere Israel, et custodire legem Domini Dei tui.
verses.english: "May the Lord also grant you wisdom and understanding, so that you may be able to govern Israel and keep the law of the Lord your God."

verses.latin: Tunc enim dirigere poteris vias tuas, si custodieris mandata et judicia quæ præcepit Dominus Moysi super Israel: confortare et viriliter age, ne timeas, et nihil paveas.
verses.english: "For then you will be able to direct your ways successfully if you observe the commands and judgments which the Lord commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and act courageously; do not be afraid, and do not be dismayed by anything."

verses.latin: Ego vero in paupertate mea præparavi expensas domus Domini, auri talenta centum millia, et argenti mille millia talentorum: æris vero et ferri non est pondus, superabatur enim numero.
verses.english: "Indeed, in my humble efforts, I have prepared for the expenses of the Lord's house: one hundred thousand talents of gold, and one million talents of silver. As for bronze and iron, there is no weight that can be measured, for there was so much that it exceeded all counting."

verses.latin: Artifices quoque plurimos habes, cæmentarios, et lapicidas, lignarios, et omnium artium fabros.
verses.english: "Moreover, you have a great number of skilled workers: masons, and stonecutters, carpenters, and craftsmen for every kind of art and skill."

verses.latin: Auri, et argenti, et æris, et ferri non est numerus. Surge igitur, et fac: et erit Dominus tecum.
verses.english: "There is no end to the gold, silver, bronze, and iron. So rise up and begin the work, and the Lord will be with you."

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque David cunctis principibus Israel, ut adjucerent Salomonem filium suum, dicens:
verses.english: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to assist his son Solomon, saying:

verses.latin: Ecce Dominus Deus vester vobiscum est, et dedit vobis requiem per circuitum: et tradidit in manibus vestris omnes inimicos, et subjecta est terra coram Domino et coram populo ejus.
verses.english: "Behold, the Lord your God is with you. He has granted you rest on every side, and He has handed all your enemies into your hands, so the land is subdued before the Lord and before His people."

verses.latin: Præbete igitur corda vestra et animas vestras, ut quæratis Dominum Deum vestrum: et consurgite, et ædificate sanctuarium Domino Deo, ut introducatur arca fœderis Domini, et vasa sanctuarii Dei in domum quæ ædificatur nomini Domini.
verses.english: "Therefore, dedicate your hearts and your souls to seek the Lord your God. Rise up and build the sanctuary for the Lord God, so that the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord and the holy vessels of God's sanctuary may be brought into the house that is being built for the Name of the Lord."

verses.latin: Igitur David senex et plenus dierum, constituit Salomonem filium suum regem super Israel.
verses.english: Therefore, when David was old and had lived many years, he appointed his son Solomon to be king over Israel.

verses.latin: Congregavit omnes principes Israel, et sacerdotes atque Levitas.
verses.english: He gathered all the princes of Israel, as well as the priests and the Levites.

verses.latin: Numerati sunt igitur Levitæ a triginta annis et supra: et inventa sunt triginta octo millia.
verses.english: Therefore, the Levites were counted—those who were thirty years of age and older—and a total of thirty-eight thousand men were found.

verses.latin: Ex his fuerunt viginti quatuor millia, ut superent opera Domini, et ad officia ministrent:
verses.english: From these men, twenty-four thousand were assigned to oversee the work of the Lord's Temple and to serve in its duties.

verses.latin: porro sex millia, magistri et judices.
verses.english: Furthermore, six thousand were appointed as scribes and judges.

verses.latin: Quatuor autem millia janitores, et totidem psaltae canentes Domino in organis quæ fecerat ad canendum.
verses.english: And four thousand were gatekeepers, and another four thousand were singers, chanting praises to the Lord with the musical instruments that David had made for singing.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Levi secundum familias suas: Gersom, Caath et Merari.
verses.english: These are the sons of Levi according to their family lines: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

verses.latin: Filii Gersom: Ledan et Semei.
verses.english: The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.

verses.latin: Filii Ledan: princeps Jehiel, et Zethan, et Joel, tres.
verses.english: The sons of Ladan were Jechiel the chief, and Zetham, and Joel—three in total.

verses.latin: Filii Semei: Jaath, Sina, et Jehus, et Beria: isti filii Semei, quatuor.
verses.english: The sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah—these were the four sons of Shimei.

verses.latin: Fuit autem Jaath primus, et Ziza secundus: Porro Jehus et Beria non habuerunt filios plurimos, et idcirco reputati sunt in unam familiam, et in unam domum.
verses.english: Now Jahath was the firstborn, and Ziza was the second. But Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, and for that reason, they were counted as one family and one household.

verses.latin: Filii Caath: Amram, Isahar, Hebron et Oziel, quatuor.
verses.english: The sons of Kohath were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—four in total.

verses.latin: Filii Amram: Aaron et Moyses. Et segregatus est Aaron ut ministraret in Sancto sanctorum ipse, et filii ejus in sempiternum, et adolere thymiama Domino, ac ministrare illi, et benedicere nomen ejus in sempiternum.
verses.english: The sons of Amram were Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart, he and his sons forever, to minister in the Holy of Holies, to burn incense before the Lord, to serve Him, and to bless His name perpetually.

verses.latin: Moysi quoque hominis Dei, filii supputati sunt in tribu Levi.
verses.english: Moreover, the sons of Moses, the man of God, were also counted among the tribe of Levi.

verses.latin: Filii Moysi: Gersom et Eliezer.
verses.english: The sons of Moses were Gershon and Eliezer.

verses.latin: Filii Gersom: Subuel primus.
verses.english: The son of Gershon was Shebuel, the firstborn.

verses.latin: Filii Eliezer: Rehabia primus, et non fuerunt Eliezer filii alii. Porro filii Rehabia multiplicati sunt nimis.
verses.english: The son of Eliezer was Rehabiah, the firstborn. Eliezer had no other sons besides him. But the sons of Rehabiah multiplied greatly.

verses.latin: Filii Isahar: Salomith primus.
verses.english: The sons of Izhar were Shelomith, the firstborn.

verses.latin: Filii Hebron: Jeriau primus, Amaria secundus, Jahaziel tertius, Jecmaam quartus.
verses.english: The sons of Hebron were Jeriah, the firstborn; Amariah, the second; Jahaziel, the third; and Jekameam, the fourth.

verses.latin: Filii Oziel: Micha primus, Jesia secundus.
verses.english: The sons of Uzziel were Micah, the firstborn; and Jesiah, the second.

verses.latin: Filii Merari: Maheli et Musi. Filii Maheli: Eleazar et Cis.
verses.english: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli were Eleazar and Kish.

verses.latin: Mortuus est autem Eleazar, et non habuit filios, sed filias. Acceperunt igitur eas filii Cis fratres earum.
verses.english: Now Eleazar died, and he had no sons, only daughters. Therefore, the sons of Kish, their cousins, married them.

verses.latin: Filii Musi: Maheli, et Eder, et Jerimoth, tres.
verses.english: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth—three in total.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Levi in cognationibus et familiis suis, principes familiarum per vices suas, et numerum nominum singulorum capitum, qui faciebant opera ministerii domus Domini a viginti annis et supra.
verses.english: These are the sons of Levi in their clans and families, the heads of the families according to their divisions, and the count of the names of each individual, who performed the work of the service of the Lord's house, starting from twenty years of age and older.

verses.latin: Dixit enim David: Requiem dedit Dominus Deus Israel populo suo, et habitaculum Jerusalem usque in æternum.
verses.english: For David had declared: “The Lord God of Israel has given rest to His people, and His dwelling place is in Jerusalem forever.”

verses.latin: Nec Levitis ultra foret necesse asportare tabernaculum, et omnia vasa ejus opera ministrorum.
verses.english: Therefore, it would no longer be necessary for the Levites to carry the tabernacle and all its vessels—which were the instruments of their service.

verses.latin: A numeris enim David novissimis, et viginti annorum, et supra, sunt filii Levi.
verses.english: For according to David’s most recent count, the sons of Levi were those aged twenty years and older.

verses.latin: Et stabunt sub manu filiorum Aaron in cultum domus Domini, in vestibulis, et in exedris, et in cœnaculis, et in interioribus, et in propitiatoriis, et in universis vasis ministerii ædis Domini.
verses.english: And they are to stand under the authority of the sons of Aaron for the service of the Lord’s house, in the courtyards, and in the chambers, and in the upper rooms, and in the inner sanctuaries, and at the mercy seat, and with all the vessels for the service of the Lord’s Temple.

verses.latin: Et panum propositionis, et similæ ad sacrificium, et laganorum azymorum, et frixorum, et in sartagine, et omnis ponderis, ac mensuræ.
verses.english: They are also responsible for the showbread, and the fine flour for the sacrifice, and the unleavened cakes, and that which is baked in the pan, and that which is fried, and for every weight and measure.

verses.latin: Et ut stent mane ad laudandum et confitendum Domino: similiter et vespere,
verses.english: And they are to stand every morning to praise and give thanks to the Lord, and likewise in the evening.

verses.latin: tam in oblatione holocaustorum Domini, quam in sabbatis, et calendis, et ceteris solemnitatibus, juxta numerum et cæremonias uniuscujusque semper coram Domino.
verses.english: They are to assist with the offering of the Lord’s burnt offerings, as well as on the Sabbaths, and at the new moons, and at all other solemn feast days, according to the prescribed number and ceremonies for each, always before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et custodiant excubias tabernaculi testimonii, et excubias sanctuarii, et excubias filiorum Aaron fratrum suorum, ut serviant in ædibus Domini.
verses.english: And they are to guard the watch of the tabernacle of testimony, and the watch of the sanctuary, and the watch of their brethren, the sons of Aaron, so that they may serve in the houses of the Lord.

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii Caath per familias suas, duces familiarum Amram, et Jesaar, et Hebron, et Oziel.
verses.english: These are the sons of Kohath by their families: the chiefs of the families of Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

verses.latin: Filii Merari per familias suas, duces familiarum Maheli, et Musi. Et isti sunt filii Levi per familias suas.
verses.english: The sons of Merari by their families were the chiefs of the families of Mahli and Mushi. And these are the sons of Levi by their families.

verses.latin: Et dux Eleazar sacerdos: et dux Cis.
verses.english: And Eleazar was the chief priest, and Kish was also a chief.

verses.latin: Fuitque Eleazar pontifex, et filii ejus: Et pontifex in locum ejus filius ejus. Et filii Caath per familias suas.
verses.english: Eleazar was the high priest, and his sons held the priesthood after him. And his son became high priest in his place. And these were the sons of Kohath by their families.

verses.latin: Filii Amram, et Jesaar, et Hebron, et Oziel.
verses.english: The sons of Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

verses.latin: Filii Gersom, Ledan, et Semei.
verses.english: The sons of Gershon were Ladan and Shimei.

verses.latin: Filii Merari, Maheli, et Musi.
verses.english: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi.

verses.latin: Omnes Levitae per familias suas, et per domos patrum suorum, in capitibus suis, et in numero suo, ab annis triginta et supra, usque ad quinquaginta annos. Ministrantes in domibus Domini, et omnes labores operis ministrorum, et tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: All the Levites, by their families and by their fathers' households, according to their divisions and their total number, from thirty years of age and older, up to fifty years of age, were serving in the houses of the Lord, performing all the labor of the ministers' work, and the service of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.latin: Filii autem Aaron, haec erant divisiones eorum: filii Aaron, Nadab et Abiu, Eleazar et Ithamar.
verses.english: Now, these were the assigned divisions for the sons of Aaron. The original sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

verses.latin: Mortui sunt autem Nadab et Abiu ante patrem suum absque liberis: et sacerdotio functi sunt Eleazar et Ithamar.
verses.english: However, Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and they had no children. So, Eleazar and Ithamar were the ones who carried out the duties of the priesthood.

verses.latin: Et divisit eos David, et Sadoc de filiis Eleazar, et Ahimelech de filiis Ithamar, secundum vices suas et ministerium suum.
verses.english: King David, along with Zadok from the lineage of Eleazar, and Ahimelech from the lineage of Ithamar, then organized these priestly families. He established their specific courses of service and their particular duties within the ministry.

verses.latin: Inventi sunt ergo multo plures filii Eleazar in principibus viris, quam filii Ithamar: et divisit eos, id est, filios Eleazar, principes familiarum sedecim: et filios Ithamar, per familias suas octo.
verses.english: It was discovered that the descendants of Eleazar had many more leading men than the descendants of Ithamar. Therefore, King David assigned sixteen family heads from the sons of Eleazar and eight family heads from the sons of Ithamar, according to their respective family lines.

verses.latin: Divisitque eos per vices suas, tam hos quam illos: plures enim inventi sunt principes in filiis Eleazar, et potentes viri.
verses.english: David then organized their courses of service by lot, treating both groups equally. However, more leading men and mighty warriors were found among the descendants of Eleazar, so their courses were more numerous.

verses.latin: Descripsitque eos Semeias filius Nathanael scriba de genere Levi, coram rege et principibus, et Sadoc sacerdote, et Ahimelech filio Abiathar, principibus quoque familiarum sacerdotalium et Leviticarum: unam domum, quae cæteris præerat, Eleazari: et alteram Ithamar.
verses.english: Shemaiah, son of Nethaneel, a Levite scribe, recorded them in the presence of the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the priestly and Levite families. He recorded one leading family line from Eleazar, and another leading family line from Ithamar.

verses.latin: Exiitque sors prima Jojarib, secunda Jedaia.
verses.english: The first lot drawn was for Jehoiarib, the second for Jedaiah.

verses.latin: Tertia Harim, quarta Seorim.
verses.english: The third was for Harim, the fourth for Seorim.

verses.latin: Quinta Melchia, sexta Maamin.
verses.english: The fifth was for Malchijah, the sixth for Mijamin.

verses.latin: Septima Accos, octava Abia.
verses.english: The seventh was for Hakkoz, the eighth for Abijah.

verses.latin: Nona Jesua, decima Sechenia.
verses.english: The ninth was for Jeshua, the tenth for Shecaniah.

verses.latin: Undecima Eliasib, duodecima Jacim.
verses.english: The eleventh was for Eliashib, the twelfth for Jakim.

verses.latin: Decimatertia Huppa, decimacquarta Isbaab.
verses.english: The thirteenth was for Huppah, the fourteenth for Jeshebeab.

verses.latin: Decimaquinta Belga, decimasexta Emmer.
verses.english: The fifteenth was for Bilgah, the sixteenth for Immer.

verses.latin: Decimaseptima Hezir, decimavoctava Aphses.
verses.english: The seventeenth was for Hezir, the eighteenth for Happizzez.

verses.latin: Decimanona Pheteia, vigesima Hezechiel.
verses.english: The nineteenth was for Pethahiah, the twentieth for Jehezkel.

verses.latin: Vigesima prima Jachin, vigesima secunda Gamul.
verses.english: The twenty-first was for Jachin, the twenty-second for Gamul.

verses.latin: Vigesima tertia Dalaiau, vigesima quarta Maaziau.
verses.english: The twenty-third was for Delaiah, the twenty-fourth for Maaziah.

verses.latin: Hæ sunt vices eorum secundum ministeria sua, cum ingrediebantur domum Domini, et juxta præceptum Aaron patris sui, sicut præceperat Dominus Deus Israël.
verses.english: These were their ordered courses of service when they went into the House of the Lord. They followed the directions of Aaron their father, just as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.

verses.latin: Porro filiorum Levi reliqui: de filiis Amram, Subael: et de filiis Subael, Jehedeia.
verses.english: Now, concerning the remaining descendants of Levi: from the sons of Amram, there was Shubael. From the sons of Shubael, there was Jehdeiah.

verses.latin: De filiis quoque Rohobia, Issia princeps.
verses.english: From the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah was the chief.

verses.latin: De Isaari, Salemoth: de filiis Salemoth, Jaath.
verses.english: From the Izharites, there was Shelomith. From the sons of Shelomith, there was Jahath.

verses.latin: Hic filius ejus Amram, et Isaar, Jeheth, et Bari. Et filii Ozihel, Micha: filii Micha, Samir.
verses.english: His son was Amram, and Izhar, and Jehath, and Beriah. And the sons of Uzziel were Micah, and the sons of Micah were Shamir.

verses.latin: Frater Micha, Jesia: et filii Jesiæ, Zacharias.
verses.english: Micah's brother was Isshiah. And the sons of Isshiah were Zechariah.

verses.latin: Filii Merari, Moholi et Musi: filii Oziau, Benno.
verses.english: The sons of Merari were Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Jaaziah were Beno.

verses.latin: Filii quoque Merari, Oziau et Soham, et Zaccur, et Abri.
verses.english: The other sons of Merari were Jaaziah, Shoham, Zaccur, and Ibri.

verses.latin: Filii Moholi, Eleazar, qui non habuit filios.
verses.english: The sons of Mahli were Eleazar, who had no sons.

verses.latin: Et filii Cis, Jerameel.
verses.english: And the sons of Kish were Jerahmeel.

verses.latin: Filii Musi, Moholi, Eder, et Jerimoth. Hi filii Levi secundum domos familiarum suarum.
verses.english: The sons of Mushi were Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of Levi according to their family lines.

verses.latin: Præposuitque eos David et principes sacerdotum, Sadoc et Ahimelech, et principes familiarum Leviticarum, per vices suas in ministerio, ut essent in domo Domini.
verses.english: King David, along with Zadok, Ahimelech the chief priest, and the heads of the Levite families, appointed these individuals for their courses of service. They were designated to minister in the House of the Lord.

verses.latin: Miserunt autem et ipsi sortes ex adverso fratrum suorum filiorum Aaron coram David rege, et Sadoc, et Ahimelech, et principibus familiarum sacerdotalium et Leviticarum. Tam cognatus quam non cognatus, æquali sorte dividebantur.
verses.english: They also cast lots for their courses of service, just as their brothers, the sons of Aaron, had done. This was done in the presence of King David, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the priestly and Levite families. Both relatives and non-relatives were assigned their duties by lot, ensuring an equal and impartial distribution of roles.

verses.latin: Igitur David et principes exercitus separaverunt in ministerium filios Asaph, et Heman, et Idithun, qui prophetarent in citharis, et psalteriis, et cymbalis, juxta numerum suum.
verses.english: So David and the commanders of the army set apart the sons of Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun for a sacred service. These were to proclaim God's message using harps, lyres, and cymbals, according to the total number appointed.

verses.latin: De Asaph: Zachur, et Joseph, et Nathania, et Azarela, filii Asaph: sub manu Asaph prophetantis juxta præceptum regis.
verses.english: From the sons of Asaph were Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asharelah. These were under the direction of Asaph, who was proclaiming God's message according to the king's command.

verses.latin: Porro Idithun: Godoliam, Suffi, et Jesei, et Hasabiam, et Mathathiam, Semeiam, sex sub manibus patris sui Idithun, qui in cithara prophetabat in confessione et laudibus Domini.
verses.english: For Jeduthun, there were six sons: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, Mattithiah, and Shemei. They were all under the direction of their father Jeduthun, who proclaimed God's message with the harp, in giving thanks and praises to the Lord.

verses.latin: De Heman: Bucchiam, Mathaniam, Oziel, Subuel, et Jerimoth, Hananiam, Hanani, Eliatha, Geddelthi, et Romemthi, Ezer, Jesbocasa, Mellothi, Othir, et Mahazioth:
verses.english: From Heman were Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth.

verses.latin: Omnes hii, filii Heman filii regis in sermonibus Dei, ut exaltaret cornu: et dedit Deus Heman filios quatuordecim, et filias tres.
verses.english: All these were the sons of Heman, who, as royal officials for God's message, were to lift up the horn of triumph in their service. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.

verses.latin: Omnes hii sub manu patrum suorum ad cantandum in templo Domini, in cymbalis, et psalteriis, et citharis, ad ministerium domus Domini, secundum regis præceptum: Asaph, Idithun, et Heman.
verses.english: All these musicians were under the direction of their fathers for singing in the Temple of the Lord, using cymbals, lyres, and harps. This was all for the sacred service of the Lord's house, according to the king's command, set by Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman.

verses.latin: Fuit autem numerus eorum, cum fratribus suis, qui erudiebantur et cantabant Domino, omnes intellegentes, ducentorum octoginta octo.
verses.english: The total number of these musicians, along with their kinsmen who were being trained and who sang to the Lord, all of them skilled and understanding in their craft, was two hundred and eighty-eight.

verses.latin: Miserunt quoque sortes per vices suas, tam minores quam majores, docti pariter et indocti.
verses.english: They also cast lots to determine their divisions of service, involving both the younger and the older members, and including both the skilled and those still in training.

verses.latin: Et cecidit sors prima Asaph Joseph: secundo Godoliæ, ipsi et filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The first lot fell to Joseph, of the lineage of Asaph. The second lot went to Gedaliah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve in his division.

verses.latin: Tertio Zachur, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The third lot went to Zaccur, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Quarto Izri, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The fourth lot went to Zeri, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Quinto Nathaniæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The fifth lot went to Nethaniah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Sexto Bucchias, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The sixth lot went to Bukkiah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Septimo Jeseï, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The seventh lot went to Jeshaiah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Octavo Isaiæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The eighth lot went to Isaiah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Nono Mathaniæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The ninth lot went to Mattaniah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Decimo Semeiæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The tenth lot went to Shemei, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Undecimo Azarel, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The eleventh lot went to Asharelah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Duodecimo Hasabiæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The twelfth lot went to Hashabiah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Tertio decimo Subuel, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The thirteenth lot went to Shebuel, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Quarto decimo Mathathiæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The fourteenth lot went to Mattithiah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Quinto decimo Jerimoth, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The fifteenth lot went to Jerimoth, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Sexto decimo Hananiæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The sixteenth lot went to Hananiah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Septimo decimo Jesbocasæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The seventeenth lot went to Joshbekashah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Duodevicesimo Anani, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The eighteenth lot went to Hanani, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Nono decimo Mellothi, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The nineteenth lot went to Mallothi, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Vicesimo Eliathæ, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The twentieth lot went to Eliathah, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Vicesimo primo Othir, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The twenty-first lot went to Hothir, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Vicesimo secundo Geddelthi, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The twenty-second lot went to Giddalti, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Vicesimo tertio Mahazioth, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim:
verses.english: The twenty-third lot went to Mahazioth, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Vicesimo quarto Romemthi Ezer, filiis et fratribus ejus duodecim.
verses.english: The twenty-fourth lot went to Romamti-ezer, who, along with his sons and kinsmen, numbered twelve.

verses.latin: Igitur per distinctiones portariorum: de Coritis Meselemia filius Core de filiis Asaph.
verses.english: So then, these were the appointed divisions of the gatekeepers: From the Korahites was Meshelemiah, the son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.

verses.latin: Filii autem Meselemiae: Zacharias primogenitus, Jadihel secundus, Zabadias tertius, Jathanael quartus,
verses.english: Meshelemiah had sons: Zachariah, the firstborn; Jediael, the second; Zebadiah, the third; Jathanael, the fourth;

verses.latin: Elam quintus, Johanan sextus, Elionas septimus.
verses.english: Elam, the fifth; Johanan, the sixth; and Elioenai, the seventh.

verses.latin: Filii vero Obededom: Semeias primogenitus, Jozabad secundus, Joah tertius, Sachar quartus, Nathanael quintus,
verses.english: The sons of Obed-Edom were Shemaiah, the firstborn; Jehozabad, the second; Joah, the third; Sacar, the fourth; Nathanael, the fifth;

verses.latin: Ammiel sextus, Issachar septimus, Phaullathi octavus: quia benedixit illi Dominus.
verses.english: Ammiel, the sixth; Issachar, the seventh; and Peulthai, the eighth. All these were because the Lord had blessed him.

verses.latin: Et Semeiae filio ejus nati sunt filii principes familiarum suarum: quia viri fortissimi fuerunt.
verses.english: To his son Shemaiah, other sons were born who became heads of their families, because they were very strong men.

verses.latin: Filii ergo Semeiae: Othni, et Raphael, et Obed, Elizabad: et fratres ejus viri fortissimi, Eliu et Samachias.
verses.english: Therefore, the sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Raphaël, Obed, and Elzabad. His brothers, who were also very strong men, were Elihu and Semachiah.

verses.latin: Omnes hi de filiis Obededom: ipsi et filii, et fratres eorum, fortissimi ad ministrandum: sexaginta duo de Obededom.
verses.english: All these men were from the sons of Obed-Edom—they, their sons, and their brothers—all very strong and capable for service. There were sixty-two descendants from Obed-Edom.

verses.latin: Porro Meselemiae filii, et fratres eorum, viri fortissimi: decem et octo.
verses.english: Moreover, Meshelemiah's sons and their brothers were also very strong men, eighteen in total.

verses.latin: De Hosa autem, de filiis Merari, filii: Semri princeps (non enim habuerat primogenitum, et idcirco posuerat eum pater ejus principem),
verses.english: From Hosah, who was from the sons of Merari, were these sons: Shimri, the chief, whom his father had appointed as chief because he had no firstborn son;

verses.latin: Helcias secundus, Tebalias tertius, Zacharias quartus: omnes hi, et filii, et fratres Hosa, tredecim.
verses.english: Hilkiah, the second; Tebaliah, the third; and Zechariah, the fourth. All these, including Hosah's sons and brothers, numbered thirteen.

verses.latin: Harum distinctiones portariorum: principum virorum, habentium officia sua, ut ministrarent fratribus suis.
verses.english: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers: these leading men had their duties to minister to their brethren.

verses.latin: Et projecterunt sortes ex aequo et parvis et magnis per cognationes suas, pro singulis portis.
verses.english: They cast lots, fairly and equally, among the small and the great among their families, for each gate.

verses.latin: Cecidit ergo sors orientalis Selemiae. Porro Zachariae filio ejus (consiliario prudentissimo) et ipsi mittentes sortem, cecidit ad septentrionem.
verses.english: So the eastern lot fell to Shelemiah. Then for his son Zechariah (who was a very prudent counselor), they also cast lots, and his lot fell to the north.

verses.latin: Obededom vero ad meridiem: et filiis ejus, domus Asaph.
verses.english: Obed-Edom received the southern lot; and for his sons, the house of Asaph.

verses.latin: Hosae ad occidentem, per vicem sortis, in via scalae, per quam ascenditur: et porta porticuum.
verses.english: Hosah received the western lot, by the assigned turn of the lot, for the road leading up the ascent, and for the Shallecheth Gate.

verses.latin: Ad orientem vero Levitae sex, et ad septentrionem quatuor per diem: atque ad meridiem similiter quatuor per diem: et ubi thesauros condebant, duo et duo.
verses.english: To the east, there were six Levites; to the north, four each day; to the south, likewise four each day; and at the storehouse where the treasures were kept, two by two.

verses.latin: In Parbar quoque ad occidentem, quatuor in agmine, et duo ad Parbar.
verses.english: Also at Parbar, to the west, there were four on the highway and two at Parbar itself.

verses.latin: Hae sunt distinctiones portariorum filiorum Core et Merari.
verses.english: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers from the sons of Korah and Merari.

verses.latin: Porro Levitarum Achia praeerat thesauris domus Dei, et thesauris sanctorum.
verses.english: Moreover, among the Levites, Ahijah was in charge of the treasures of the house of God and the consecrated treasures.

verses.latin: Filii Ladani, filii Gerson: de Ladano capita familiarum Gersonitarum, et Cori.
verses.english: Concerning the sons of Laadan, sons of Gershon: from Laadan were the heads of the Gershonite families, and Cori.

verses.latin: Filii Hieheli: Zetham et Joel fratres ejus, erant super thesauros domus Domini.
verses.english: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham and his brother Joel, were in charge of the treasures of the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: De Amramitis, et Isaharitis, et Hebronitis, et Ozielitis.
verses.english: From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites.

verses.latin: Sub Amram filio Moysi, erat Subael princeps.
verses.english: Under Amram, the son of Moses, was Shubael, the chief.

verses.latin: Et fratres ejus: Eliezer, cujus filius Rahabia, et hujus filius Isaias, et hujus filius Joram, et hujus filius Zechri, et hujus filius Selemith.
verses.english: His brothers were Eliezer, whose son was Rehabiah; and his son was Jeshaiah; and his son was Joram; and his son was Zichri; and his son was Shelomith.

verses.latin: Ipse Selemith et fratres ejus super thesauros sanctorum, quae sanctificavit rex David, et principes familiarum, et tribuni, et centuriones, et duces exercitus.
verses.english: This Shelomith and his brothers were in charge of the consecrated treasures, which King David, the heads of families, the military commanders (tribunes and centurions), and the army leaders had consecrated.

verses.latin: De praeliis et manubiis consecratas.
verses.english: These were things consecrated from battles and plunder.

verses.latin: Et omnia quae sanctificaverat Samuel propheta, et Saul filius Cis, et Abner filius Ner, et Joab filius Sarviae: omnia sanctorum horum sub manu Selemith et fratrum ejus.
verses.english: And all things that Samuel the prophet had consecrated, and Saul, the son of Kish, and Abner, the son of Ner, and Joab, the son of Zeruiah: all these consecrated things were under the authority of Shelomith and his brothers.

verses.latin: De Isaharitis, Chonenias et filii ejus ad opera forinseca super Israel, ut docerent et judicarent.
verses.english: From the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were appointed for external duties over Israel, to teach and to judge.

verses.latin: De Hebronitis, Hasabias et fratres ejus viri fortissimi, mille septingenti, praeerant Israëli trans Jordanem contra occidentem, in omni opere Domini, et in ministerium regis.
verses.english: From the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, strong men numbering one thousand seven hundred, were in charge of Israel west of the Jordan, for all the work of the Lord and for the service of the king.

verses.latin: Porro de Hebronitis Jeria princeps, secundum cognationes et familias eorum. Anno quadragesimo regni David, recensiti sunt, et inventi sunt viri fortissimi in Jazer Galaad.
verses.english: Moreover, from the Hebronites, Jeriah was the chief, according to their genealogies and families. In the fortieth year of David's reign, they were counted, and very strong men were found among them in Jazer of Gilead.

verses.latin: Et fratres ejus viri fortissimi, duo millia septingenti, principes familiarum: quos constituit David rex super Rubenitas, et Gadditas, et dimidiam tribum Manasse, in omnia quae ad Deum, et ad regem pertinent.
verses.english: His brothers, also very strong men, numbered two thousand seven hundred, heads of families. King David appointed them over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for everything pertaining to God and to the king.

verses.latin: Filii autem Israël secundum numerum suum, principes familiarum, tribuni et centuriones, et præfecti, qui ministrabant regi juxta turmas suas, ingrediebantur et egrediebantur per singulos menses in anno, sub singulis principibus, qui erant viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: Now, for the people of Israel, according to the official count of their people, the family leaders, the military commanders (of thousands and hundreds), and other officers who served the king in their assigned divisions, these groups were assigned to serve by taking turns, going in and out, for each month of the year, under individual leaders. Each of these service groups had twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: super primam turmam in mense primo Jesboam filius Zabdiel erat : et sub eo viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: Over the first division, for the first month, was Jasobaam, the son of Zabdiel. Under him were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: De filiis Phares, princeps omnium principum in exercitu mense primo.
verses.english: He was from the sons of Phares (a son of Judah), and he was the chief of all the commanders in the army for that first month.

verses.latin: Super secundam turmam mensis secundi, Dodia Ahohites, et alter ex parte sua princeps, Abbat ; et in turma ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: Over the second division for the second month was Dodai the Ahohite. And another commander of his division, named Abbat, served with him. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Tertius imperator exercitus in mense tertio, Banaias filius Jojadæ sacerdotis : et in divisione sua viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The third commander of the army, for the third month, was Banaias, the son of Joiada the priest. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Ipse est Banaias fortissimus inter triginta, et super triginta : et Amizabad filius ejus præpositus divisionis ipsius.
verses.english: This Banaias was the strongest among the thirty mighty men, and he was chief over them. And Amizabad, his son, was the appointed leader of this division.

verses.latin: Quartus, in mense quarto, Asaël frater Joab, et Zabadias filius ejus post eum : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The fourth commander, for the fourth month, was Asahel, the brother of Joab. After Asahel's death, his son Zabadias took his place. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Quintus, in mense quinto, princeps Samhuth Israhites : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The fifth commander, for the fifth month, was the chief Samhuth the Israhite. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Sextus, in mense sexto, Ira filius Acces Thecuites : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The sixth commander, for the sixth month, was Ira, the son of Acces the Thecuite. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Septimus, in mense septimo, Heles Phallonites de filiis Ephraim : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The seventh commander, for the seventh month, was Heles the Phallonite, from the sons of Ephraim. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Octavus, in mense octavo, Sobochai Husathites de stirpe Zarahi : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The eighth commander, for the eighth month, was Sobochai the Husathite, from the lineage of Zarahi. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Nonus, in mense nono, Abiezer Anathothites de filiis Jemini : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The ninth commander, for the ninth month, was Abiezer the Anathothite, from the sons of Jemini (meaning Benjamin). And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Decimus, in mense decimo, Maharai Nethophathites de stirpe Zarahi : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The tenth commander, for the tenth month, was Maharai the Nethophathite, from the lineage of Zarahi. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Undecimus, in mense undecimo, Banaias Pharathonites de filiis Ephraim : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The eleventh commander, for the eleventh month, was Banaias the Pharathonite, from the sons of Ephraim. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Duodecimus, in mense duodecimo, Holdai Nethophathites de stirpe Othoniel : et in divisione ejus viginti quatuor millia.
verses.english: The twelfth commander, for the twelfth month, was Holdai the Nethophathite, from the lineage of Othoniel. And in his division were twenty-four thousand men.

verses.latin: Super tribus autem Israël, principes erant hi : Rubenitis, præpositus Eliezer filius Zechri : Simeonitis, Saphatias filius Maacha :
verses.english: Now, concerning the tribes of Israel, these were their leaders: For the Rubenites, Eliezer, the son of Zechri, was the appointed chief. For the Simeonites, Saphatias, the son of Maacha, was the chief.

verses.latin: Levitis, Hasabias filius Camuel : Aäronitis, Sadoc :
verses.english: For the Levites, Hasabias, the son of Camuel, was the chief. For the Aäronites (meaning the priests descended from Aaron), Sadoc was the chief.

verses.latin: Judæ, Eliu filius David : Issachar, Amri filius Michael :
verses.english: For Judah, Eliu, who was a son of David himself, was the chief. For Issachar, Amri, the son of Michael, was the chief.

verses.latin: Zabulonitis, Ismaias filius Abdiae : Nephthali, Jerimoth filius Ozriel :
verses.english: For the Zabulonites, Ismaias, the son of Abdias, was the chief. For Nephthali, Jerimoth, the son of Ozriel, was the chief.

verses.latin: Filiorum Ephraim, Osee filius Ozaziu : dimidiæ tribus Manasse, Joël filius Phadaia :
verses.english: For the sons of Ephraim, Osee, the son of Ozaziu, was the chief. For the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joël, the son of Phadaia, was the chief.

verses.latin: Dimidiae tribus Manasse in Galaad, Addo filius Zachariæ : Benjamin, Jasiel filius Abner :
verses.english: For the half-tribe of Manasseh in Galaad, Addo, the son of Zacharias, was the chief. For Benjamin, Jasiel, the son of Abner, was the chief.

verses.latin: Dan, Azareël filius Jeroam : hi principes filiorum Israël.
verses.english: For Dan, Azareël, the son of Jeroam, was the chief. These were the leaders for the sons of Israel.

verses.latin: Voluit autem David numerare eos a viginti annis et infra : quia dixerat Dominus ut multiplicaret Israël quasi stellas cæli.
verses.english: Now, King David did not want to include those twenty years old and under in his census, because the Lord had said that He would multiply Israel like the stars of the universe.

verses.latin: Joab filius Sarviæ cœperat numerare, et non complevit : iratusque est propter hoc Dominus contra Israël, et idcirco numerus non est relatus in libro Paralipomenon regis David.
verses.english: Joab, the son of Sarvia, had begun to take the census, but he did not complete it. Because of this, the Lord became angry with Israel, and for that reason, the total number was not included in the Book of the Paralipomenon (Chronicles) of King David.

verses.latin: Super thesauros autem regis, Azmoth filius Adiel : his autem thesauris qui erant in urbibus, et in vicis, et in turribus, Jonathas filius Oziæ præsidebat.
verses.english: Over the king's treasuries was Azmoth, the son of Adiel. And over the treasuries that were in the cities, and in the villages, and in the towers, Jonathas, the son of Ozias, presided.

verses.latin: Super operarios agri, et agricolas, qui exercebant terram, Ezri filius Chelub.
verses.english: Over the field workers and the farmers who tilled the land was Ezri, the son of Chelub.

verses.latin: Super vineas, Semeias Romathites : super statumina quoque et cellas vinarias, Zabdi Siphmites.
verses.english: Over the vineyards was Semeias the Romathite. Over the produce of the vineyards and the wine cellars was Zabdi the Siphmites.

verses.latin: Super oliveta et ficeta, quæ erant in campestribus, Balanan Gederites : super acervos autem olei, Joas.
verses.english: Over the olive groves and fig trees, which were in the lowlands, was Balanan the Gederite. Over the stores of oil was Joas.

verses.latin: Super armenta quoque quæ pascebantur in Sarone, Sareth Sarones : et super pecora in vallibus, Saphat filius Addai.
verses.english: Over the herds of cattle that pastured in Saron was Sareth the Saronite. And over the livestock in the valleys was Saphat, the son of Addai.

verses.latin: Super camelos, Obil Ismahelites : et super asinos, Jadai Meronathites.
verses.english: Over the camels was Obil the Ismahelite. And over the donkeys was Jadai the Meronathite.

verses.latin: Super oves quoque, Jaziz Agarenus : omnes hi principes substantiæ regis David.
verses.english: Over the flocks of sheep was Jaziz the Agarenus. All these were the chief officers over the property of King David.

verses.latin: Jonathas autem consobrinus David, consiliarius, vir prudens et litteratus : ipse et Jahiel filius Hachamoni erant cum filiis regis.
verses.english: Now, Jonathas, David's nephew, was a wise and learned counselor. He, along with Jahiel, the son of Hachamoni, were with the king's sons.

verses.latin: Achitophel etiam consiliarius regis : et Chusai Arachites amicus regis.
verses.english: Achitophel was also a counselor to the king. And Chusai the Arachite was the king's trusted friend.

verses.latin: Et post Achitophel, Jojada filius Banaiæ, et Abiathar : princeps autem exercitus regis, Joab.
verses.english: And after Achitophel's influence declined, Jojada, the son of Banaias, and Abiathar became counselors. Now, the chief commander of the king's army was Joab.

verses.latin: Congregavit autem David omnes principes Israel, principes tribuum, et praepositos turmarum, qui ministrabant regi, tribunis quoque, et centurionibus, et praefectis eorum, qui possidebant substantiam regis, et filios suos cum eunuchis, et potentes, et omnem virum fortem in Jerusalem.
verses.english: King David gathered all the leaders of Israel: the heads of the tribes, the officers of the military divisions who served the king, and the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds. He also called the overseers of those who managed the king’s possessions, and all of his sons. With them were the royal court officials, the mighty men, and every brave warrior in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Cumque surrexisset rex David, stetit, et ait: Audite me, fratres mei, et populus meus: cogitavi ut aedificarem domum requiei arcae foederis Domini, et scabelli pedum Dei nostri: et ad aedificandum omnia paravi.
verses.english: Then King David rose to his feet and said, "Listen to me, my brothers, and all my people. I had planned in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord, which is the footstool of our God. And I had prepared everything necessary for this building."

verses.latin: Sed Deus dixit mihi: Non aedificabis domum nomini meo, eo quod sis vir bellicosus, et sanguinem fuderis.
verses.english: But God said to me, "You shall not build a house for My Name, because you are a man of war and have shed much blood."

verses.latin: Dominus autem Deus Israel elegit me de universa domo patris mei, ut essem rex super Israel in sempiternum: de Juda enim elegit principes: et de domo Juda, domum patris mei: et de filiis patris mei, me unum elegit, ut super omnem Israel regem me constitueret.
verses.english: However, the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from all the house of my father to be king over Israel forever. For He chose Judah to be the leading tribe, and from the house of Judah, He chose my father’s house. Then, from among the sons of my father, He chose me alone to make me king over all the people of Israel.

verses.latin: Sed et de filiis meis (multos enim filios dedit mihi Dominus) elegit Salomonem filium meum, ut sederet in throno regni Domini super Israel.
verses.english: And from among my own sons (for the Lord has given me many sons), He chose Solomon, my son, to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Salomon filius tuus aedificabit domum meam, et atria mea: ipsius enim elegi eum mihi in filium, et ego ero illi in patrem.
verses.english: And He said to me, "Solomon your son shall build My house and My courts, where My presence will dwell. For I have chosen him for Myself to be My son, and I will be a Father to him."

verses.latin: Et firmabo regnum ejus usque in aeternum, si perseveraverit facere praecepta mea, et judicia mea, sicut et hodie.
verses.english: I will establish his kingdom forever, if he continues to keep My commandments and My judgments, just as he does today.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo coram universo coetu Israel, audiente Deo nostro, custodite, et quaerite omnes mandata Domini Dei nostri: ut possideatis terram bonam, et tradatis eam filiis vestris post vos sempiternam.
verses.english: Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, which is the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of the Lord our God. Do this so that you may possess this good land and leave it as an inheritance to your children after you, forever.

verses.latin: Tu autem Salomon fili mi, scito Deum patris tui, et servi illi corde perfecto, et animo voluntario: omnia enim corda scrutatur Dominus, et omnes cogitationes mentium intelligit. Si quaesieris eum, invenies: si autem dereliqueris, projiciet te in aeternum.
verses.english: And you, Solomon, my son, know the God of your father, and serve Him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind. For the Lord searches all hearts and understands every thought and intention of the mind. If you seek Him, you will find Him. But if you forsake Him, He will cast you off forever.

verses.latin: Vide nunc, quoniam elegit te Dominus ut aedificares domum sanctuarii, et sis fortis, et facias.
verses.english: See now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a house for His sanctuary. Therefore, be strong and do what He has called you to do.

verses.latin: Dedit ergo David Salomoni filio suo descriptionem porticus, et templi, et gazophylaciorum, et coenaculorum, et camerarum interiorum, et domus propitiationis,
verses.english: Then David gave Solomon his son the complete architectural plan for the porch, and for the temple structure itself, including its treasuries, its upper rooms, its inner chambers, and the house of the mercy seat (the Holy of Holies).

verses.latin: necnon et omnium quae cogitaverat, et fecerat in Spiritu, exemplaria. Atriorum quoque, et exedrarum per circuitum, in qua erant thesaura domus Domini, et thesaura sanctorum:
verses.english: He also gave him the plans for everything he had conceived and designed under divine inspiration from the Spirit of God. This included the plans for the courts, and for all the surrounding rooms where the treasures of the house of the Lord and the treasures of the holy things were kept.

verses.latin: Sed et divisionum sacerdotum et Levitarum, et cunctorum operum ministerii domus Domini, et omnium vasorum ministerii Templi.
verses.english: Furthermore, David provided the plans for the divisions of the priests and the Levites. These plans detailed all the work of the service of the house of the Lord and specified all the vessels required for the service of the Temple.

verses.latin: Pondus quoque ad seras aureas, et argenteas, atque ad omnia vasa operis et ministerii: Et in singulis vasis pondus, ad diversa ministeria.
verses.english: He also specified the precise weight for the golden and silver clasps, and for all the vessels to be used for the construction work and the sacred ministry. Additionally, he stipulated the weight for each individual vessel, considering its specific use in the various ministries of the Temple.

verses.latin: Pondus etiam ad candelabra aurea, et lucernas eorum aureas, ad diversas mensuras uniuscujusque candelabri, et lucernarum. Similiter et in candelabris argenteis, et lucernis eorum, pondus, et mensuram diversitatis, et usus uniuscujusque.
verses.english: David specified the weight for the golden lampstands and their golden lamps, precisely according to the various measurements of each lampstand and its corresponding lamps. Similarly, for the silver lampstands and their lamps, he laid out the weight and the precise measurements, detailing the diversity and specific use for each.

verses.latin: Pondus quoque in tabulis propositis aureis, et in argenteis:
verses.english: He specified the weight for the golden tables of the showbread and for the silver ones.

verses.latin: et in fuscinulis, et in phialis, et in cyathis aureis singulorum pondus: similiter et in argenteis vasis, librarum diversitatem pensavit.
verses.english: He gave the precise weight for each of the golden forks, bowls, and cups. Likewise, for the silver vessels, he carefully weighed and determined the different weights in pounds.

verses.latin: Et in altare thymiamatis aurum purissimum, et ad similitudinem currus cherubim, aureos expandit, extendentium alas, et tegentes arcam foederis Domini.
verses.english: And for the altar of incense, he specified pure gold. He also provided plans for the golden cherubim, whose wings would be spread out and cover the ark of the covenant of the Lord, giving the appearance of a divine chariot-throne.

verses.latin: Omnia in scriptis, ait, Dominus dedit mihi, et intelligere singula opera.
verses.english: "All these things," David said, "the Lord made me understand in writing, giving me insight into all the specific works and designs for the Temple."

verses.latin: Et ait David Salomoni filio suo: Viriliter age, et confortare, et fac: ne timeas, nec pavescas: Dominus enim Deus meus tecum est, et non dimittet te, nec derelinquet, donec perficias omne opus ministerii domus Domini.
verses.english: Then David said to Solomon his son, "Act with courage and be strong. Do not be afraid or discouraged, for the Lord my God is with you. He will not leave you nor abandon you until you have finished all the work for the service of the house of the Lord."

verses.latin: Ecce divisiones sacerdotum, et Levitarum in omni ministerio domus Domini, sunt tecum: et parabuntur tecum in omni opere ad promptissimum, quique sponte et toto animo parati sunt ad ministerium: in omne opus excubatores et sapientes ex omni genere.
verses.english: "Look, the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the ministry of the house of the Lord are with you. They will be prepared to assist you in every work with the utmost readiness. There are also those who are ready and willing with their whole heart for the ministry. For every work, you will have skilled overseers and wise men from every craft."

verses.latin: Dixit autem rex David omni ecclesiæ: Salomon filius meus, quem unum elegit Deus, puer parvulus est et tenellus: opus quoque grande est: neque enim homini præparatur habitatio, sed Deo.
verses.english: King David then spoke to the entire assembly: "My son Solomon, whom God has uniquely chosen for this task, is a young boy and still tender. And the work is a great one, for this sacred dwelling is not being prepared for a man, but for God Himself."

verses.latin: Et ego ex omnibus viribus meis præparavi impensas domus Dei mei: aurum in vasa aurea, et argentum in argentea, æs in ænea, ferrum in ferrea, ligna in lignea: et lapides onychinos, et ad implendum cœtum, et lapides diversicolores, et omnem decoris præparationem: et marmor Parium plurimum.
verses.english: And I, with all my strength and resources, have diligently prepared the supplies for the house of my God: gold for objects of gold, silver for objects of silver, bronze for objects of bronze, iron for objects of iron, and wood for objects of wood. I have also prepared onyx stones and other precious stones for setting and inlaying, stones of various colors, and every kind of beautiful adornment, and a great deal of Parian marble.

verses.latin: Et ultra hæc, quæ obtuli pro domo Dei mei, de peculio meo aurum et argentum dedi in templa Dei mei, juxta id quod paraveram:
verses.english: And beyond these materials which I offered for the house of my God, from my own personal possessions I have given gold and silver for the sacred dwelling of my God, in addition to what I had already prepared.

verses.latin: tria millia talenta auri, et septem millia talenta argenti probatissimi, ad deaurandos parietes templi.
verses.english: This includes three thousand talents of pure gold, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, specifically for gilding the walls of the Temple.

verses.latin: Aurum in aurea, et argentum in argentea, et in omnem operam artificum manus tuæ. Et si quis sponte offert, impleat manum suam hodie Domino.
verses.english: Gold for gold items, silver for silver items, and for all the work requiring the hands of skilled craftsmen. And if anyone is willing to make a voluntary offering, let him consecrate his hand to the Lord today.

verses.latin: Polliciti sunt itaque principes familiarum, et proceres tribuum Israël, et tribuni, et centuriones, et principes operis regis.
verses.english: Therefore, the heads of the families, and the leaders of the tribes of Israel, and the commanders of thousands, and the commanders of hundreds, and the officials overseeing the king's work, all made their pledges.

verses.latin: Et dederunt in opera domus Domini auri talenta quinque millia, et solidos decem millia, et argenti talenta decem millia, et æris talenta decem et octo millia, ferri quoque centum millia talentorum.
verses.english: And for the work of the house of the Lord, they gave five thousand talents of gold, and ten thousand gold coins, and ten thousand talents of silver, and eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and also one hundred thousand talents of iron.

verses.latin: Et apud quemcumque inventi sunt lapides, dederunt in thesauros domus Domini, per manum Jahielis Gersonitis.
verses.english: And whoever possessed precious stones gave them into the treasuries of the house of the Lord, through the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.

verses.latin: Lætatusque est populus, cum vota sponte complerent, eo quod toto corde offerebant Domino: sed et David rex lætatus est gaudio magno.
verses.english: And the people rejoiced when they voluntarily fulfilled their vows, because they offered them to the Lord with a whole heart. King David also rejoiced with great joy.

verses.latin: Et benedixit Domino in conspectu universæ multitudinis, et ait: Benedictus es Domine Deus Israël patris nostri ab æterno in æternum.
verses.english: And he blessed the Lord in the presence of the entire multitude, and said: "Blessed are You, O Lord God of Israel, our Father, from eternity to eternity."

verses.latin: Tua est Domine magnificentia, et potentia, et gloria, atque victoria, et tibi laus: cuncta enim quæ in cælo sunt et in terra, tua sunt: tuum Domine regnum, et tu es super omnes principes.
verses.english: "Yours, O Lord, is the magnificence, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and to You belongs praise. For all things that are in the universe and on the earth are Yours. Yours, O Lord, is the kingdom, and You are supreme above all rulers."

verses.latin: Tuæ divitiæ, et tua est gloria: tu dominaris omnium. In manu tua virtus et potentia: in manu tua magnificare et firmare omnia.
verses.english: "Yours are riches, and Yours is glory. You rule over all things. In Your hand are strength and power. In Your hand is the ability to make all things great and to make all things strong."

verses.latin: Nunc igitur Deus noster, confitemur tibi, et laudamus nomen tuum inclytum.
verses.english: "Now therefore, our God, we confess to You, and we praise Your glorious name."

verses.latin: Quis ego et quis populus meus, ut possimus hæc tibi universa promittere? Tua sunt enim omnia: et quæ de manu tua accepimus, dedimus tibi.
verses.english: "Who am I, and who is my people, that we should be able to promise all these things to You? For all things are Yours. And what we have received from Your hand, we have given back to You."

verses.latin: Advenæ enim sumus coram te et peregrini, sicut omnes patres nostri. Dies nostri quasi umbra super terram, et nulla est mora.
verses.english: "For we are strangers and sojourners before You, just like all our fathers. Our days are like a shadow upon the earth, and there is no lasting permanence for us."

verses.latin: Domine Deus noster, omnis hæc copia quam paravimus ut ædificaretur domus nomini sancto tuo, de manu tua est: et tua sunt omnia.
verses.english: "O Lord our God, all this abundance that we have prepared to build a house for Your holy name, it comes from Your hand, and all things are Yours."

verses.latin: Scio Deus mi quod probes corda, et simplicitatem dilectionis. Ego quoque in simplicitate cordis mei lætus oblata sunt universa. Et populum tuum, qui hic repertus est, vidi cum ingenti gaudio tibi offerre munera.
verses.english: "I know, my God, that You test hearts and that You delight in sincerity. I also, in the sincerity of my heart, have gladly offered all these things. And I have seen Your people, who are gathered here, offering gifts to You with immense joy."

verses.latin: Domine Deus Abraham, et Isaac, et Israël patrum nostrorum, custodi in æternum hanc voluntatem cordis eorum, et permanentem cogitationem: et dirige corda eorum ad te.
verses.english: "O Lord God of Abraham, and Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, preserve this intention of their hearts forever, and their enduring thoughts. And direct their hearts always toward You."

verses.latin: Et Salomoni filio meo da cor perfectum ut custodiat mandata tua, testimonia tua, et cæremonias tuas: et faciat universa: et ædificet ædem cui paravi omnia.
verses.english: "And to my son Solomon, give a perfect heart, so that he may keep Your commandments, Your testimonies, and Your ceremonies, and that he may do all things, and build the sacred dwelling for which I have prepared everything."

verses.latin: Præcepit quoque David universæ ecclesiæ: Benedicite Domino Deo nostro. Et benedixit omnis ecclesia Domino Deo patrum suorum: et inclinaverunt se, et adoraverunt Deum, regemque.
verses.english: Then David commanded the entire assembly: "Bless the Lord our God!" And the entire assembly blessed the Lord God of their fathers, and they bowed down and adored God, and also the king, showing respect.

verses.latin: Et immolaverunt victimas Domino: et obtulerunt holocausta die altera post hæc, tauros mille, arietes mille, agnos mille cum libaminibus suis, et cæremonias plurimas pro omni Israël.
verses.english: And they offered sacrifices to the Lord: and they presented burnt offerings on the following day after these events—a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, a thousand lambs with their drink offerings, and many other sacred ceremonies for all of Israel.

verses.latin: Et comederunt, et biberunt coram Domino in lætitia magna in die illo: et unxerunt secundo Salomonem filium David. Et unxerunt eum Domino in principem, et Sadoc in pontificem.
verses.english: And they ate and drank before the Lord with great joy on that day. And they anointed Solomon, David’s son, a second time. And they anointed him to the Lord as their ruler, and Zadok as the chief priest.

verses.latin: Sedit itaque Salomon super solium Domini in regem pro David patre suo, et cunctis placuit: et obedivit ei omnis Israël.
verses.english: So Solomon sat upon the throne of the Lord as king in place of David his father, and he pleased everyone, and all Israel obeyed him.

verses.latin: Sed et omnes principes, et potentes, et cuncti filii regis David dederunt manum, et subjecti fuerunt Salomoni regi.
verses.english: Furthermore, all the princes and powerful men, and all the sons of King David, pledged their allegiance and subjected themselves to King Solomon.

verses.latin: Magnificavit ergo Dominus Salomonem supra omnem Israël: et dedit illi gloriam regni, qualem habuit nullus ante eum rex Israël.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord greatly magnified Solomon above all Israel and gave him such royal glory as no king in Israel before him had possessed.

verses.latin: Igitur David filius Isai regnavit super universum Israël.
verses.english: So David, the son of Jesse, reigned over all Israel.

verses.latin: Dies autem quibus regnavit super Israël, fuerunt quadraginta anni: in Hebron regnavit septem annis, et in Jerusalem annis triginta tribus.
verses.english: The days during which he reigned over Israel were forty years: in Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem thirty-three years.

verses.latin: Et mortuus est in senectute bona, plenus dierum, divitiarum, et gloriæ: et regnavit Salomon filius ejus pro eo.
verses.english: And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and glory. And Solomon his son reigned in his place.

verses.latin: Acta autem regis David priora et novissima scripta sunt in libris Samuelis videntis, et in libris Nathan prophetæ, atque in libris Gad videntis:
verses.english: Now the acts of King David, from the earliest to the latest, are written in the books of Samuel the seer, and in the books of Nathan the prophet, and in the books of Gad the seer.

verses.latin: Universi quoque regni ejus, et fortitudinis, et temporum quæ transierunt sub eo, sive in Israël, sive in cunctis regnis terrarum.
verses.english: They record all the details of his reign, his strength, and the times that passed under him, both in Israel and in all the kingdoms of the lands around them.
